209501.name: Kengo
boardgameartist: フジオカ　アデリ (Aderi Fujioka)
209501.description:
User summary

A vs tactical card game for 2 players. Players choose two fighting schools and have cards in hand with numbers. The cards need to be held in number order, and some of the cards might have to be revealed to the opponent; hence guessing what the other one has is part of the game. Players take turns playing cards and taking over threat foci, by cleverly choosing numbers on the cards that the opponent cannot counter.

The player to either deal 7 deadly wounds or 13 normal wounds to the opponent wins.

209502.name: Perpetual Life
209502.description:
Perpetual Life is a farming management worker placement game in which the players are to cultivate manafruits in order to develop the lands as much as possible. Each turn, the player chooses an action to perform, like getting seeds, watering the lands, harvesting, or leasing a machine. The more people who have chosen a specific action, the more beneficial it is to the latecomer.

When harvesting a fruit, the fruit may evolve into a more valuable fruit if it's adjacent to a specific other fruit. Also, having several fruits of the same sort adjacent to each other gives bonuses.

209503.name: Next Seven Days
boardgameartist: 藤井ルマンダー Rumanda Fujii
209503.description:
Next Seven Days is a solitaire card game representing the first week of the new world.

With a deck of various events, numbered 1–20, each with a special piece of story and effect, the player must discard some of the cards in order to play the cards they want. Cards must be played in a strict pyramidal form in seven layers, obeying the rules for numbering. The game is played in seven rounds, and if the player manages to create an unbroken line of increasing numbers from round one to seven, the week is complete. Points are awarded for achieving special goals.

209504.name: Let's throw away it all
209504.description: Let's throw away it all is a simplistic card game about throwing away trash. All players have cards numbered 1–7, and secretly decide what to discard. If no one else discards the same number, the player gains points. However, each round there are special numbers worth a lot of points, and other factors that affect the game. Penalties are given to players who discard the same number as another player.

209505.name: Star Fields
209505.description:
User Summary

A simple game in which you advance down a 3D 6 lane track, shooting certain shapes and avoiding getting hit by others.

209506.name: Terra Formars
209506.description:
In Terra Formars, based on the Terra Formars anime series, players take the role of the egotistical heroes sent to Mars to cleanse the humanoid cockroaches from the planet so that humans may settle the newly terraformed planet.

The game uses a combination of unique dice and cards to create a nice balance of resource management and backstabbing your friends. The seven unique dice create the resources each round to buy cards to enhance your character and steal kills from your opponents. In the end, the player who killed the highest priority targets wins.

209507.name: G.I. Germ Fighters: Base Camp
boardgamepodcastepisode: 28 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Boston FIG Tabletop games
209507.description:
DIRTY DUKE IS ON THE LOOSE! He has taken over the kitchen sponge and must be vanquished! Rally the Germ fighters from the town dump to fight the good fight and take back what has been unrighteously appropriated by the “Duke-ster”!

Base Camp is a 2 player card driven, board game. It is fast paced and meant to be played in 20-30 minutes sessions.

209508.name: Equipment's Weight
209508.description:
From the introduction:

This is a simple work detailing the total weights of several equipment packs. It was made to speed up the character creation process for people who [are] interested in using the Encumbrance rules.

User summary:

Rules compiled from published ("official") sources.

209509.name: Druid's Road
209509.description: As a druid, players must restore Purity back into the Drachnel Forest by casting Enchantments throughout various glades. There are 8 rounds in the game also known as Sabbats from the Celtic Wheel of the Year. During a turn a Druid must build a glade of the forest and then perform actions by himself or with the help of a summoned animal. Druids must try to Enchant a Glade to earn Spirit points. Glades that have less purity than others will earn more Spirit points. Each druid that creates a Triad (3 adjacent glades with their own enchantment) will score Spirit Points. Depending on the position of The Wheel of the Year, glade enchanting may prove difficult. Certain glades are also abundant with Druidic Magick; swiping other’s enchantments, using magical bursts, or summoning forest animals for assistance, to name a few. The more the game is played, players will come up with new strategies and new ideas on how to best earn Spirit. Each game will create a random layout of the forest, never knowing which glades will be present that game. And you never know what changing events the Drachnel Forest will unleash - so be certain to store up your Mind Power to use only when needed. The druid with the most Spirit Points after one year, wins!

209510.description: This is a set of 5 previously released promo tiles for Neuroshima Hex. It comes with a nice color printed rules.
209510.name: Neuroshima Hex! Żetony promocyjne – zestaw I

209511.description:
Atlanta Is Ours is the next game in the award-winning Great Campaigns of the American Civil War (GCACW) series. The two maps included are painted by original map artist Charlie Kibler. The military unit counters have been redesigned by Charlie Kibler to harken back to the counters in the original games in the series but with a more modern graphical treatment.

Atlanta Is Ours contains an updated version of the GCACW Standard Basic Game Rules that all the other games in the series use. The Advanced Game rules are also standardized so players will be able to move quickly from one campaign to the other.

Atlanta Is Ours includes fourteen Basic Game scenarios and five Advanced Game campaigns, all extensively playtested:

Basic Game Scenarios


The Opportunity of a Lifetime (Snake Creek Gap/Resaca (5/9/1864, 1 turn, small forces): Beginner’s scenario, great for learning how to play.
The Gap Is Blocked (5/8-5/10/1864, 3 turns): Hypothetical scenario, what could have happened if Sherman had not sent McPherson to Snake Creek Gap and instead attacked or tried to outflank other points in the Confederate defenses.
Battle of Resaca (5/14/1864; 1 turn): Sherman's entire army reinforces McPherson's corps outside Resaca, and attacks Johnston's army in Resaca, which has just arrived from its positions around Dalton.
From the Oostanaula to the Etowah (5/17-5/21/1864, 6 turns): Sweeping maneuver from one river to the other, with the aborted battle of Cassville near the end of the scenario. Includes special random events and optional limited intelligence.
Advance and Retreat (5/19-5/22/1864; 4 turns): Johnston's army attempts to attack a portion of Sherman's army while Sherman is advancing on a wide front. Hood aborts the attack as it is developing and falls back into a defensive line near Cassville.
The Hell Hole (5/25-5/28/1864; 4 turns): Sherman moves off the rail line to the west in an attempt to flank Johnston, but is stopped after several days of battle. This scenario encompasses the battles of Dallas, New Hope Church, and Pickett's Mill.
Kennesaw Mountain (6-22-6/27; 6 turns): This scenario covers the battles of Kolb’s Farm and Kennesaw Mountain.
Crossing the Chattahoochee (7/3-7/8/1864; 6 turns): Johnston retreats from Kennesaw Mountain and then Sherman breaches Johnston's line covering the bridges and fords of the Chattahoochee River.
Battle of Atlanta (7/20-7/221864; 3 turns): Hood (now in command of the CSA army) attacks portions of Sherman's army twice, at Peachtree Creek and Bald Hill, but is beaten back with heavy losses both times.
Ezra Church (7/28/1864; 1 turn; half armies): Hood sends two corps to block Howard (now commanding the Army of the Tennessee), who is attempting to move around Atlanta from the west; they stop Howard, but incur heavy casualties in their attacks.
Wheeler's Raid (8/10-8/15; 6 turns; solitaire cavalry scenario): Wheeler moves north to disrupt the Union supply line around Dalton; -Wheeler does minimal damage before being forced to retreat.
Kilpatrick's Raid (8/18-8/22/1864; 5 turns, cavalry scenario): Kilpatrick takes the Union cavalry south around Atlanta to Lovejoy's Station, but he does minimal damage and returns to Union lines.
Marching On Tara (8/28 - 9/2/1864; 6 turns): Sherman moves around the west flank of the Confederates and marches to the RR stations supplying Atlanta from the west and the south. The goal is to force the Confederates to fight outside the forts or abandon Atlanta. Tara is the fictional plantation in the movie Gone With The Wind, and is "located" a few miles from Jonesboro where the armies have their final battle.
Last Stand At Tara (8/31 - 9/2/1864; 3 turns): This scenario encompasses both the Confederate attack on the Union at Jonesboro and then the Confederate retreat and consolidation of their army at Lovejoy’s Station to the south on the RR line.



Advanced Game Scenarios


To The Chattahoochee (Advanced scenario, May-July 1864): This scenario covers Johnston's retreat and the Union advance from the initial lines at Dalton to near Atlanta.
The Real Game For Atlanta (Advanced scenario, July-Sept. 1864): This scenario encompasses Hood's attacks near the Atlanta forts and Sherman's maneuvering resulting in the Union capture of Atlanta.
The Atlanta Campaign (Advanced scenario, May-Sept 1864): A "grand campaign" linking the two above advanced scenarios.
The Hardest Knocks (Advanced scenario, May-July or Sept 1864): Alternative setups to the May campaign startup.
Without Home Or Habitation (Advanced scenario, Sept – Oct 1864): After the fall of Atlanta, Hood heads north to cut Sherman’s rail line. Union forces pursue.



Contents


GCACW Series Rules Booklet (28 pgs, black and white; downloadable in color; or you can use the color rules booklet that comes in Stonewall Jackson's Way II)
AIO Specific Rules Booklet (100 pgs in color including scenarios, the game as history, map gazetteer, etc)
Two 22"x 32" full-color map sheets (preview).
Three 280-piece counter sheets
One Terrain Effects Chart
Two full-color Force Displays
One Off-Map Display
Two 4-page color Charts and Tables
Two 6-sided Dice



Credits

Design & Development: Ed Beach, Mike Belles, and Chris Withers
Original series design by Joseph M. Balkoski
Map Artwork by Charlie Kibler
Counter Graphics by Charlie Kibler and Nicolás Eskubi
209511.name: Atlanta Is Ours
boardgamefamily: Great Campaigns of the American Civil War

209512.name: Lure of the Serpent, Part 1
209512.description:
From the introduction:

Some time ago now, a band of highly intelligent Yuan-Ti that inhabit an island some way from "civilisation" made a startling discovery. The amulet of an extra-planar power — that is to say, the device which Tanar'ri lords and princes use to maintain their vital essences — has been traced to a location somewhere in the Prime Material Plane! Possession of this device would mean having the ability to control Cassiel (whom the Yuan-Ti always refer to as 'The Beast'), a ferocious lord from the darkest and most turbulent of the outer planes. With power of this magnitude at their beck and call, the Yuan-Ti (and their human associates) would be able to dominate large areas of the Forgotten Realms. Few individuals would have even a chance of standing in their way.

From the introduction:

For 8th - 10th level characters.

209513.name: A Lycanthrope
209513.description:
User summary:

The player characters are known in town as heroes. They are engaged early in the morning by the town mayor - he informs them of a grisly murder during the night and asks them to track down the perpetrator. Once they discover who did it.

A short scenario for low-level characters. Usually distributed as the RTF scenario and a BMP file (map).

209514.name: Mazaron's Monstrous Manual
209514.description:
From the introduction:

This is a collection of monsters of my own design...for use in campaign settings.

User summary:

several dozen original monsters suitable for general fantasy settings.

209516.name: The Magnificent Monstrous Database
209516.description:
User summary:

The Magnificent Monstrous Database, in its fifth iteration, contained over 2,500 monsters - all derived from commercial ("official") sources published by TSR. The database included the salient "stats" of monsters but not their descriptions, etc. Various database forms, etc., were provided in order to modify, randomize, and print monster data for campaign use.

The product was published as data files with accompanying documentation (introduction and index) in RTF format. The final version of the database ("5th Edition") was offered in A20, A70, and ASCII format.

209517.name: Antenna
209517.description:
User Description

A audio puzzle based (short) adventure featuring a machine pondering his existence.

209518.name: G.M.O.ooh!
209518.description:
You’re a Scientist, Salesperson, CEO, Inventor, and Promoter trying to dominate the market and survive the dystopian world of G.M.O.ooh! Real-life Genetically Modified Organisms are intermingled with bizarre, advanced innovations to create a card game filled with laughs, debate, and fantasy.

G.M.O.ooh!’s key game mechanic involves debating the merits of the futuristic Organisms across a many of dimensions. These unique factors lead to one-of-a-kind, creative discussions. Only one G.M.O.ooh! Card survives per round. The player with the last remaining G.M.O.ooh! Card wins the game.

Each G.M.O.ooh! Card is a futuristic genetically modified organism, including background information and data on 5 Categories. Each Category has a Description and a Rating number. The Categories are Profit, Cost, Environmental Impact, Demand, and Risk.

Each Challenge Card allows a player to Challenge and overtake the Current Leader. Red Challenge Cards involve adding or subtracting Rating points or changing the Category. Blue Challenge Cards allow the player to debate the Current Leader across 11 Debate types: Category Challenge (5 different Categories), Survive, Mate, Sales Pitch, Danger, Act, Fight, Outsmart, Race, Outgrow, and Looks.

This description primarily covers the Basic Game. The full details of the Advanced Game version are included in the instruction booklet.

Setup: Deal all of the G.M.O.ooh! Cards face down to each player. This is the players Stack. Players do not look at the cards in their stack until the top card is played. Deal 3 Challenge Cards to each player face down. Players can hold and view their Challenge Cards and also replenish up to 3 after each round. The Dealer starts with the Current Leader Dial and the Dealer Button. The Current Leader Dial acts as a scorekeeper for the Category and Rating within the current round and also denotes who the Current Leader is.

Each round within a game includes 2 phases: G.M.O.ooh! Card phase and Challenge Card phase.

G.M.O.ooh! Card phase – This phase establishes the Current Leader. The dealer introduces the G.M.O.ooh! Card, choses a Category, and states the Rating. All players then reveal their Rating in that Category. The player with the highest rating in the Category chosen becomes the Current Leader and announces their Card if necessary.

Challenge Card Phase – Starting clockwise, the Current Leader then Checks for Challenges. Players can then play a Challenge Card to attempt to become the new Current Leader. There is a limit of 1 Challenge per player per round.

Red Challenge Cards may result in an immediate change of Current Leader.

Blue Challenge Cards require a debate. The Challenger first states their case, the Current Leader then defends. A final phase allows all players at the table to ask questions or lobby before all players vote.

Voters should consider creative use of data provided on each G.M.O.ooh! Card when casting their vote.

The Challenger must have at least 1 extra vote (A tie goes to the Current Leader). The Challenge Phase then continues clockwise until all players have had 1 chance to Challenge. A feature in the Advanced Game version allows players to pass and still Challenge in the same round.

The Current Leader when all challenges have been exhausted or one full pass around the table has been completed wins the round and moves their G.M.O.ooh! Card to their Winners Pile. All losers in the round discard their G.M.O.ooh! Card to the Losers Pile in the center of the table. In the Advanced Game version, players can Steal or Re-incarnate lost G.M.O.ooh! Cards using Yellow Challenge Cards.

Pass the Dealer Button to the left and continue with a new round. When a player’s Stack is depleted, their shuffled Winners Pile becomes their new Stack. A player is out of the game when they lose their last G.M.O.ooh! Card.

The player with the last remaining G.M.O.ooh! Card wins the game.

209519.name: Future Wars - (Issue 18)
rpgissuearticle: Medium Mechs: The Work Horse of the Inner Sphere
209519.description:
This Issue:
Medium 'Mechs: Work horse of the Inner Sphere
Interview: Micael A. Stackpole
Excerpt from: Blood Legacy Blood of Kerensky Part 2

209520.name: Yeti Mountain - The Three-Dimensional, Adventure Board Game
209520.description:
Yeti Mountain is a board game for 2-4 players, inspired by the classic game, Fireball Island from the 1980's. Yeti Mountain is played on a unique 3D game board where players race against each other to be the first to capture the Idol and escape the mountain. At any time, players can use cards to hinder opponents and help themselves. But watch out! An evil Yeti controls the mountain and tries to stop the players from stealing his Idol. He rolls snowballs at players sending them back into snow pits, slowing them down.

A turn consists of rolling the die and moving that number of spaces. If a player rolls a "1" on the die, they get to roll one of the many snowballs(marbles) and try to knock over the other players.

The first player to steal the Idol from the Yeti and escape the mountain wins!

209521.name: The Kristal
209521.description:
Box Back

Become Dancis Frake, swashbuckling space pirate, in this epic quest to find the fabled Kristal of Konos and return it to its rightful resting place. You'll battle ruthless villains, woo a beautiful princess, and interact with strange, alien life forms.

The galaxy is the stage and you're the star!

Based on an original play, The Kristal features incredibly lifelike animation and gorgeous graphics. Fiendish puzzles, character interaction, and amazing arcade-style sequences combine to provide the ultimate challenge to all of your game playing skills.

Huge multi-disk universe.
Addictively clever traps and puzzles.
Interrogative parser.
Real-time action.

209522.name: Mega Man: The Board Game – Proto Man Expansion
209522.description:
Before Dr. Light created Mega Man, he made DLN-000 - Proto Man! Now is your chance to use this character to battle the forces of Dr. Wily.

Contents:
1 Proto Man Figure + Character Card

209523.name: Adventures of Pip
209523.description:
Adventures of Pip revitalizes the classic side-scrolling action platform genre. Pip — the ultimate digital underdog – is a lowly single pixel in a 32-bit world who proves that you can’t judge a hero by the fidelity of his shaders. During the game, Pip gains the ability to evolve and grow by absorbing pixels from his fallen foes. Those same pixels can then be used to blast through environment puzzles and enemies, devolving Pip back to a single pixel. Players will explore five stylized worlds and experience up to 10 hours of epic adventure saving Pip’s village from the evil Queen DeRezzia.

Inspired by classic platformers, Adventures of Pip basks in a world where players can defeat a huge 32-bit boss as a single pixel or even as an 8-bit character.

With three different forms, evolve and devolve Pip to solve puzzles and defeat enemies; each with their own weakness and strength that must be unraveled throughout the campaign.

Source: The Developer Website.

209524.name: The NetBook of Dungeon Keeper Rules
209524.description:
From the introduction:

As many of you know there have been thousands of dungeons that have been destroyed by those wretched heroes and other hazards. Heroes come and go and destroy everything in their path. Many have found the dungeon a difficult task, others will have nightmares to remember and still others will be lying in eternal sleep as a puddle of blood on the dungeon floor.

Heroes have spoken of the "final enemy", as they put it, who is the mastermind of it all. Sages have finally named these masterminds as Dungeon Keepers.

209525.name: NetBook of Golems & Gargoyles
209525.description:
User summary:

This guide presents a variety of interpretations of golems and gargoyles, including numerous variations of both. Also included is the processes needed to manufacture golems and gargoyles, and the materials from which they can be constructed.

209526.name: The Great Net Pantheon
209526.description:
From the introduction:

I first started to compile this work in June 1992. At the time I was beginning to put together a new gaming world for my own use. I had written some new deities for this world called Ogygia, but was beginning to run short of inspiration. Thus, I asked for help from the contributors to the ADND-L and Forgotten Realms lists. I decided that it would be a good idea to share these new Gods, Goddesses, and Demi-Gods with other list members, and so the Great Net Pantheon came into being.

209527.name: The No Lands Bestiary - Tomo 1
209527.description:
From the publisher website:
What better way to start our line of roleplaying games books with a tome dedicated to the monsters of the No Lands? Read about the most varied and fascinating creatures that populate our world, from dragons to demons, from fairies to undeads...

209528.name: La Cittadella delle Lance
209528.description:
From the publisher website:
We are proud to present our first roleplaying game adventure module, The Citadel of Spears! Located in the northern part of the continent of Aartha, the Citadel has always been a sanctuary for the humans of this turmoiled land. The scourging Marmoorians cannot harm it, nor can any other form of evil, and it will remain so until the Sacred Bell, a powerful relic, will protect the city with its magical aura.

209529.name: Desideri di Morte
209529.description:
From the publisher website:
Death Wishes is our second RPG Adventure Module that takes place in the Free City of Lie. A group of expert thieves has decided to raid the undergrounds of Castle Palfray where the Prince of Lie is keeping all his precious belongings.

209530.description:
Gwent is a standalone card game included inside the Witcher 3: The Wild Hunt videogame by CD Projekt Red. It was available as a physical copy with the Xbox One Collector's Edition of the video game (Northern Realms and Nilfgaardian Empire factions), in "Hearts of Stone"physical expansion for PC/PS4 (Scoia'Tel and Monsters factions) and with the purchase of the Season Pass giving you the opportunity to ask for redeem code to buy both limited editions versions on CD Projekt Red merchandising store.

Gwent has two players simulating a war between two of four factions: Northern Realms, Scoia'Tael, Monsters, or Nilfgaardian Empire. Players take turns adding strength to the battlefield until both players pass. The highest strength on the battlefield wins the round and matches are played best of three, with little to no card drawing in between rounds. Special cards may also be played to reduce the effect of certain unit types. Gwent also features various once-per-game leader abilities and deck building rules.
209530.name: Gwent: Nilfgaard and Northern Realms

209531.name: Future Wars - (Issue 19)
rpgissuearticle: Review: The AADA Vehicle Guide, Vol. 3
Technology of Battletech Star League and Tech 16
Without a Shot: The Art of Manouver
209531.description:
This Issue: Tactics
(The cover has a bunch of vehicles on it because this was supposed to be the vehicle issue from the editorial)

209532.description:
Meteln is a dice game all about honey and mead (honey wine). As in Yahtzee, players roll five dice and try to get the best combination out of three rolls.

Meteln is played with five special twelve-sided dice, the faces of which show symbols like a flower meadow, bees, beehive, honey & mead. The dice also have two wild faces that allow the player to choose the symbol they need. To score points, you need at least three suitable symbols.

The game ends after 13 rounds, and whoever has the most points wins.

The scoring sheet is available as a free download in German and English, and other languages will follow.
boardgameversion: English/German first edition (wood barrel edition—200 copies)
209532.name: Meteln

209533.name: Watch This!
209533.description:
User Summary

Watch This! is a first person horror game about a new show, you have to entertain people...

209534.name: 14 Days
209534.description:
Publisher's Blurb
Why Migraines?

We designed 14 Days with a focus on migraines because the subject matter is personal, and it’s one we can present with confidence.

The mechanics of the game are based on the unpredictability of migraines and the medications, rebound headaches, and misconceptions. However, there are many types of chronic pain that impact and reshape people’s lives. We hope 14 days can serve as a resource for building empathy and understanding.

14 Days isn’t a game about describing pain. It’s a game about balancing the responsibilities of everyday life when you don’t know what tomorrow will bring.

Though 14 Days centers around migraines, you don’t have to know anything about migraines to play. Some folks who played and enjoyed the game include:


People who experience migraines or other chronic pain conditions
The friends and family members of people with chronic migraines
People interested in a deeper look at the day-to-day impact of chronic pain
Folks who enjoy tabletop games!

209536.name: Mephisto (Issue 62 - Sep/Oct 2016)
209536.description: Issue #62 contains a range of articles, news, reviews and interviews. There's also an adaption of the Deus Ex setting for Shadowrun 5, a detailed Earthdawn location, two Fiasco playsets, and scenarios for Mansions of Madness.

209538.name: Alexandria
209538.description:
Fire! The Great Library, the world's most complete archive of knowledge and wisdom is on fire!

As books and relics are consumed by the flames, you must make a choice over what to save - some artifacts are more valuable to you than others, and your fellow heroes may have different priorities than you - and some may even be trying to burn books!

In Alexandria, 2-4 players must use a limited supply of time to move through the burning corridors of the Great Library, looking for scrolls, items and even scholars that they can save. Each round, up to four rooms of the library will surrender to the flames, and anything in them will be lost!

Will you use your time wisely to preserve ancient knowledge, or will your opponents get the best of you? In Alexandria, every second counts, and you are running out of seconds...

209539.name: Galaktisch Taktisch Gut
209539.description:
Aliens are planning to secretly take control of the earth. Humans who get to know about this can try to stop them. The players bet which side is stronger in the end to score points.

In Galaktisch Taktisch Gut, each player holds two cards. One player draws two cards and passes two cards to any other player, who then discards one of these, revealing it only to the player who gave it to them. In addition, the active player can play an action card and execute its special effect.

When the draw pile is used up, each player makes a bet on whether the players hold more alien or more human cards in their hands. All players who guessed correctly, win — unless everyone bets on the aliens, then the player who holds the alien leader wins.

boardgamepublisher: He Does Not Throw Dice Limited
209541.description:
Description from the publisher:

Dead Cat is a bluffing and push your luck game that can be played in under 10 minutes.

It is family friendly, and the box is designed to be portable, so that it is light and convenient for one to carry it around, thus allowing games to be played during a train ride or on a plane.

You are one of the assistants to Erwin Schrodinger, the famous physicist, who just entered the laboratory with a cat in one hand and a box in the other. After some fighting and hissing Schrodinger finally manages to put the cat into the box and to close it. Happy that the struggle is over he proudly announces that from now on no one is able to know if the cat is dead or alive as long as nobody looks into the box. Schrodinger orders you and your colleagues assistants to watch the box and take notes. An so you do for hours and hours…

Finally, you have had enough. You turn towards your fellow colleagues, announcing that you will wager your position of first assistant to whoever is able to make the best guess on whether the cat is already dead and how long ago it died. Enthusiastically, everybody agrees, however you have a plan: to sneak into the laboratory at night and risk a peek into the box to make sure the most suitable candidate gets the title of first assistant. After all, who else would be more suitable than you?

In Dead Cat you try to guess how long the cat in the box is already dead. When it's your turn you have two options: you can either look into the box or you announce that the cat is dead.

If you decide to look into the box you take a card from the box deck, look at it without showing it to your opponent and put it on top of the time deck. After that you have to change your bet. Take the your betting die and change it to another site. You choose which one as long as it is not the same as before.

If you decide to announce the death of the cat the round ends and you start revealing cards from the top of the time deck until you find a dead cat or there are no cards left. In the first case the player with the closest bet to the amount of revealed cards wins the round, in the latter case the player with the highest bet. In case of a tie both player receive a point.

You play until one player gets 4 points.
209541.name: Dead Cat: A Quantum Physics Card Game

209542.name: Diesel Demolition Derby
209542.description:
Description from the publisher:

Behind hidden alleys and in dark basements, a new underground league of robot combat has begun. Engineers bring their latest creations to the arena, and battle with each other for money, glory, and power!

In Diesel Demolition Derby the players compete in a series of quick arena matches by fielding their robotic contraptions in battle against each other.

Each match is composed of several rounds where the mechanical warriors fight for the right to remain in contention for the final showdown. In each round, the players secretly choose a card and place it face-down in front of them. They then simultaneously reveal the cards, and the ability of each card is resolved. Whatever cards remain in play are then added to each player's lineup.

At the end of the match, the player with the most power in their lineup is the winner. The first player to win 3 matches wins the league and becomes the champion!

209543.description:
Claim: The Search for the Gold Nugget is a card game in which you play as a prospector mining for gold and trying to strike it rich! But you will have to compete with other prospectors to find and hold on to the elusive gold nugget.

Claim is a deduction and bluffing game for 2-4 players. It plays in around 20-30 minutes, and is appropriate for all ages. Players start with three cards in their hand and their own Secret Stash card out in front of them. In turn players will play cards to try to find the gold nugget card hidden in the deck or hidden by other players. Players will try to keep the gold nugget hidden from other players in either their hand or under their Secret Stash. The player who is holding on the gold nugget when the deck runs out and the game ends wins.

The gold rush is on!
209543.name: Claim: The Search for the Gold Nugget

209544.name: Mundane Beasts
209544.description:
From the publisher's website:

Want to shapechange into a bear? Do battle with a pack of ravenous wolves? Get the Book of Mundane Beasts as a FREE download!

209545.name: Cowboys and Indians Card Game
209545.description: This is a set of 36 cards (4 Tomahawk, 4 Six Shooter, 14 Indian, 14 Cowboy) in which players are trying to win all the cards. They do this by flipping over cards and indicating "Indian" or "Cowboy" as they are turned over. If a player turns over a Tomahawk card and their opponent has flipped over a "Cowboy" or "Six Shooter" card they then take the opponents pile. Conversely, if a player turns over a "Six Shooter" card and their opponent has flipped over an "Indian" or "Tomahawk" card they take the opponents pile. First player to take all their opponents cards is the winner.

209546.name: Hegemony III: Clash of the Ancients
209546.description:
User Summary

Hegemony III: Clash of the Ancients is a historical RTS game taking place before the rise of Rome. Lead one of 28 factions in its rise to rule all of ancient Italy by managing resources and cities, raising and commanding an army, and by gaining territory through peaceful or aggressive manner.

There are 2 main campaigns from which to choose. Play either the Unification of Italy or Etruria.

209549.description:
The game contains 12 cardboard riders with a wooden base, and there are rules for 4 different races: Sprint, Poursuit, Omnium and Madison. The first three are individual while the latter is a team race, each team being composed of two riders.

The movement of the rides is determined by the roll of two dice, and the coloured squares on the board mean:

- red squares: advance two extra squares
- yellow squares: go back two squares:
- black squares: take a chance card

The player who's riders finish the race first wins the game.
209549.name: Holland Wielersport

209550.name: Walt Disney's Pinocchio Playing Card Game
209550.description:
This game is filled with temptation cards, all attempting to make Pinocchio do wrong. But have no fear - Jiminy Cricket is on hand to guard him.

This card game consists of 35 playing cards - 11 Jiminy Cricket cards, 11 Temptation Cards and 13 Pinocchio cards. The object of the game is to hold 4 Pinocchio cards together with 1 Jiminy Cricket card.

Five cards are dealt to each player and then players discard and draw cards until the winning condition is met. Players then receive 30 points for the winning hand, 5 points for each Pinocchio card and negative 5 points for each Temptation card. Jiminy Cricket cards do not score but cancel a Temptation card. First player to 100 wins the game.

209551.name: Zombergeek
209551.description:
You and your friends have missed the right turn and find yourself in a dark wood. You are run out of fuel and it’s getting dark outside.

Suddenly there is a nice cosy mansion in front of you. You and your friends being naive as kids have no choice but to come in and find lots of zombies, aggressive dogs, venomous spiders and chaos! Move! Save your life, board up the windows and kill the hellish zombies!

Gameplay: players move across the house (one cell a turn), search for useful items, block windows and doors, fight zombies. The game field is a map containing hidden dangers (zombies and other monsters) and items (weapons, aid kits, boards for blocking windows and doors). Your goal is to find the car keys and gas, and then escape. Most preferably, escape without losing anyone. Each character has unique properties that help them and the entire team. For example, the police girl has a gun and she doesn’t need to look for one in the house.

A fight against zombies is simulated with a rotating arrow with a range of possible results, from a victory to fleeing the battlefield or suffering a wound. Weapons can modify the result.

If a monster eats your character, you become a zombie chief. With your help, zombies can chase living characters, block their access to rooms or specific items.

209552.name: Urfin Jus
209552.description:
A tower defense board game.

Urfin Jus is a children's brain-training game. You take command of the defenses of the Emerald City, which is being attacked on all sides by wooden soldiers. Your goal is to build special defensive towers that fire at various parts of the map according to certain rules. Each turn all the players reach into a bag full of tower parts, find the pieces of the structures they need by feel, and decide where to put the towers they construct. The wooden soldiers then take several steps.

Urfin Jus is an way to teach logical reasoning, develop motor skills (you try finding the right part in the bag!), and is just plain fun.

209553.name: We Are Dragon
209553.description:
You play as one of the heads of a three-headed dragon named
Josh who has captured the Princess. You and the other
players, i.e. the dragon’s other heads, will have to deal with
endless daring knights, a horde of the Princess’ defenders
and loads of other challenges, all while flirting with a lovely
Princess. Try not to let the dragon down and do your best to
stick with him until the end. That means not spending all your
money, or charming the capricious damsel more than the
other heads.

Gameplay: there is an event every turn that requires the attention of a dragon (for example, if you are attacked by a knight, or there is a thunderstorm, or if something like that happens). Each player-head suggests a solution (basically, it all boils down to an auction to minimize the resources needed). Those who can solve the problem with the least effort win the favor of the princess. If the problem appears insoluble, the entire dragon suffers – for example, a knight hits it hard with a sword. A few turns “lost” this way end the game. In the end, this is a balance between the cooperative part (benefits the entire dragon) and the individual one (to become the most efficient manager among other heads). And, of course, the princess herself occasionally assigns tasks – and the princess’s card additionally defines which methods she likes most.

Contents:
• 9 player cards (dragon heads);
• 3 two-sided princess cards
(six beauties in all);
• 30 dragonfire cards;
• 15 spell cards;
• 8 defense cards;
• 7 gift cards;
• 18 cards with daring adventurers
to defeat;
• 6 unexpected move or
“force majeure” cards;
• 6 tokens representing
Gosha’s health;
• 24 coins;
• rules.

209554.name: One Moment Please
209554.description: You throw the dice, move forward and complete the task. Sometimes you must answer a trivial question; sometimes you need to defeat another player in a mini game, and sometimes—to accomplish a small odd assignment. If you manage to do it—you stay where you are on the field or move forward, if not you have to move back. The player who gets to finish line first wins.

209555.name: Yorsh
209555.description:
This is as simple as simple gets: perform your bizarre task, or take a drink. There are no neccesary to drink in that game actually. You should do tasks or refuse it. Each task gives you points.

As the game progresses, some tasks become easier: «send a text message to a phone number dictated to you by your friends»; while others become more difficult: «turn on your axis 10 times in 15 seconds». Beware of the polar bear — if you draw this card, everyone will have to hide under the table. And after half an hour of this game, some players just might have to spend the night down there. A perfect game for a group of fun-loving friends on a cold winter evening.

Game ends when you see fifth bear card (from the main deck).

Player with maximum score wins.

209557.name: Pulp!!
209557.description:
Pulp!! is a skirmish miniature game set in the adventurous world of the old pulps. Players control groups of 3 to 12 figures, controlling Heroes, Villains, Sidekicks, Henchmen, and many supporting characters. A game lasts typically 1 to 2 hours, and can be linked to other sessions in a campaign.

Each turn the players roll to determine who has Initiative.

Next, the characters that are still locked in Melee from the previous turn get to fight a round of combat or attempt to withdraw from the fight.

Then the main part of the turn begins. Players alternate activating Units. Models in an activating Unit check their cohesion. Models may be In Touch with one another or Out Of Touch. Models roll to determine if they will receive a Full or Partial Activation – models In Touch having a better chance to activate fully.

Models in the active Unit resolve their Full and/or Partial Activation. They may walk, run, attack with ranged or melee weapons, get ready to fire, or take a defensive stance. Special Points can be spent to purchase special Benefits.

When a fight occurs, the attacking Model rolls a number of dice equal to the Impact value of their weapon. The number to meet or exceed to score a Hit is based on the character’s Ability. For each Hit inflicted, the target gets a Save roll based on their Protection value. Each unsaved Hit results in a Suppression or a Wound.
Suppressions impair the target; Wounds get the character closer to be removed from the game.

After all Models in a Unit have resolved their Active and/or Partial Activations, another Unit activates. Activations continue this way until all Units have acted. At that point tokens that do not apply anymore are removed from the play area, and a new turn is started.

209558.name: Teocalli: La Conquista
209558.description:
Teocalli is a board game in which your goal is to defeat the heart of your opponent.

To do this you must go moving your characters through a board on which go dodging and fighting the characters that your opponent has, strategy and luck will decide your fate.

To create a character you must pay the cost of tribute, either doubloons or cocoas and to move should look out for its speed, represented by three icons: a tortoise advances one space, a rabbit advances two, and the horse three spaces forward.

Six colors represented by the six sides of the dice will define whether your character attributes is stronger than your opponent. If so, you will get a sacred feather, getting six, it is another way to win.

Once you have reached the heart of your opponent, your luck will define your destiny. 1 or 6 is an eagle devouring a snake, which means you've won. 2 to 5 a Mayan zero, which means it was a null attack, 3 two arrows reversed which means spear again and 4 the skull of the god Mictlantecuhtli which means you will go to the underworld and must take another character to the heart.

209559.name: Kids Go Wild
209559.description: A game designed by and for kids. Throw the dice, draw a card, preform the task on the card, and move your game piece forward. Our test group called it «trash the apartment».

209560.name: Hang 12
209560.description:
''Hang 12 is a push-your-luck party game!

Do you know what your friends are thinking? Guess correctly to surf bigger and bigger waves, but if you answer incorrectly, it will all come crashing down! Ride your wave in to shore before you lose it! You may even get to hang 12 and cry "Cowabunga"!

Try to guess what other players think in order to catch waves. Then, ride the waves in to shore to score points. Be the first to collect twenty-four points to win!

209561.name: Minibluff
209561.description:
A very simple new trick-taking card game where the first to play lowest card at last trick wins the game and losers are penalized according to the risks taken.
Minibluff combines Agurk game rule (playing a higher card or lowest) and Backgammon double dice rule (trick winner can ask others to double round value).
Combination of this makes Minibluff unique !

209562.name: Pipework Duo
209562.description:
Pipe Work Duo is a 2-player(or team) version of Pipe Work.
The game rule is almost same with Pipe Work. However, the player who makes the right connection on his game board will take the puzzle card as a point. The one who collects 5 cards wins the game!

Pipe Work is a simultaneous-play, tile placement game with the tiles actually being pipes that connect colored tokens on your 5x5 playing area.

In each of the eight rounds, players start by revealing a card that shows where the pairs of colored tokens are placed on their individual 5x5 game board. As soon as everyone's done this, all players race simultaneously to place pipes in their game board to create connections between matching tokens.

209563.name: Future Wars - (Issue 20)
rpgissuearticle: So You Want To Play Battletech
209563.description:
From Front Cover:
This Issue: UNITS!
Unit Issue:
113th Division
Stuarts Light Clavary (sp)
New Mechs
and MUCH MORE

209564.name: Dungeons of light and darkness
209564.description:
Somewhere in the tunnels of Dungeon of Light and Darkness, lies famous Fountain of Knowledge. Many have tried to find it, but none succeed. And no, there are no monsters in this dungeon.. But the light goes on and off in its chambers in mysterious ways, and this is enough to drive explorers crazy and forever lost. Can you become the first man in centuries to drink from the long lost fountain?

Dungeons of light and darkness is a push your luck tile and dice placement game of exploring a dungeon in search for the Fountain of Knowledge.

The game is played by rolling the pool of dice looking for specific combinations. Each combination of dice can be used to perform different actions like movement, placement of the new tile, turning lights on the specific tile on or off, etc.

To win the game, player needs to find Fountain of Knowledge, and safely exit the dungeon afterwards.
Game is lost if the player runs out of options.

209565.name: Tomb of Horutep
209565.description: A free example adventure for the $1 Adventure Framework series.

209566.name: Snippets
209566.description:
Description from the publisher:

Snippets is the fast paced anything goes word game!

For 2-8 players and taking about 45 minutes, Snippets is perfect for a party or family game night. It can best be described as a combination of Scrabble and Scattergories, but unlike Scrabble, you don’t need a crazy vocabulary to win, unlike Scattergories there’s no ambiguity, and unlike most word games, the “smartest” player doesn’t always win.

A "snippet" is a short sequence of letters that can be found as a whole within one or more words. For example, the snippet IPP can be found in the words SNIPPETS, QUIPPED, and HIPPIE but not in SHIPSHAPE, PIPE, or HOPPING.

Players have 60 seconds to write down as many words as they can think of that contain each round's snippet. Anything goes! Dictionary words, people names, place names, brand names, fictional things, technical terms, slang, acronyms, abbreviations, contractions, hyphenations, non-english words, the snippet itself, and even plurals and alternate verb tenses are all allowed!

When time's up, players compare answers, earning points for unique words and fun bonuses. The player with the most points wins the round and the first to 3 rounds wins the game!

With its unique "anything goes" rule, Snippets isn't like most word games, requiring more of a creative mind than a large vocabulary. And with only 60 seconds to think, everyone’s answers will be equally hilarious.

209567.description:
Like every spring, the melted snow fills the riverbeds, opening the way back home for the Salmon, after a life swimming in the oceans.
Each player controls a bank of salmons swimming upstream to lay their eggs where they were born.
During their journey they will face hungry bears, fierce birds of prey, as well as patient fishermen, which they must avoid in order to survive.
These are not the only hazards the Salmons must face, as each round of play the strength of the water flow will cause some pieces of the river to fall back, making it impossible for some fishes to keep their way upstream.

The game is played in rounds, where each player must spend 5 points among their salmon tokens in order to move them, either swimming or jumping across the hexagonal tiled river. At the end of each round the lowermost pieces of the river are removed from the game with any salmon token standing over them, then 3 new tiles are added to the uppermost side of the river. The game ends when all the salmons are either deceased or on the spawn point, at the very end of the river. Players will then score points, according to the number and order of arrival of their salmons. The player with most points is the winner.
209567.name: Upstream

209568.name: Children of the Nuclear Age
209568.description:
From the introduction:

A popcorn (action adventure) Super Hero scenario for 2-5 players. The characters are students at an elite high school in upstate New York.

User summary:

For 50-point character builds with 4-points "Weird Stuff".

209569.name: Fast Company
209569.description:
From the introduction:

The streets are wet with blood, rain, and waste water from broken sewer mains. The city is sweltering under a punishing heat wave and in the wake of rolling blackouts crime has become epidemic across the city and much of the Eastern Seaboard. Indeed all of America seems poised on the edge of a dark age of violence, corruption, and hopelessness. It is dark times. They are saying there is no one to look to that can save us.

209570.name: Guilty Gear Xrd -REVELATOR-
videogamehonor: 2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Design of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Mutliplayer Experience of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
209570.description:
Mysteries and machinations have come to a head, triggering the latest chapter in the GUILTY GEAR saga. It’s been a week since Ramlethal declared war on all of humanity. Sol and his crew have begun an investigation in order to track down Elphelt, who has been abducted. There is no clue on her whereabouts…

Suddenly, Sol gets an unexpected visit…It’s the very man who created the Gears, Sol’s nemesis, “That Man”, along with one of his lieutenants — Raven. “That Man” seeks help from Sol in order to settle his score with the “Universal Will.”

Who is the “Universal Will”? And who will win in the end…?

Source: The Game Website.

209571.name: JAGS Monsters
209571.description:
From the introduction:

Ghosties and goulies and long-legged beasties; and things
that go bump in the night.
...
Monsters don’t follow natural laws. They cheat. They are often armed with advantages and abilities that not only make them more terrifying, but also make them harder to vanquish.

209572.name: JAGS Treasure
209572.description:
From the introduction:

Treasure...makes a certain kind of adventuring interesting and fun. JAGS Treasure is meant to serve several purposes. First, it's a cool list of magic items that you can use in any campaign. Second, it provides a history of sorts - it's not exactly a world book, but there is a time-line and some ideas about where all of these wonderful toys might have come from. Finally, it describes a "popcorn fantasy economy".

209573.name: Navegador: Privilege Cards
209573.description:
Privilege Cards is an expansion for Navegador. It consists of 8 stable cardboard cards (7 unique cards and a rules summary card) plus rules.
The cards are played in addition to the players normal action and therefore enrich Navegador with new tactics and strategies.
The cardboard sheet with rules also includes the 8 Forum Cards expansion for Concordia.

209574.description:
8 Forum Cards is a mini-expansion for Concordia. It can be combined with the base game with or without expansions, Concordia: Salsa is not required.

It is a cardboard sheet with rules and also includes Navegador: Privilege Cards.
209574.name: Concordia: 8 Forum Cards mini-expansion

209575.name: Justifiers (1st Edition)
209575.description:
From the introduction:

In the beginning there was only one corporation, The Corporation, The Terran Trade Alliance, Inc. TTA was born out of the need of various smaller conglomerates to protect themselves during the late 20th and early 21st centuries.

209576.name: The Axon Confrontation
209576.description:
An Introductory Justifiers Scenario

From the introduction:

The team will be beaming to the planet Axon, officially controlled and under exploration by TTMS. They will have to locate the stolen shuttle, then hunt down Major Martell and the rest of his team. Once found, the team must confront Martell and recover the stolen test data and prototype weapons, all the time attempting to avoid direct contact with TTMS.

209577.name: Skylanders Action Game
209577.description:
Work together as Skylanders and visit the four islands to collect Battle Dice for your final battle against the evil Kaos!
Each player controls one of the four characters, but you face the island challenges together.
Collect as many dice as you can by successfully completing the challenges, and you'll stand a better chance of defeating Kaos.
If you come out on top after the Final Battle, you all win the game together.

209578.description:
Description from the publisher:

"Ah, what’s hatching over there? Four small cheeky chicks are beginning to poke through their shells and immediately they have an enormous appetite. Only one thing will help – food! But watch out. The roll of the die will decide what the chicks can be fed and how quickly they will grow. Which of them will be the first to grow into a stately little bird?
A cheerfully cheeky collecting game."

1. Roll the die.

2. What feed symbol does the die show?(worm, fly, berries, or seeds)All the children look to see whether the corresponding feed symbol is pictured on their meadow, that is, whether their chick would like to eat the corresponding feed.
The children may take one matching feed dish from the middle. Cover the feed symbol on there meadow with the feed dish.

3. Your chick is full when you have collected all the feed dishes for it. Place all the dishes from your meadow back into the middle. Turn the card over and cover up the little chick with the pictured larger chick.
The chick has grown larger but it is still hungry.

4. The first child to turn over his or her last card and cover up all the other cards with the little bird pictured on it wins the game. His or her bird is now full-fledged and flies out into the world.
209578.name: Little Bird, Big Hunger

209579.name: Eldritch Items
209579.description:
From publisher blurb:

Occult Weapons and Weird Science

From dread books with ancient secrets, to obscure cult relics and alien technologies that man was not meant to know, the worlds of the eldritch and the strange contain many unique and powerful magic items. This book contains fifteen new magic items with a focus on eldritch, alien, and Lovecraftian themes, including:

The brain box, a strange device that preserves a severed brain and allows its knowledge to be accessed.
The cloak of man skin, a cloak made from human skin, which allows creatures of any race to disguise themselves in human guise.
The fingerbone of curses, a human fingerbone that fuses to one’s hand and allows the wielder to deliver limitless curses with a touch, but also inflicts bad luck upon its wielder.
The tongue of the goat, a writhing, living tongue that can be sewn into the user’s mouth and allows him to speak any language and influence or even slay those who might oppose him.
…and much, much more!

209580.name: The Dragon
209580.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take to the skies (with or without wings), annihilate your enemies from a distance with a devastating breath weapon, or close in to tear them apart with your fangs and claws, shrugging off their pathetic blows with your armored hide.

You start out by choosing from three types of dragons (and there are ten more in the back), which determines what your breath weapon does and grants another ability. As you level up you can become bigger, tougher, and more dangerous in a variety of ways: sharper claws and teeth, a more potent breath weapon, even your blood can become hazardous to your enemies (but beneficial for your allies).

You can also learn how to smell out treasure (and those that might futilely try and keep it out of your talons), transform into a human, affect the land around your lair, become resistant to magic (and even reflect it back on the spellcaster), gain fanatically loyal followers, and strike fear in those would would stand before you with your mere presence.

This product contains three files.

The first is a letter-sized character sheet that uses our new character sheet layout (so we could fit the twenty-nine advanced moves on the back).

The other two are digest-sized PDFs, one in color, the other in black and white to make it easier to print at home. They both contain:

The dragon class.
Armor made from dragon parts, and armor made for dragon parts.
Some extra dungeon gear.
Chromatic dragon types, so if you wanna play D&D dragon you can.
Other dragon types, like the dragon turtle, feathered serpent, and wyvern.
The dracolich compendium class.
A set of moves to represent ryu dragon magic (but could be easily reskinned for other dragons).
A Director's Cut with questions to ask yourself when rolling up a dragon, explanations/clarifications for some of the moves, and some extra monsters.

209581.name: Albert's Big League Baseball Game
209581.description:
This undated but likely mid-20th century title has an unusual mechanism based on two midway-style spinning wheels, one red for pitching and the other green for batting.

Each wheel has four large fins in the middle that players use to spin the wheel, vertical teeth on the rim between each of the 40 wheel segments, and a flexible metal strip mounted to a post on the corner that slows the wheel and eventually comes to rest between two of the pegs. There is also a thick cardboard field and plastic pegs to mark runners, balls, strikes and outs.

The fielding player spins the pitching wheel, which includes 12 strikes, 13 balls, 6 fouls, 1 foul pop out, and 8 hits. Balls and strikes may lead to strike-outs or walks, but on any hit result, the batting player spins the red wheel. That wheel in turn has 12 ground outs, 14 fly outs, 8 singles, 3 doubles, 2 triples and 1 home run. Most results have specific consequences such as tagging up, advancing runners or double plays.

209582.name: Ultimate Rulership (5E)
209582.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heroes Rule!

Ultimate Rulership is a massive expansion to the 5th Edition rules for building and ruling a domain of your very own! Building upon the rules introduced in Kingdoms from Legendary Games, Ultimate Rulership provides new rulership edicts for festivals, espionage, and more, as well as expanded guidelines on founding and investing in your kingdom alongside a vast array of noble titles and forms of address. Build villages into towns and cities as your population expands with your territory, and enhance them with magical improvements, natural advantages, over a dozen new buildings from aeries to lumberyards, or construct magnificent hanging gardens, lighthouses, or a magnificent colossus, or an entire exotic settlement from cliff dwellings to treetop cities and underwater cities! Add to that a new system of danger in managing kingdom events and over 70 settlement attributes to make each city unique, from natural geography like resettled ruins and strategic location to a legendary marketplace or rumormongering citizens, or even magical attributes like a planar crossroads, slumbering monster, or a god-ruled city! Plus dozens of tables to reference every rule. Your heroes can establish their own domains, raising cities and monuments to their glory and becoming a force to be reckoned with in the campaign world, striking out into a position of leadership with amazing depth and detail.

209583.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 6, Issue 12 - Superyacht)
209583.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This week: A new hide out for your super villains.

209584.name: Shaintar Adventure: The Burning Heart
209584.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Legend in the Making. Back in 2008 (we think) Sean Patrick Fannon ran a series of games over the course of several conventions with larger games at that years Origins and an Epic finale during Gen Con. This EPIC Event has been written into a full adventure that GM can really sink their teeth into. It starts wtih two legends and a twisted plan by agents of Ceynara in a bid to gain her return to the land.

From the mists of time, there are weapons that are rumored to be the first made of white silver. The spirit of Shaintar gave her blessing to these 4 or 5 first weapons and they are rumored to have the ability to kll or banish Dragons - or so Legend says. This adventure was taken from the notes of the original proposal. Its not the same as much has been updated and rewritten to incorporate some new material but that flair you expect from SPF is there along with some fun twists and turns.

Your heroes have the opportunity to become movers and shakers in the war effort. There's much to be done and High Command has a number of battles planned for your group. Do they have what it takes to thwart Ceynara's evil plan? Find out and have fun with this full adventure complete with fully realized NPCs, Monsters and Villains in the back half of the book.

209585.name: Heroic Conveyances
209585.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the following pages, you will find 11 new vehicles, 3 new feats and 4 new magic items. There’s also a table to randomly generate traits for the vehicle, so that every vehicle can be special. If you aren’t familiar with how vehicles work in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, start with the rules found in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Ultimate Combat.

209586.name: Across Angry Waves
209586.description:
From publisher blurb:

The ocean itself seems to fight back against the united armies of the pegasi and the griffons, with waves and wind as its foot-soldiers. Will the landing force be too wrecked, after their ocean voyage, to wage war effectively?

Only you and your brave party of adventurers can break this trail, find out what has angered the ocean, and stop it. Or will you break instead? Will it all be for naught and your bones join those of countless ponies at the bottom of the ocean?

An adventure that starts at level 3 and ends into level 5 and continues the fight, bringing the war to the doorstep of the elves.

This adventure is made to scale for a party as small as three or as large as six. It's set in the world of Everglow, but standard PCs (humans, dwarves, maybe not elves) can function just fine.

209587.name: Criss Cross Crash
209587.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all derbies are raced with cars. A large, solid vehicle that is difficult to control and turn – such as a semi cab – can make for an exceedingly crazy and exciting derby. Make the track mud, and it will add even more to the craziness! ...Semi cabs, a mud arena, and a brother aching for revenge all in the next exciting edition of Destruction Derby!

209588.name: O.K.O
209588.description:
This 1950s French-Canadian game is a form of bingo or lotto but played with a regular deck of cards. The game consists of a roll of red tokens and a set of 12 player boards, each showing 25 different cards in a five-by-five grid. Unlike bingo, there is no free center space on a board, nor are card values restricted to any given row or column.

The dealer or caller shuffles the card deck and turns over the top cards one at a time. Each player with that card showing on their board covers it with a red token. As in bingo, the winner is the first to cover a line of five horizontally, vertically or diagonally and call "O.K.O". The winner then becomes the next caller.

The numbering on the player boards suggest that there were at least three series of 12 available (to allow for larger groups).

The rules are printed in English and French on the inside of the box lid, along with Patent No. 207035 and the designer and publisher's address and phone number.

209589.name: Inquisitor Spells II (PRD)
209589.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Inquisitor Spells is a simple document that collects the inquisitor spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 2nd-level inquisitor spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

209590.name: Inquisitor Spells II (3PP)
209590.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Inquisitor Spells is a simple document that collects the inquisitor spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 2nd-level inquisitor spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and from select third-party products.

209591.name: Druid Spells II (3PP)
209591.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Druid Spells is a simple document that collects the druid spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 2nd-level druid spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and from select third-party products.

209592.name: Trumped Up Cards
209592.description:
Description from the publisher:

Trumped Up Cards exist to document the insanity of the 2016 campaign season. It's a fast-paced, satirical game where reality collides with absurdity.

The goal of the game is to be the first person to be able to be able to spell V-O-T-E from the lettered quote cards they collected during the game.

Each player has a hand of ten phrase cards and will draw back up to ten after each round. A player is selected to be the CEO for the round and they draw a quote card and read it to the players. The quote is missing a phrase that will be filled in with a phrase card from each player. Players select the "best" phrase card from their hands for the current quote card and place the chosen phrase cards face down in a pile. The CEO shuffles the submitted phrase cards and then reads the quote filled in with each phrase. The CEO then decides which phrase "won" the round and the player that played the winning phrase collects the quote card. Rotate the CEO position after each round.

There are special phrase cards called Trump cards that give a player special powers and are usually played in combination with a phrase card.

A "lightweight" ending is optional and occurs when a majority of the players grow so depressed at the prospect of a real Trump presidency that they just start quietly sobbing. When this happens, the player with the most quote cards wins.

209593.name: Druid Spells II (PRD)
209593.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Druid Spells is a simple document that collects the druid spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 2nd-level druid spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

209594.name: Intervention: Reach for the Stars
209594.description:
Inis Vare - Welcome, Earth-dweller.

It is the year 3251 Earth-Standard-Time. Mankind overcame its century old conflicts a few decades ago, and now strives for the stars as a unified species.

In the Millennia past the humans eyes looked up to the stars uncountable times, yet they didn't know that there were always others who looked back to them, from stars far away. While the rise to glory for mankind has just begun, the old species will continue to ignore them, while they split up the galaxy among themselves.

While fierce battles raged in the depth of space, trade and smuggling prospered, spies tried to gather secret knowledge and sinister laboratories sought always for new ways to annihilate rivals or solve the riddle to gain immortality. ... in all that Chaos of the crimson night... you Earthlings might be able, to save and preserve a part of the Universe.

Inis Vare, Mortal, in Intervention!

Intervention is a 4X turn-based strategy game set in space. There are four phases to run through per player and turn.

In phase one the player rolls the die and moves. Depending on where the token ends up, it can have unexpected impact on the player’s turn.

In phase two resources are gained form planets, colonies, conquered worlds, alliances, technologies and strategic resource-fields, that are occupied by his ships.

In phase three the player can take various actions. For example, building ships, move, conquer, colonize, research, trade or sign alliances.

In phase four you check if you have fulfilled one of the three victory conditions and tell it the person to your left.

The game ends, if one player has fulfilled one of the victory conditions at the end of a turn.

You may have to trade, cooperate, advance through research, or conquer your opponents to win this game. You also share the stars with non-playable factions, neutral star bases, and many other planets, asteroids and greater Neutrons.

What does make Intervention so special and worth to be played?

The designer has created an own unique universum for the game, the so called “Interversum”, with its own unique history. The Interversum is populated by 14 different species already, but it is planned to extend this pool further in the future. A player can even create its own unique species by using our civilization builder, which then can find its own place in the Interversum.

Furthermore, there is a lot of additional gaming material of high quality included. Every civilization comes with 30 spaceship tokens, each with six individual drawn spaceships. The species cards (faction cards), where the players income and victory points are marked, are coated with an iron lamination, that lets the magnets adhere on them.

At last there is to mention, that the board is made out of modular square cards, of which are more in the box than needed for a single match. That means every match is unique and not repeatable.

209595.name: Goblins
209595.description:
From publisher blurb:

A goblin is a legendary evil or mischievous grotesque dwarf-like daemon or monster that appeared in European stories and accounts during the Middle Ages. Sometimes green, grey or various shades, they are often thought to be a smaller version of the Orc.

Having a description ready or being able to come up with one can be handy. This is what the Creature Description Generator is for and covers 10 aspects to help flesh out and bring to life your description.

The aspects covered by the Creature Description Generator are:

Armour type and style - What type and style of armour do they wear?
Body Details - What about their eyes and teeth and other features?
Personality - Are they brash and loud or scheming & greedy?
Position/Rank/Job - What is their job or role within the tribe?
Size/Build - Are they fat? Long limbed? Or even really short for a goblin?
Tattoo - What markings do they have on themselves?
Symbol - What sign or symbol is associated with this goblin or their tribe?
Voice - How do they speak? Is their voice creepy or high pitched?
Weapon - What is their weapon of choice in combat?
Quirk/Feature - A d100 table of weird and odd things to personalise your gobbo

209596.name: Golems
209596.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Jewish folklore, a golem is an animated anthropomorphic being, magically created from clay or mud. Many others have been made from other materials, such as flesh, or clockwork. They all follow the commands of their creator or others that use the correct method, sometimes literally. The golem is, essentially a created tool. Some people treat them as slaves or worse, whilst others will give them the same respect they would another sentient or being. This can vary from person to person and culture to culture

All these aspects and more are covered in this volume of the CDG. The CDG (Creature Description Generator) range is designed with a fantasy setting in mind, but can easily be used for sci-fi or modern/horror settings. This creature description generator is broken down into various aspects. Any stats are given in vague terms, such as high, or fast, to allow your creation to fit into as many systems and stories as possible.

The aspects covered in this Creature Description Generator:

Command - How is the golem commanded?
Creator - Who, or what, made this golem?
Description/Form - What does it look like?
Decoration & Details - As it says, covers any decoration and details
Intelligence - A smarter golem is not always a good thing
Material - What is the primary material of the golem?
Movement - How does it move?
Purpose/Task - What is the primary purpose of this construct?
Voice - Can the golem speak or communicate?
Quirks & Features - Some quirks and features to help round off the description

209597.name: QB8
209597.description:
Description from the publisher:

QB8 is an engaging game of balancing the accumulation and retention of game cubes. Each cube displays one of four colors AND a number between one and six. In order to win, a player must be in possession of exactly two cubes each of all four colors AND where all eight numbers on those cubes, when added together, total exactly 28. You must only have eight cubes in your possession to win.

It's not as difficult as it sounds but it does require some concentration and some playing strategy. The goal of each turn is to acquire a game cube. While that's not guaranteed, the rules make it pretty easy to accomplish. At the end of each turn, a player is allowed to "discube" - or get rid of an unwanted cube - thus engaging in the act of balancing which cubes a player retains in their effort to obtain a winning combination of eight game cubes.

209598.name: Horror Feats C-E
209598.description:
From publisher blurb:

Horror Feats C-E is the latest Mythic Mini devoted to exploring the terrible tricks that desperate heroes and vile villains alike might unleash in a horror-themed campaign using the new Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Horror Adventures rulebook. Whether they deal in blood, pain, death, plagues, curses, corruption, sinister sorcery, or the mortal and immortal soul, these enhanced feats will dial up the horror in your campaign to a diabolical degree! Open up sinister secrets and skills aplenty in this PDF of 9 new feats from Clarity of Pain to Enemy Cult and all feats in between, including truly nasty tricks like Consume Essence and Contagious Spell!

209599.name: QB8 Words
209599.description:
Description from the publisher:
QB8 WORDS is a new version of QB8 where the cubes have letters instead of numbers and the goal of the game is to get exactly two cubes each of all four colors AND where you then use the eight letters to make one eight letter word or two words where one of the words has at least three letters.

209600.name: Flenheim
209600.description:
From publisher blurb:

Flenheim is a wretched, horrible place. Wretched in dancing shadows, the derro enclave is renowned for its flesh crafters—derro skilled in the art of enhancing their customer’s bodies by grafting or infusing the body parts of others onto their own. Flenheim is also at the centre of a growing slave trade and many come here to browse the wares at the Collectors’ Lodge and the Shadow Market.

And above the clamour of life and trade, moans and screams echo through the village. It is here the mad derro bard Herath Syngler perfects flenning—the art form of using the screams of torture victims to create soul-crushing symphonies of macabre horror. Each performance is unique and Herath always has need of fresh instruments. His seemingly unending thirst for new muses has brought him into conflict with the fleshcrafters and soon bloody violence and slaughter may engulf Flenheim’s chaotic society…

209601.name: STYX 666
209601.description:
Phlegyas has asked you to become the Master of Styx, but to do so you must fight your opponent on the banks of the river to Hell: The STYX.

For that use Wrathful's help to conquer this famous STYX.

6 factions, 6 forces and 6 Faculties all different that you will need to control during an infernal duel..."

Become the Master of STYX by controlling all the “wrathful” living there (or the majority of survivors).

To do so, on your turn, you can :

Either draw a visible « Wrathful » card and you play a « Wrathful » card from your hand by following the rules of installation.
Or, if you have less than 4 cards in your hand, choose to draw a face-down "Wrathful" card and your turn is over.




Once a player controls the five « Wrathful » of the STYX (When all cards are directed to him), he gains automatically and becomes the Grand Master of the STYX !
As soon as there is no more deck face up, we can not play anymore, the game ends, and, the player with the most STYX cards directed towards him, become Master of STYX.
The other player just passed on the other side of the river, synonymous of Hell ...

209602.name: Treasure Hoards #4
209602.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your PCs are deep in the dungeon and have just defeated a terrifying dragon! As they bandage their wounds, and ready their fallen friend’s bodies for return to the surface, they look around and ask “So what treasure’s in the dragon’s hoard, anyway?” At that point, unless the GM has prepared a detailed list of treasure, the PCs get (possibly) literally tons of coins and some generic magic items. (After all, most GMs have better things to do with their prep time than generate descriptions for stuff the PCs will likely sell).

Treasures & Trinkets: Treasure Hoards #4 banishes these problems by providing a veritable hoard of 25 pre-generated, richly detailed treasure hoards for challenges 17-20 ready to insert into almost any GM’s campaign.

This book is designed for use with the 5th edition of the world's most popular role-playing game.

209603.name: The Metamorphosis - New Oracle Mystery
209603.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue features the creation of Joshua Hennington, a new oracle mystery that grants the oracle the ability to harness the power of the eidolon's evolutions to completely transform herself based on her whims and desires.

209604.name: Weight of the Underworld
209604.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lands in Shadow for Shadow of the Demon Lord!

Everyone dies.
