This supplement for the World Wide Wrestling Roleplaying Game contains individual cards containing every Role and Gimmick Move that have been officially released for the game through August of 2016.

Easily track what you can do in the ring, randomize custom movesets or simply have them on hand as a resource for your roster to browse new Moves to take as their wresters advance.

The Move Deck was originally produced for the International Incident Kickstarter and is only available in the full-color tuckbox (as pictured) in limited quantities. A print-on-demand option for the Move Deck (including a clear deckbox option) is available through DriveThruCards.

The Move Deck contains 116 premium poker-sized cards, including:
1 Cover/Credits
10 Doublesided Basic Role Moves (Babyface/Heel)
4 Doublesided Lucha Libre Role Moves (Tecnico/Rudo)
4 Doublesided Advanced Role Moves (Celebrity/Icon and Legend/Part-Timer)
97 Move Cards covering all 26 Gimmicks publishing in World Wide Wrestling, International Incident, Season One and Season Two.
They feature the Gimmick Art on one side and the Move description on the other, and contain every Move that's possible to take as an Advance for your wrestling character.

209693.name: The Vault Heist
209693.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Vaults of Death

In the endless caves that snake beneath Skull Mountain, a secret war is being waged. The death cultists push inexorably on with their plan to destroy all other philosophies, and feed those who hold divergent ideas into the ravenous maws of their evil gods. From the perspective of the dragon worshippers, they appear to be winning this war.

But all is not yet lost. Indeed, the death cultists have numerous resources at their disposal, and one of the most important is their wealth. For humans are not the only creatures that lust after gold and shiny jewels — there are plenty of monsters whose aid can also be bought with such lucre. And of one must hoard wealth, one must hoard it somewhere, and the location of the death cult's vault full of valuables is a secret that has not been able to escape the cult of the dragon.

Suella the Snake, a petty thief not well-liked in the human underworld because of her reptilian features, has friends amongst those who revere the dragon, and the plan to raid the death cult's vault is her brainchild. Rafa Serpesso of the green robes, being the closest to her — and also a trainer of the cult's most fearsome weapon, the dragon dog — has been given command of the heist.

Day and night they toil, digging through the earth. But soon they will have tunnelled into the back of the vault, bypassing the hordes of undead creatures and cult necromancers that guard its entrance. They have guards to keep outsiders away until they can make off with the loot, but if they do not work fast enough, someone will discover them — someone whose silence cannot be bought with death — and the plan will be ruined.

But the dragon cultists know what is at stake here. If the death cult is allowed to grow and flourish, every other cultist in the land, whether they worship dragons or not, will be forced to surrender to death. But if they can strike this blow against their hated rivals, it could be their own cult that triumphs in the end.

209694.name: The Vault Heist
209694.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Vaults of Death

In the endless caves that snake beneath Skull Mountain, a secret war is being waged. The death cultists push inexorably on with their plan to destroy all other philosophies, and feed those who hold divergent ideas into the ravenous maws of their evil gods. From the perspective of the dragon worshippers, they appear to be winning this war.

But all is not yet lost. Indeed, the death cultists have numerous resources at their disposal, and one of the most important is their wealth. Rafa Serpesso of the green robes, being the closest to her — and also a trainer of the cult's most fearsome weapon, the dragon dog — has been given command of the heist.

Day and night they toil, digging through the earth. But soon they will have tunnelled into the back of the vault, bypassing the hordes of undead creatures and cult necromancers that guard its entrance. They have guards to keep outsiders away until they can make off with the loot, but if they do not work fast enough, someone will discover them — someone whose silence cannot be bought with death — and the plan will be ruined.

But the dragon cultists know what is at stake here. If the death cult is allowed to grow and flourish, every other cultist in the land, whether they worship dragons or not, will be forced to surrender to death. But if they can strike this blow against their hated rivals, it could be their own cult that triumphs in the end.

209695.name: Stickin' Around
209695.description:
This board game is based on the 1990's television cartoon series "Stickin' Around."

The box contains two games that are played one after the other.

The first is called "Mix and Match the Illustrations." In this game, players attempt to assemble complete characters by collecting the correct heads, bodies, and feet cards. The more characters collected in this game will help players in the second game.

The second game is called "Turn the board for explorations." In this game, players roll dice to advance on a board towards the goal, planet Uranus. This game is a combination of luck and skill, as the characters that you collected in the first game can allow you to affect the game, such as stealing an opponent's character, or switching positions on the game board.

209696.name: Star Saga: The Eiras Contract
209696.description:
Set in Mantic’s Warpath Universe, Star Saga: The Eiras Contract is a science fiction dungeon crawler for 1-5 players, with optional rules for solo play and co-operative play.

In multiplayer, one player becomes the Nexus Player, who is responsible for controlling the actions of the minions and bosses in the dungeon, all represented by coloured plastic 28mm miniatures. While up to four other players take on the role of mercenaries, again represented by detailed 28mm miniatures.

The mercenaries are controlled alternately and move around a grid-based sci-fi dungeon complete with computer terminals, narrow corridors and storage lockers to search for new equipment, which can then be used to upgrade the characters' abilities.

Combat features an opposed dice roll between the Nexus Player and the Mercenaries using custom dice. The game features a number of different story-led scenarios detailing the exploits of the mercenaries as they venture deeper into the dungeon.

209697.name: Förbjuden Zon: brädspel efter undergången
209697.description: Förbjuden Zon is a dystopic semi-cooperative board game, with a Stockholm setting. From the start of the game is good for the players to cooperate with the other players, but in the end of the game it is better to steal items from them. The board has four special sectors: Tunnels, Junkyard, Ark, and Mekano. You can only visit those one time in each game. The players need to pass through all of these. A player can be one of five characters in the game, who is better or worse at the four abilities (negotiate, habit, technology, and combat). The players roll two D6 and moves, draws Ruin card, one event cards and then a item card. Each item card has a "treasure value" from 1-3. If a player lose of lifepoints he is out of the game. The winner is the player that can escape "the zone", the board, with most total value on item cards.

209698.description:
The Red Artefact promo cards are composed of 1 survival card, 1 hunt card and 1 new place card.

The survival and the hunt cards may be added to their respective stack.

The new place card is a new version of the artefact and replaces the one of the basic game.
209698.name: Not Alone: The Red Artefact Promo

209700.description:
Description from the publisher:

Epic Roll: Eclipse is the first stand-alone expansion for the Epic Roll series, combining a dice-based battle system with card effects and character abilities.

Eclipse challenges players to don their black hats (helms and cowls are also acceptable) and lead the forces of evil against the Paladin King and his loyal followers. Make your friends jealous and your parents proud(ish) by being the first to plunge the kingdom into darkness. Trampling do-gooders on your way to victory is only part of the fun…further enjoyment comes as you thwart the efforts of your fellow players and spoil their dreams of glory. All while grinning behind steepled fingers.

Eclipse allows 2-3 players to compete in games averaging 15-30 minutes. Combined with the original Epic Roll, games expand to support up to 6 players, competing in teams or individually (with 6 players, expect games to last 40-60 minutes)
209700.name: Epic Roll: Eclipse
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 70: Thursday, September 29th

209701.description:
Two small punch boards, one with the first two Heroes of the Labyrinth (Ariane and the Minotaur), the other with counters for Provinces at War (5), the Statue of Zeus peace (2), and Odysseus (Ulysses).

The German Kickstarter edition also includes the third Hero of the Labyrinth (Theseus). English Kickstarter subscribers also received Theseus.
209701.name: Mare Nostrum: Empires Kickstarter Exclusives

209702.name: Games Unplugged (Issue 8 - June 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Behind the Mask: The Making of the Legend of Zorro
Tanks, planes and Artillery, Oh My!
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (2nd Edition)
209702.description:
From the cover:

Top 25 Most Influential People in the Adventure Game Market

Gropos Arrives
Tanks, Planes, Artillery, Oh My!

Behind the Mask
The Legend Becomes an RPG

Lancers Impalling the Market

209703.name: Games Unplugged (Issue 9 & 10 - July/Aug 2001)
209703.description:
From the cover:

Free RUNE ENCOUNTER by Atlas Games

8 Pages of Fiction by Maragaret Weis & Tracy Hickman

35 Hot NEW Summer Products

Plus
ZOMBIES!!!
Need Your Brain!!!

GEN CON Special Double Issue

SnarfQuest ECG
Designer Notes

Richard Garfield
Interview

Series Archer
Sneak Preview

Zero-G
Action Toy TCG

The Omerta Men
The Mafia RPG

209704.name: Cryptomancer
209704.description:
Back Cover:
Cryptomancer is a tabletop role-playing game made for hackers, by hackers. It features an original fantasy setting and gameplay informed by diverse security disciplines: information security, physical security, intelligence analysis, clandestine tradecraft, and risk management. Players assume the role of characters on the run from a shadowy organization that rules the world through mass surveillance, propaganda, and political coercion.

Explore a rich fantasy setting connected by the Shardscape, the magical equivalent of the Internet
Attack and defend fantasy networks built upon real networking and cryptography principles
Build up your safehouse and manage covert cells of spies, scouts, political agitators, and assassins
Customize your character with dozens of talents and spells emphasizing stealth, deception, and creative problem-solving

Kill all the orcs, hack all the things!

209705.name: Discworld Roleplaying Game
209705.description:
Publisher blurb:

Journey through the off-kilter imagination of Sir Terry Pratchett in the Discworld Roleplaying Game.

There's a lot of unusual stuff on the Disc, but don't worry about getting lost – game author Phil Masters has crafted a roadmap to Pratchett-inspired storytelling.

Visit settings like the most dubious city in the multiverse, Ankh-Morpork. Intervene in the cultural interactions of trolls and dwarves (but watch out for flying axes). Campaign for goblin rights. Flee from an angry Swamp Dragon (two feet of mindless fury and high-explosive digestion). Even find out why the why the second-greatest lover on the Disc needs a stepladder.

And remember, the world is round. And also flat.

This is a complete roleplaying game. You need no other books to play. It includes the material from the previous edition of the game and its supplement, Discworld Also — all of it updated to reflect the events of the Discworld novels released since then, as well as the rules of GURPS Fourth Edition.

209706.name: Hundreds of Wonderous Wands
209706.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set of random tables will give you over 400 answers to the question “So what does that magic wand look like?” Just grab a d20 and a d6 (just in case) and see what you've got!

User summary:

Includes two d20 random tables (construction materials; decorations).

209707.name: Sci-fi Random Encounter Tables
209707.description:
User summary:

A series of random tables to support traveling into unexplored space. These tables are derived from the Chaos 6010 A.D. rule books but are advertised as suitable for use in any science fiction setting or system.

209708.description:
Special Committee is a bluffing and hidden identity game featuring current US politicians.

Each player has two concealed Senator Cards. Players need to pass legislation that is important to their own Senators; HOWEVER, if other players figure out both of your Senators, and correctly accuse you, you're out of the game.

The game has similarities to both Machi Koro and Coup. Machi Koro, because players pass Legislation Cards that then give them returns (in the form of votes, favors and coins) on certain dice rolls, and Coup because of the two concealed characters in each players hand.
209708.name: Special Committee
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode #32 – Special Committee

209709.name: Tyrannosapien
209709.description:
From the introduction:

There is no dishonor in fleeing from this howling, dinosaur-like humanoid. Problem is, it’s faster than most of your post-apocalyptic heroes. Ravenous, solitary, smart and swift, the dreaded Tyrannosapien can appear as a normally deadly variant or with one or more nasty mutations. It is an almost perfect hunter, and in an age of nightmarish monsters, this enormous horror has few equals.

209710.name: Alpha Blue Quickie
209710.description:
Publishers' blurb:

[Alpha Blue Quickie] contains the new and improved character sheet for Alpha Blue - the sleaziest space pulp RPG in the entire galaxy, as well as a couple hi-rez starships mapped out for virtual use or printable for home use.

User summary:

The two-sided character sheet is intended for print-and-play use. It is provided as four JPG files: the front and back of the sheet, in one format with parchment background and one format with printer-friendly (white) background. Also includes two JPG files of high resolution spaceship maps.

209711.name: Trick or Treat
209711.description:
Trick or Treat is a micro card game about pressing your luck to grab as much candy as possible before too many Trick cards show up. This is a SHORT micro Print and Play game for 1 to any number of players.

Description of a turn:
1. Shuffle the deck.
2. Draw a Card
3. Keep Treat cards and return Trick cards to the deck.
REPEAT steps 2-3 until you decide to quit or you lose. Then pass to the next player.
You gain 1 point for each Treat card that you take and you lose the game when you have drawn any Trick card 3 times.
Objective: Press your luck and see who can grab more candy!

209712.description:
With Rattus: Academicus, an expansion for the Rattus base game, you can upgrade the base characters to make their actions even more powerful!

The added universities and event cards provide even more diversity to the game.
209712.name: Rattus: Academicus

209713.name: Flitting Bad Wolf
209713.description:
Big Bad Wolf is so annoying! No one wants to be his neighbor! People start to move around in the town to stay away from him. Will you be lucky enough to live happily ever after — or end up being annoyed by the Big Bad Wolf for the rest of your life?

Flitting Bad Wolf is a microgame of deduction and bluffing. Players try to get the most valuable cards while avoiding a visit from the Big Bad Wolf! On a player's turn, they may choose to (1) offer a hand card to the opponent (who may refuse), or (2) play a card and execute the ability. Players alternate turns until no one has any cards in hand, and the round scoring takes place. The game is played for a number of rounds until one player has scored 11 or more points to become the winner.

209714.description:
SHOOT is a turn-based game about capturing the flag and returning it home to your base.

You can use any miniature character you may have. The miniature character becomes your HERO which you move around via card lengths on a map you create out of everyday items.

You start from your base and fight your way through the map, using line of sight, collecting weapons and gadgets along your way.

When you die, you re-enter the game from your base and fight on.
209714.name: Splatter SHOOT
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG-EXTRA 3: Spiel 2016 Deel 1

209715.name: Sack of Moustaches
209715.description:
The game contains 25 plastic moustaches with hooked ends.

Pick up a moustache and hook one end around the end of a second moustache. Now hook your second moustache to a third. Make the longest chain of moustaches without dropping any and win!

209716.name: Edgar & Lucien
209716.description:
Welcome to Fosko, a city full of opportunities for the daring, a merciless universe where you shall make your way to the top. There, you will impersonate a pair of characters who will try to gain control of the city by successfully achieving three of the four victory conditions available. You move each of your characters from district to district to accomplish your goals, hoping that your opponents do not see it coming too quickly. You may choose to become rich, powerful, or both; to fiddle just a little or to do it a lot; and to let your friends carry out their own plans…or not!

Your unlikely duo in Edgar & Lucien consists of a puppet and a human:


Lucien, the wooden and political man, is loved by the people and envied by his peers. His strength lies in his natural eloquence and talent for diplomacy.
Edgar, the brain, sly and cunning, is always ready to get into any kinds of shenanigans to bring his and his partner's projects to fruition.


Working together, they try to take control over the city and build your own legend.

In more detail, each player must manage their two characters to gain control over the city and win the game. Everybody programs their movement secretly and simultaneously, then uses the action for each of their characters. Lucien, as a politician, rallies the people and extends his influence on the board, while Edgar chases other Luciens and tries to set up shenanigans. You win by combining three victory conditions (with four possible) that measure your capacity to extend your influence, make a lot of money, and be popular to the people. Find your own way to take over Fosko!

209717.name: Aye
209717.description:
Aye is a cooperative pirate board game where the player will the crew of a ship under attack by a Kraken. One player will assume the role of captain and will be in charge of planning the round strategy, while the other players (the crew) will execute that strategy to try and complete four different missions: fire cannons, attack with swords, set sails and navigate away from the Kraken. As the mission unfolds, players will win and lose reputation and, if the captain's reputation is to low, crew members with high reputation will be able to declare a mutiny to nominate a new captain of the ship.

Aye is a dice rolling game with a high social component and push-your-luck mechanics. It has 12 custom dice which are dealt by the captain to the players, who will roll them to complete the missions. But receiving damage and losing to much reputation can make you lose those dice.

209718.name: Forgotten Battles: The Overloon Campaign
209718.description: Forgotten Battles is a low to moderate complexity game on the largest tank battle fought in The Netherlands during World War II. The Allied Market-Garden offensive in September ended in a frustrating loss and the Germans occupying a salient in the Allied lines east of Nijmegen. Seeking to destroy the German threat that was centered on the crucial crossroads town of Overloon, as well as possibly resuming the drive to the Rhine, the British 2nd Army launched a series of offensives that took place throughout the last week of September and the first three weeks of October. The battles that occurred were often fought in torrential rains and marked by heavy casualties on all sides. Can you do as well or better?

209719.description:
After an Environmental Crisis, Human kind left the Earth to its doom. Now, they have developed the means to time travel and save the earth by completing 12 time-changing missions.

Takyon is a time travel game in which players will have to adjust time to try and gather religious, cultural, scientific, warfare, environmental and future technologies, so they can bring them to other places in time and space. The game missions can be of the kind of giving nuclear bombs to French Revolutionaries or teach the Roman Empire the ways of Pastafarianism!

In this strategic worker placement game, each change to the time continuum will create a paradox that can block a continent for further time travel, until it is cleaned (or it has so many paradoxes it is blocked permanently). With their time machine pieces, the players will be able to perform actions like move time, move the agents between continents, sell technologies to the Time Museum, clean Paradoxes, acquire new missions o gather future technologies. Moving time will affect all players simultaneously, as their time machines are time-locked.

The game can end in either of these conditions: all players have completed 12 missions overall, which will trigger final scoring to declare a winner, or if three continents get permanently blocked due to an excess in paradoxes, in which case all players will lose and the Earth will be erased from hist...
209719.name: Takyon

209720.name: Curious Creatures
209720.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore the Wild Side of New Europa!

From the darkest jungles of Africa to the rooftops of London, animals are everywhere in New Europa. Curious Creatures offers a glimpse into the less civilized side of Castle Falkenstein, drawing out into the light the marvelous, the monstrous, and the mythic for your edification and delight. Brought to you from across the Faerie Veil and written by one of the most knowledgeable naturalists of all time, the reader will find within these pages:

A bestiary offering in-depth analysis of over thirty new creatures as well as statistics for their inclusion in your Adventure Entertainment.
New and clarified rules for the use of creatures of all types in your Adventure Entertainment.
A new Magick lorebook as well as insight into the existence of sorcerous familiars in New Europa.
Details on Sphinxes, a potentially sinister power operating from the shadows.
Rules on choosing a True Unicron, Beast Folk, or wild Child as a Dramatic Character.
Dinosaurs!
New Dramatic and Host Characters to enliven any event set in the Age of Steam.
A new tale of heroics and adventure set in a land where fiction, fantasy, and history collide!




All this and more can be found in this volume. Curious Creatures is the definitive bestiary for all enthusiasts of Castle Falkenstein.

209721.name: The Tarot Variation
209721.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Alternative Sorcery Deck for Castle Falkenstein

In the Tarot Variation, the ordinary deck of playing cards used for the Sorcery Deck is replaced with a Tarot Deck. Over the centuries the Tarot Deck has been used both for playing games and for divination and, because of this, these colorful cards, rich with imagery and symbolism, can perfectly represent a more robust and fascinating Magick. With a Tarot Deck, Magic in Castle Falkenstein becomes more than just a form of energy divided into four types but a living, breathing thing with whims and purposes of Its own.

209722.name: The Relentless Corpse Sect
209722.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Endless Grudge of Relentless Corpse Sect

The Relentless Corpse Sect is a new Martial Sect for the Wandering Heroes of Ogre Gate roleplaying game. Relentless Corpse Queen rules her sect with an iron-fist, using an insidious venom to turn her admirers into slave-disciples. Aided by her sister and her sister's husband, she is bent on revenge against the people who murdered her father and stole his River Flowing Sword. Once a righteous and respected martial sect, they are now the most notorious and feared clan in all the martial world.

This PDF includes stats for members of the Relentless Corpse Sect, new poisons, Kung Fu Techniques and weapons. It is designed to be dropped into any campaign as needed.

209723.name: Soulknives III
209723.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take your soulknife into new prestige classes with this third installment of Psionics Augmented: Soulknives for the iconic blade wielder from Ultimate Psionics!

Contained in the pages of Psionics Augmented: Soulknives III are new prestige classes for the soulknife class, including the marvel, the primarch, and the strategos.

Whether harnessing their psychic ability to fly, or tapping into elemental energy, or utilizing the power of the collective, soulknives gain all-new options in this latest release in our Psionics Augmented line!

209724.name: Bard Spells II (PRD)
209724.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Bard Spells is a simple document that collects the bard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 2nd-level bard spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

209725.name: Bard Spells II (3PP)
209725.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Bard Spells is a simple document that collects the bard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 2nd-level bard spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

209726.description: The world of Zombicide: Black Plague is as dangerous as it is immersive. The Plastic Token pack takes players one step further into that world. Matching all of the tokens in the game with suped-up components. players will be drawn in like never before. The sculpted Broken Wall works perfectly with the Abominotaur from the Zombie Bosses: Abomination Pack.
209726.name: Zombicide: Black Plague – Plastic Token Pack

209727.description:
Is there anything more terrifying than a closed door in Zombicide: Black Plague?

What horrors lie behind it?
What is that gurgling noise it's barely muffling?

The 3D Doors Pack contains 27 doors with 3 different designs to keep players' adventures looking fresh. Containing more doors than required in the base game, players get a variety to keep them stocked up for future expansions. The doors don't just stand upright creating a visual barrier on the board, they'll also swing open when Survivors have gained access to the other side!
209727.name: Zombicide: Black Plague – 3D Doors

209728.description:
Description from the publisher:

When one reporter's sensational news about a series of savage killings fails to make its way into the Arkham Advertiser, your friend at that establishment decides to contact you, nonetheless, deeming the reports the sort of thing that might suit your eccentric curiosities. She's right, of course, and when you head to Northside Station to book your ticket for New Orleans, you can't possibly imagine the full shape of the horrors that await you…

Designed to be played as a standalone adventure, or added to your campaign as a "side-story," Curse of the Rougarou sends you along a bone-chilling hunt through New Orleans and the bayous of southern Louisiana. Its 62 cards come with all the rules, locations, act, agenda, and encounter cards that you'll need to immerse yourself in a mystery full of malign spirits, murderous beasts, and other hazards—some natural and some decidedly unnatural.
209728.name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Curse of the Rougarou – Scenario Pack
boardgamefamily: Arkham Horror: The Card Game LCG
boardgamepodcastepisode: MN 0143 Arkham Horror the Card Game

209729.description:
Description from the publisher:

Neolithic: Advanced Cultures is an expansion for Neolithic.

This expansion introduces new Tasks, brand new cards (and card types), and new ways to play Neolithic, including solo play.

Dedicated Forage cards add additional paths to streamline Village scoring strategies and boosted Task turns. While a new, revolving card pool changes the cards that are available each game, adding additional variety and replayability to Neolithic.
209729.name: Neolithic: Advanced Cultures

209730.name: Tiny Epic Galaxies: Beyond The Black – Drones Mini Expansion
209730.description: The Drones Mini Expansion to Tiny Epic Galaxies: Beyond The Black introduces Drones, which integrates with the pilots, and includes six additional pilot cards.

209731.name: Engineer's Guide
209731.description:
From publisher blurb:

StarCluster 4 Toolbox 4 is a tool designed to let you create and control every system and subsystem of the starships and stations for your StarCluster 4 Game. Unlike Toolbox 3, Toolbox 4 is math heavy and incredibly detailed, but you can do whatever you want, at the price of detailed calculations. You can create:

Tech Level 7, 8, 9 and 10 ships - not just TL 10
Arbitrary sized ships - not limited to certain hull sizes
Armed military ships - not limited to just unarmed civilian ships
Matter-Antimatter Drives - for enormous power
Atomic space drives like Orion and Nerva types

209732.name: Stellaris: Plantoids Species Pack
209732.description:
The Plantoids Species Pack adds a plant-like species to the game featuring: fifteen new species portraits, new templates for plantoid civilian and military ships, and new cityscape art.

(Source: Publisher blurb (https://www.paradoxplaza.com/stellaris-plantoids-species-pac...)

209733.name: Stellaris: Leviathans Story Pack
209733.description:
Leviathans is a story pack DLC featuring new events, new encounters, options, material, music and sounds.

Source: The Developer Website.

209734.name: Conflicting Legends
209734.description:
Conflicting Legends is an epic war of Rock-Paper-Scissors in which the fate of the world lies in your hands. You will develop civilizations and conquer lands with all of the great people in history at your disposal. Will your name go down in history as a famous emperor or as a subjugated loser? It's all determined by Rock-Paper-Scissors!

In Conflicting Legends, players may conquer new lands with their forces or develop the lands with culture or technology to gain glory points. Whoever conquers all six continents or wins ten or more glory points will be declared the winner. The key to victory is to attack opponents' lands and resolve the conflict by casting Rock-Paper-Scissors. With the special abilities of various great people in the history, RPS has never been so much fun!

209735.name: Baby Blues: Little Angels
209735.description:
6 promo cards for the Baby Blues game.

Every player gets one card, devil side up.

When you trade a card with another player you have an opportunity to flip your card to the angel side when you make an honest trade. Though this is only possible outside your turn (so you need to help the active player to become an angel).

When the angel side is visible the player receives a few benefits:


At the end of your turn you can draw up to 6 cards if the angel side is still visible.
During your turn you are allowed to play 2 negative cards instead of 1.


But you don't stay an angel forever...


When you lie about the card you trade when the angel is visible you must immediately flip your card to the devil side.
Also when you decide to play 2 two negative cards in one turn, you must immediately flip your card to the devil side. At the end of this turn, you only draw up to five cards again.

209736.name: Rebel Times (Issue 108 - Sep 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Bez zasad nie ma gry, a bez graczy reguły nic nie znaczą
Maky Chemik z Kulkami: Dr. Eureka
Słodka nić Ariadny, czyli po nitce do kłębka

209737.name: The Fairy Game
209737.description:
The Fairy Game - A Matching Game of Flowers and Fairy Magic! Watch out Fairies! Mr. Winter is trying to freeze over the fairies' treasured flowers! In this game from the award-winning design team at Peaceable Kingdom, players work together to match fairy cards and gather the hidden magic gems before 4 snowflakes land on one flower. Work together to fill the fairies' magic wand and banish Mr. Winter from the garden!

On a player's turn, they draw a card for their hand. If at any point they have 3 fairies of the same color they can move that color gem to the wand. Other cards allow for players to trade fairies or remove snowflakes. Also available to be drawn is the Mr. Winter card which requires the player to immediately add a snowflake to a flower. The players win if they move all four of the gems to the wand before Mr. Winter adds four snowflakes to any one flower.

209738.name: Derelict
209738.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Derelict, 3-8 players are exploring an abandoned space ship. What is the purpose of the ship, and the rooms that the crew discover along the way? That is yet to be discovered. But with a bit of knowledge and some luck, you may be able to survive.

Derelict is a tile exploration, worker placement board game for 3-8 players. Players work together to explore the derelict ship and gain resources along the way. At some point in the game, the purpose of the ship becomes clear. At that point, it is everyone for themselves as they try to escape.

With dozens of scenarios, Derelict can be played again and again, and each time will be different.

209739.name: TAKARO: The Anagram Exchange Game
209739.description:
Description from the publisher:

TAKARO is the fast-paced anagram exchange game where players earn points by using game tiles to spell words and then exchange those tiles with the other team to spell a completely new set of words.

In round 1, each team draws any combination of 10 game tiles – consonants and vowels. Teams then roll the dice and choose a designated number of additional game tiles. To boost their scores, teams may decide to select a Power Vowel tile. This tile can be used to earn 10 additional points each round if used. When the round starts, teams will spell as many words as they can within five minutes.

At the completion of round 1, teams exchange all of their game tiles with the other team. In round 2, teams must spell unique words using the other team’s game tiles. Teams may not repeat words from round 1. The highest cumulative score wins!

209740.name: Nidhogg II
209740.description:
User Summary






UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




The sequel to Nidhogg, featuring an all-new art style.

209741.description:
Rekindle the flames of faith first stirred up in Avignon: a Clash of Popes. The standalone expansion Avignon: Pilgrimage introduces new ways to push and pull your way to Pope, even more characters with new powers that change with their position, and alternate setups that create even more variety. Play Pilgrimage by itself or combine it with the powers from A Clash of Popes to add new levels of strategy and tactics while preserving the quick and accessible gameplay of the original.

Pilgrimage is a stand-alone expansion to Avignon that introduces six new Characters, abilities differ than those in Avignon: A Clash of Popes. Gameplay is like that of the original Avignon, using the characters' unique powers to pull the character cards over to their side of the table (their congregation), or force an opponent to push cards towards them. The first player to get three characters into their congregation wins.

Avignon: Pilgrimage will also feature alternate setup options that add additional strategy and tactics while still preserving the quick, accessible game play of the original Avignon game.
209741.name: Avignon: Pilgrimage
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode #44 – ButtonShy Wallet Series, 2017 Quarter 1
Episode 193

209742.name: 20 Dungeon Starters
209742.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This book collects 20 "dungeon starters"; sets of prompts and cues for kicking off a Dungeon World adventure with no prep. Each starter is comprised of two pages that contain all of the impressions, custom moves, discoveries, dangers, and special rules you need to run it.

209743.name: The Copper Crown
rpgseries: The Chronicle of the Copper Canyon
209743.description:
From the distributor's website:

A nation on the run. A homeland ravaged and barren. To stay would mean certain death. Going back is only considered by the foolish and those who have vowed to die on their native soil. Under these circumstances the people must be considered blessed to have such an amazingly beautiful, abundantly rich, so warmly welcoming destination ahead – Ambria, the promised land of Queen Korinthia.

You are but one of many who have travelled across the snow-clad passes of the Titans. You have set foot in your new homeland, but there is still much to learn. The journey continues to Thistle Hold, the town of explorers and treasure hunters bordering the great forest of Davokar. From there it continues out into the forest, brooding on ruins and powerful artifacts from the golden days of Symbaroum. It will be a journey that will make you see the world and yourself with new eyes, provided that you reach the end of the road with eyes to see and with life left to live ...

The Copper Crown features two independent sequels to the tutorial adventure included in the Core Rulebook and is meant to provide players and Game Masters with more advanced guidelines regarding the rules and game world of Symbaroum. The first adventure, The Mark of the Beast, deals with different kinds of problem-solving and introduces the players to the town of Thistle Hold. And in the second adventure, Tomb of Dying Dreams, the Game Master gets an example on how to design a so called adventure landscape, while the players finally get to venture out in the vast Davokar Forest. All in all, it will undoubtedly be a journey to remember!

Aside from the adventures, the Chronicle of the Copper Crown includes:

- 7 mystical artifacts

- A handful of color maps to explore

- A dozen handouts of letters, notes and map sketches

- More than 20 NPCs and creatures

- New rules in the form of rituals, traits and elixirs

- And much more to add …

209744.description:
Description from the publisher:

Croopo is a fun, strategic, two-person trading card game where players battle each other by carefully choosing Creature, Power-up, and Terrain cards, and rolling dice to determine the outcome of each turn.

Croopo can be enjoyed by kids as young as six years old, and by adults of all ages. For younger kids, rules may be modified for simplification, for example, by omitting Terrain or Power-up cards from the deck.

Each game takes around 30 minutes. All you need to play Croopo are two decks of cards (one for each player) and two six-sided dice. A game board is also available to help beginners place cards correctly. Players can build custom decks by choosing different combinations of cards from their collection in order to develop new strategies of game play.
209744.name: Croopo: The Trading Card Game

209745.name: Haturan's Tomb
209745.description:
From the introduction:

After many days of travel you have reached the gates of Dyvers. You have come here in search of adventure, to have a place where you can spend your gold and have a good time at it. Having come across the Velverdyva from the direction of Furyondy you approach the Gate of the Dragon, Dyvers’ most western gate. As you draw nearer you can see the enormous gate, towering above the city walls with its 30-foot height and 20 foot width. The two huge wooden ironbound double doors of the gate are open. At each side of the gate an image of a dragon curves upward, carved out from the stone, meeting its counterpart at the apex of the gate, their snouts almost touching. Between the snouts of the creatures is the shield device of Dyvers, the tritower.

User summary:

For 6th to 12th level characters.

209746.name: Items in a Wizard's Chamber
209746.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A simple 1D100 chart of items you may find in a Wizard's chamber. It is meant to help Gamemasters add flavor text to their adventures.

209747.name: Ambria and Davokar Map
209747.description:
From the distributor's website:

When setting up for adventures in the world of Symbaroum, start by spreading this double-sided, high quality print map across the table. The map is of the size A2 (or 16.5 x 23.4 inches) and shows the world of Symbaroum and the town of Thistle Hold in great detail.

On one side is the map of Symbaroum’s game world. The borders of the barbarian clan territories and Ambria’s duchies are shown, along with the main traveling routes of Queen Korinthia’s realm. Of course, it also displays the name and location of many rivers, settlements and already discovered ruins.

On the back is a detailed city map of Thistle Hold, including street names and important establishments – something you can hardly do without if you plan to spend some time in the town of Mayor Nightpitch!

209748.description: In Find Your Seats, players take the roles of party planners having a terrible day. They have completely misplaced their seating plan! Each player will start with a hand of cards representing dinner guests and, over three rounds, draft what they believe to be the best group of guests to sit next to each other. Players score points based on the seating arrangement of their guests. The player with the most points in a round wins the round, the player with the most round-wins will win the game.
209748.name: Find Your Seats
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode #44 – ButtonShy Wallet Series, 2017 Quarter 1
Episode 193

209749.name: La Muerte
209749.description:
La Muerte has a job: kill people that has finished their time on Earth.

But not everyone wants to die. Some people try to run. But La Muerte don't give up.

La Muerte starts the game with Wrath value 1. Every card has a "Run" and "Wrath" values. In your turn, you can play until 3 cards and sum the Run value to be equal or greater than La Muerte's Wrath. If you run, La Muerte get's more anger and its Wrath value is increased, according with the played cards. If you can't, you died. As ghost, you only increment La Muerte's Wrath, and helps it to kill!

When only one player is alive, he/she has one turn to stay alive and win! But if La Muerte, with the ghosts' help, kills this last player, nobody wins, except La Muerte!!

209750.description:
In Manimals: Zoo Leipzig, which features animals found in that particular zoo, players compete to find as many animals as possible with a certain characteristic. To start play, shuffle the animal cards, then spread forty of them on the table so that everyone can see them. Flip over one card, see the characteristic identified on this card, then race to pick up all animals that feature this characteristic. Once everyone has finished picking up cards, check all the cards collected to see whether anyone made a mistake; if so, that player must return the mistaken card and one correctly collected card.

Players repeat this process six more times, first laying out three more cards from the deck each time, then they see who has collected the most cards and won!

Manimals: Zoo Leipzig includes rule variants that allow for play with children as young as four, and for each copy of Manimals sold, Adlung-Spiele will donate fifty cents to "für den Freundes- und Förderverein des Zoo Leipzig e. V." for animal protection.
209750.name: Manimals: Zoo Leipzig

209751.name: Arrass
209751.description:
In Arrass, players quickly count how many parts of the parrot are the same on two revealed cards, then lay the appropriate number card down on the table as quickly as possible. The quickest player to lay down the right number card is awarded points, and the player with the most points wins.

Arrass includes rule variants allowing for players as young as four to compete.

209752.name: NextPress
209752.description: In NextPress, all players reveal cards simultaneously each round, with the cards having letters on them. As soon as a player discovers a word, they call out and claim it on their victory pile — but because all visible letters are allowed to be used by all players in future rounds, the topmost card on each victory pile is not safe from being stolen!

209753.name: Speemo
209753.description: Find all the necessary ingredients as quickly as you can in the speedy memory game Speemo, and hurry! The guests are hungry! Whoever prepares the most meals wins!

209754.name: Turn A-Round
209754.description: In Turn A-Round, players lay their cards simultaneously in such a way as to have more of their own colored cards showing than those of their neighbors. But watch out! You are not allowed to lay cards on your own colored cards!

209755.name: The Netbook of Traps
209755.description:
A Resource for Fantasy Role Playing Games

From the introduction:

Welcome to the Netbook of Traps. This netbook has been created to help effectively utilize traps in their adventures and campaigns. Herein you will find all manner of traps to inflict upon your players to cause them anxiety, frustration, and ultimately satisfaction as they overcome the obstacles put before them. There is also advice and optional material to assist with the creation, adaptation and placement of traps.

209756.name: Arcane Warfare Excel 10
209756.description:
Arcane Warfare Excel 10 (AWE 10) are rules for miniature wargaming in the Antiquity, from 300BC to 500AD.

They are the latest evolution of the Arcane Warfare Project, run by Jerboa Wargames.

AWE 10 is a miniatures game without randomizers, like dice, cards or equivalent, instead it is a true mind game.
The rules have been developed using 15mm miniatures on 40mm frontage bases.
Each base represents a cohort size unit, that can fight independently of as part of a large formation, a phalanx.
The game is played over rectangular templates, by default 20x10cm, but areas of 10x10cm and 30x10cm are also used.
A battle with 32-34 bases per side can be conformably concluded within 90 minutes.

Features

Fast play
Basic armies around 32 stands
Scalable
New miniatures combat system based on choice/reaction
Decisive combat
Combat Tiles concept
Decided by player skill
Unforgiving
Handicap system




No dice, rulers, cards, bookkeeping or written orders.

Requirements: rectangle templates; magnetic sheet and metal steel paper, such as those found in hobby stores.

Out now!

209757.name: You are standing in a cave...
209757.description:
Author Blurb:

... you do not know how you got here. The last thing you remember is going out to eat at a fancy restaurant. Perhaps you were drugged. Perhaps you had a bad case of food poisoning and wandered off, feverish, into the outskirts of town. Whatever the case may be, you are here now. Wherever here is. And you want to leave.

This game started as a VGG PbF game, which can be found here: You are standing in a cave... and was later turned into a true IF game for the 2016 IF Competition.

209758.name: A (More) Complete Guide to the Aligned Outer Planes
209758.description:
From the introduction:

My inspiration to make this work was mainly the fact that the "Planar Cosmographical Tables" in Planes of Conflict, supposedly the most complete official reference to the Realms, Sites, and Towns of the Planes seemed incomplete. Realms were on it that had never been detailed.

209759.name: Paladin of Ethdale
209759.description:
From the introduction:

The people of Ethdale are ardent followers of Tyr. For over a thousand years, a Paladin of Tyr has been sitting on the throne. The temple of Tyr has a major presence in the city and plays a heavy role in administrating the affairs of Ethdale. The city has been peaceful for many years and the people in the city have become complacent in the service to Tyr. They believed that they were blessed and this blessing would never be taken away. As such, they slowly became more debaucherous and unjust, believing that they could do nothing wrong.

User summary:

For 2nd - 4th level characters. Typically distributed as a ZIP archive including the RTF scenario and two BMP files (maps).

209760.name: Planescape Monstrous Compendium
209760.description:
User summary:

This netbook is patterned after the commercially published Monstrous Compendium Planescape Appendix in format, "stat block", and content. It includes dozens of fan-created monsters suitable for use in Planescape. Most entries include an illustration.

209761.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 492 - Oct 2016)
rpgissuearticle: This Isn't the 'Zine You're Looking For

209762.name: 20 Real Diseases and their Effects
209762.description:
From the introduction:

The diseases on this table all actually exist. The symptoms, contagiousness and untreated mortality rates are estimated based on World Health Organization statistics, so roll a d20 and see what happens!

209763.name: Fifty Shades of Thay
209763.description:
Heroes of Darkness

From the introduction:

In the north lay the desolation that was once Netheril, and ever-growing magocracy of Thay. Most people think of them as looming shadows of everlasting evil. However, dark magic practitioners across the globe envy these international superpowers for their malefic innovations. Now their secrets are yours! Within this article you will find races, feats, and spells that all benefit from intimate knowledge of the renewed Shadow Weave.

209764.name: Secretum Secretorum
209764.description:
From the introduction:

A collection of 36 arcane and divine spells
...
Some of the following spells are original spells. Other are converted, reimagined, or adapted from previous editions and other RPGs.

209765.name: You Can Try!
209765.description:
Tips on Becoming a Better Dungeon Master

From the introduction:

This is a collection of thoughts and ideas from 30+ years spent playing D&D and other tabletop RPGs as both player and referee. They’re things that have worked for me, made my games infinitely better. This is not to say I’m some Genius Wizard DM of Awesome. It’s just to say I’ve been doing this a long time. It’s to say that I was terrible at DMing when I started, I’ve learned a thing or two about what works and what doesn’t, and if you can learn something from that, well, here you go. Maybe you try some. Maybe not. If any of this helps you be a better DM, we can call it a win. The biggest caveat is that this is stuff that works for me. It might not work for you. That’s okay!

209766.name: Immersion Tables
209766.description:
From the introduction:

The mulberry trees are so thick you almost missed the tavern. But once inside, you smell the onion sautéed lamb being served up with dates. !e only thing sweeter is the fresh, hot honey cakes that follow it to your table.

User summary:

A series of random tables to generate atmosphere, focused on trees, food, tomes, and names.

209767.name: RPG Review (Issue 28 & 29 - Sep/Dec 2015)
209767.description:
RPG Review
Issue #28 - 29
The Undead Double Issue
September - December 2015

209769.name: RPG Review (Issue 31 - Jun 2016)
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

209770.name: GOLPH
209770.description: Similar to Six Card Golf. This game is played with 9 cards that start face down in 3 rows of 3. At the beginning of game play one card is upturned (any card). On your turn you can take a new card from the draw pile or one that has already been discarded. There are cards ranging from -3 to 9, a few wild cards & also a lose your turn & a reverse order card. The object of the game is to have the least amount of points. If you get 3 cards in a row (diagonal, horizontal or vertical) all 3 cards count as 0 no matter what their face value. Game ends when one player has all 9 of their cards face up.

209772.description:
Immerse yourself in the world of James Bond.

This set contains 600 questions and answers on 100 cards from the following categories:

- Cast & Characters
- The Films
- Vehicles
- Gadgets & Weapons
- Locations
- Crew / Behind the Scenes

This set can be used as an expansion along with any Trivial Pursuit base game.
209772.name: Trivial Pursuit: 007 Edition

209773.description:
100 Swords: The Gold King's Dungeon is a sword-based dungeon-crawling micro deck-builder! Load up with as much as you can carry and run head first into the dungeon, exploring rooms and revealing monsters, all while keeping track of hidden treasures and swords!

During play, you must efficiently play the five cards in your hand for any combination of movement, strength, or energy. Movement advances you deeper into the dungeon, allowing you to peek at or reveal the cards along the way. Monsters you find can be defeated only with strength. New items (and swords!) are acquired by spending cards in your hand for energy. Many items have effects that will further expand your tactical options as your deck grows.

As you defeat monsters and pick up loot, do your best to remember where everything is hidden. Treasures and slain monsters are worth gold, so get collecting! Once the dungeon has been thoroughly ransacked, or the boss is defeated, whoever has the most gold wins!

This deck is a standalone dungeon complete with items, monsters, and a Boss — the glorious Gold King. This dungeon has hard hitting monsters and harder hitting swords.
209773.name: 100 Swords: The Gold King's Dungeon

209774.description:
100 Swords: The Silver Queen's Dungeon is a sword-based dungeon-crawling micro deck-builder! Load up with as much as you can carry and run head first into the dungeon, exploring rooms and revealing monsters, all while keeping track of hidden treasures and swords!

During play, you must efficiently play the five cards in your hand for any combination of movement, strength, or energy. Movement advances you deeper into the dungeon, allowing you to peek at or reveal the cards along the way. Monsters you find can only be defeated with strength. New items (and swords!) are acquired by spending cards in your hand for energy. Many items have effects that will further expand your tactical options as your deck grows.

As you defeat monsters and pick up loot, do your best to remember where everything is hidden. Treasures and slain monsters are worth gold, so get collecting! Once the dungeon has been thoroughly ransacked, or the boss is defeated, whoever has the most gold wins!

This deck is a standalone dungeon complete with items, monsters, and a Boss — the sinister Silver Queen. This dungeon has hard hitting monsters and harder hitting swords.
209774.name: 100 Swords: The Silver Queen's Dungeon

209775.description: 100 Swords is a sword based dungeon crawling micro deck builder! The Multi-User Dungeon Expansion or (M.U.D. Expansion) adds support for additional players. (This expansion requires two of the base dungeons to play!)
209775.name: 100 Swords: The Multi-User Dungeon Expansion

209777.name: Lear
209777.description:
Introduction

Lear is a finite territory game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square board. The suggested board sizes are between 7x7 and 10x10 points.


Definitions

To flip a stone means to replace it with a stone of the opposite color.


Play

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On their turn, a player must place a stone of their color on an empty point. If the placement is part of an uninterrupted orthogonal line of stones made of

a) two friendly stones and
b) an uninterrupted line of enemy stones,

said enemy stones are flipped. The two friendly stones can be both at one end of the enemy line or one at each end.

x+oo ... +xoo ... +ooox ... +xxooo

In the first three diagrams above, an x play at + flips the o stones; in the fourth diagram, it doesn't.

The game ends when the board is full. The winner is the player with the highest score. A player's score is the number of stones with their color showing that there are on the board, plus a komi (see below) where appropriate.


Komi

The komi is the number of points which are added to the score of the player who doesn't get to make the last move of the game. To avoid ties, the parity of komi should be different from the parity of the board size. On odd-sized boards, komi should be even and go to White; on even-sized boards, komi should be odd and go to Black.

Before the game starts, the first player tells their opponent the number which will be used as komi, and then the second player chooses which color to play. The player who got black makes the first move of the game.

209778.description:
Description from the publisher:

After being stripped of all their possessions, a mage, a warrior, an elf, and a dwarf are forced to go rob the local Magic Maze shopping mall for all the equipment necessary for their next adventure. They agree to map out the labyrinth in its entirety first, then find each individual’s favorite store, and then locate the exit. In order to evade the surveillance of the guards who eyed their arrival suspiciously, all four will pull off their heists simultaneously, then dash to the exit. That's the plan anyway…but can they pull it off?

Magic Maze is a real-time, cooperative game. Each player can control any hero in order to make that hero perform a very specific action, to which the other players do not have access: Move north, explore a new area, ride an escalator… All this requires rigorous cooperation between the players in order to succeed at moving the heroes prudently. However, you are allowed to communicate only for short periods during the game; the rest of the time, you must play without giving any visual or audio cues to each other. If all of the heroes succeed in leaving the shopping mall in the limited time allotted for the game, each having stolen a very specific item, then everyone wins together.

At the start of the game, you have only three minutes in which to take actions. Hourglass spaces you encounter along the way give you more time. If the sand timer ever completely runs out, all players lose the game: Your loitering has aroused suspicion, and the mall security guards nab you!
209778.name: Magic Maze
boardgamepodcastepisode: [Jeux du mois] Magic Maze et Not Alone

209779.name: Stardust the Super Wizard
209779.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE MOST REMARKABLE MAN THAT EVER LIVED!

Stardust the Super Wizard is a name spoken in hushed whispers throughout the universe, He uses his vast knowledge of interplanetary science and sorcery to monitor all inhabited worlds, and when he finds beings he considers exceptionally evil or vile, he dispenses the justice he feels they deserve. Once you've incurred the wrath of the Super Wizard, you are done for!

Stardust the Super Wizard from NUELOW Games collects six tales from the Golden Age of Comics by one or its most eccentric and erratic creators, Fletcher Hanks. Although he only worked in comics for a brief time during 1939 to 1941, the over-the-top nature of his work left a permanent mark on the emerging artform--and it makes the stories worth reading even today. The "Stardust the Super Wizard" series is where his bizarre story-telling style was most prominantly on display. followed closely by run on the "Fantomah" series (highlights from which are featured in NUELOW's The Three Lives of Fantomah: Mystery Woman of the Jungle.)

In addition to the classic comics, Stardust the Super Wizard contains an extensive OGL d20 System adaptation of the techno-magical devices featured in the comics, as well as an all-new map and description of the base from which Stardust operates. This never-before-published material is by veteran game designer Steve Miller, whose work on Star Wars roleplaying games for two different publishers (West End Games and Wizards of the Coast) and some of the more macabre releases for the Ravenloft game setting, makes him uniquely suited to capture the nature of Hanks' Stardust in game form.

209780.name: Advanced Monster Abilities
209780.description:
From publisher blurb:

Of the several ways to advance a creature, adding racial Hit Dice is the least effective. Giving a creature class levels grants them access to spells, class abilities and massive ability score increases, while applying templates can grant a host of new abilities. When you increase racial Hit Dice, often all you get is an increase in hit points, a better BAB, new feats, and better saves, which a creature given class levels gets as well as all those tasty class abilities.

Increasing racial Hit Dice often gives a creature that is too weak for its CR. There are few if any rules for scaling racial special abilities to keep them challenging for higher level parties. This ebook offers upgrades to the special abilities of 20 core monsters, from the ankheg and black pudding to the gibbering mouther and yeti, enabling the GM to keep those creatures relevant at higher challenge ratings with increased racial Hit Dice.

Grab a copy of this ebook today and use the 80 plus abilities inside to make your creatures unique and more interesting.

Advancement powers is a Creature Powers Sourcebook for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, suitable for GMs and Players of any level.

This material can easily be adapted to fit into any campaign world.

209781.name: The Mind's Eye (HERO)
209781.description:
From publisher blurb:

Students of Psionics, Known as Psions, use the powers of their mind to work extraordinary abilities. They require an iron discipline, and constantly strive to mold heir minds to their greatest potential.

Are you up for the challenge?

Do you have what it takes to be a Psion.

A supplement to introduce Psionics into a Fanstasy Hero Campaign.

209782.name: The Mind's Eye 2 (HERO)
209782.description:
From publisher blurb:

Students of Psionics, known as Psions, use the powers of their minds to work extraordinary abilities. They require an iron discipline and constantly strive to mold their minds to their greatest potential.

This supplement to introduce new psionic abilities to add to your Fantasy Hero Campaign. The Mind’s Eye II contains 26 new Psionic abilities to choose from and comes with PDF and HD files.

209783.name: TITechCorp Equipment Flyer #3
209783.description:
From publisher blurb:

TITechCorp Flyer #3 - Carapace Armor

Are you tired of you agents having inferior weapons?

Tired of you lackeys falling like flies to the superheroes of the world?

Tired of those dim witted Until agents having better equipment than you agents?

Then you have come to the right place here at TITechCorp we are dedicated to creating the best weapons, armor and other equipment money can buy.

So stop by today and pick up the latest blaster or force belt and get a jump on those pesky do-gooders.

And remember your satisfaction is guaranteed or we won’t see you again.

209784.name: Murderthon
209784.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sunday! Sunday! Sunday!

Juicer blood-sports are barbaric, but intensely popular, and it looks like one is coming to the Kingsdale area.

A one-night special event, promising charity funds as well as a fantastic cash prize, draws juicers and other thrill seekers from all around. The Tomorrow Legion is directly invited to send a team, and the need to see what's really going on is great enough that our heroes are sent.

What's really going on is something far, far darker than a merely deadly arena sport.

209785.name: Liminal Power
209785.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Astral Plane. The Ethereal Plane. The Shadow Plane.
Three places between worlds.
Psionic Powers. Psychic Magic. Shadow Loci.
Each a discipline of a liminal master - a being between worlds.
Step through the Border and find your place among them.

Book of Beyond: Liminal Power provides mechanical support for Paizo's occult classes and third party systems like psionics, binding and shadow magic. New Archetypes. Dozens of feats. And new prestige classes for those daring to blend liminal Source Origins with other classes and each other. These prestige classes include:

Astral Antiquarian – A gifted channeler of the awakened potential of artifacts, these characters focus on unlocking a world of psionic and psychic implements. They master techniques of astral infusion to surge their implements temporarily with the energies of the Astral Plane.
Blackblade Breaker – Mastering the entropic elements of negative planar infusion, these warriors learn to shatter shadow versions of themselves, providing their own tactical advantages from flanking to misdirection.
Dreamsealer – A studied master of the energies of body, spirit and mind, the dreamsealer uses healing as an opportunity to enhance the life it finds. Providing wounded allies with seals that unlock new powers and transform their physical being, their powers is amazing as it is fleeting.
Eye of the Storm – Wilders and mages have flirted with the power of Chaos for ages, but the Eye of the Storm welcomes it into their being. Gaining increasingly unstable energies they can’t hope to control forever, these mad savants combine twin Source Origins and live for the unbridled power of their lucid moments.
Gyreblade – Soulknives and other mystic warriors have found ways to awake the weapons of the mind, elemental planes and etheric power. The gyreblade seeks to fuse two of these weapons into one singular form combining the lore of mind and magic into a weapon of endless potential.
Shadowed Packmaster – Mentalists and mages call to the silver sea of the Astral for summoned constructs of crystallized thought or planes like the Ethereal for dream echoes of what is. The Shadowed Packmaster learns to utilize the power of two planes at once, drawing Shadow versions of his own summons as he calls them to form a pack of servitors.
Souldancer – Some mentalists learn the strange art of possessing another creature’s body. The souldancer perfects it learning to migrate from host to host, shifting her friends to less wounded bodies, caging possessing creatures or even to call back the lost to life.
Tribemind – Rare are those whose mind fragments to for other selves, rarer still are those who learn to control this phenomena. The tribemind learns to command their inner multitudes and call upon them in moments of need.
Trinity Mage – Exploiting one of the Great Laws, the trinity mage masters the art of drawing on three distinct power Source Origins learning

209786.name: The Way of Ki (5E)
209786.description:
From publisher blurb:

A bounty of feats and options for using ki, ideal for monks, ninjas, and samurai but including rules for incorporating the use of ki into every character class!

The Way of Ki contains a rule system for integrating ki or spirit energy into any campaign but is particularly well-suited for campaigns set in or journeying to fantasy realms inspired by the Far East and the Asian traditions of martial arts and mysticism. With 60 new ki feats, The Way of Ki contains a wealth of options for increasing the variety and flavor of what not just monks but any class can do with proper focus and meditation on unlocking the mysteries and transcending the natural into the sublime, including new samurai and ninja archetypes to show how fighters and rogues can use the power of mind, body, and spirit to hone their craft to deadly perfection. The power of ki lies in the extension of the self into communion with the universe and its hidden flows, and its secrets are yours to contemplate and yours to master! Grab this 26-page 5th Edition rules supplement today and Make Your Game Legendary!

209787.name: The Guide to the Cult of Shub-Niggurath (Revised)
209787.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vile rites on defiled sites beneath twin gibbous moons,
From howling lairs she bleats and swears within the darkened lunes,
Cleanse your dice and pay the price for this gruesome pdf,
With each page turned ye'll surely learn a new fate worse than death,
The Goddess calls her mates and thralls to shout her whispered prayers,
As fiendish boons spell horrid dooms on bloody 5ft. squares!
From the darkest of the hillside thickets, the decadent followers of Shub-Niggurath perform their evil celebrations when The Stars are Right.

Contained herein are the cult’s forbidden secrets, their debased practices, and a collection of unwholesome allies from beyond the walls of time and space.

This updated and revised edition features:

7 new class archetypes, over a dozen new feats and spells, new items, Monstrous Mounts, a new prestige class, and much, much more!

209788.name: The Plant Corruption
209788.description:
From publisher blurb:

Turn Your Enemies To Mulch!

Corruptions, from Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Horror Adventures, give players a new way to indulge their dark fantasies and take the role of gothic monsters, infecting themselves with some taint or darkness, and presenting the tantalizing question of whether to struggle against the corruption, or embrace it, and allow themselves to bask, however briefly, in its dark power. While Horror Adventures presents 11 different corruptions to choose from, there are many more potential sources of corruption that could potentially be explored.

This book presents the plant corruption, a brand new corruption featuring unique progression rules, and 10 new manifestations that are flavorfully connected to plants and fungi. Further, the book introduces the black spore plant template, which can be applied to any plant and gives it, in addition to other abilities, the power to infect victims with spores that deliver the plant corruption.

209789.name: Hill Valley Community
209789.description:
From publisher blurb:

FT29 – Hill Valley Community is the Filbar free offering for October! This setting centers on a small Motte and Bailey fortification that has grown over the years. Home to Count Elam, a fair and caring ruler. This area was originally home for an FQ series adventure but can easily be dropped in any setting.

209790.name: Toot: The Automobile Game
209790.description:
This is a very early automotive-themed card game. It consists of a deck of 56 cards, divided into four colored suits with card values ascending from 1 mile to 14 miles.

Each player takes a well-shuffled suit, and the first player then turns over the top card. If it is a 1 mile, he starts his "Speed Pile" and can turn over the next card. If not, he places the card in a "Delay Pile", and the turn passes. No player may have more than three Delay Piles.

Each turn, a player then has the choice of turning over the top card in his deck or adding the top card from one of his Delay Piles to his Speed Pile. Each time a card is added to the Speed Pile, the player gets another play. When a deck runs out of cards, all cards in that player's Delay Piles are shuffled together and become the new draw deck.

The first player to complete his Speed Pile in sequence from 1 to 14 wins the hand, and gets points equal to the number of cards left in the other players' hands or Delay Piles. First player to 50 points wins the game.

209791.name: The Phlogiston Books Volume I
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
209791.description:
From publisher blurb:

What you hold in your hands, bold reader, is the first issue of The Phlogiston Books, an anthology of game aids, house rules, and adventures for the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG, gleaned from the various planes of the multiverse.

Some of the articles in this volume deal with one of the most dangerous environments that a party of daring adventurers can face: the countryside. We thus vindicate this setting, its dwellers, and its huge potential in a new and exciting genre that we've dubbed as “Rural fantasy”.

In these esoteric pages you'll find...

A new patron, The Gallows tree, to whom the wizards and elves of humble origins can sell their souls in exchange of scraps of power.
How to bring superstition to your game table… and make it work.
Rules to create animals like wolves, tigers, bears, and even more bloodthirsty and raging beasts like goats or geese. A table of disturbing rural encounters.
A level-0 adventure set in the most noble hamlet of Humiliatown: Beaten copper.




So sharpen your sword and memorize your spells, 'cause otherwise you could end up dead, or even worse: hanging from the gallows tree.

209792.name: Duck Shooting
209792.description:
This is an early but undated shooting game from Parker Brothers. It consists of an 11.5" long metal and wood spring-loaded rifle, 0.6" long wooden bullets, 9 cardboard ducks held upright by small metal stands, and a decorated platform with 9 spots for the ducks. The spots have point values: 2 x 5; 2 x 10; 2 x 15; 2 x 25; and 50.

The box lid is placed upside down on the floor. The box is inserted vertically to form a backdrop, and the target platform fits in front of that. Standing "a few feet away", players get three shots each, and score points for each duck hit equal to the value of its spot. The targets are reset after each player turn. The first player to reach 500 points over multiple rounds wins.

209793.name: Gentes de Ablaneda
209793.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gozoso me veo de encontrarme ante la presencia de sus señorías, y les ruego me presten su atención.

En este suplemento para Ablaneda el Juego de Rol les hablaremos de los personajes que arrastran sus vidas por ese valle de lágrimas que es el condado de Ablaneda. Para eso dividiremos la obra en dos partes. En primer lugar, como ordena el decoro, irán las damas y señores del Condado, algunas de las personas que más poder tienen entre sus manos. Describiremos cómo son, cómo piensan y cómo planean usar ese poder.

Proseguiremos hablando sobre los hombres de la Ronda, en un intento de comprender las miserias que estas pobres gentes han pasado antes de servir al Condado. Representan las formas más frecuentes de entrar en esa banda de rufines que es la Ronda de Yerbosera.

209794.name: Milagros de Ablaneda
209794.description:
From publisher blurb:

Buenos días tengan vuesas mercedes.

Este documento que tienen ante ustedes es un suplemento para Ablaneda el Juego de Rol, donde se ofrecen veinticinco semillas de aventuras, personajes y objetos mágicos que, esperamos, sirvan de valiosa inspiración a la hora de preparar y jugar a Ablaneda.

Cada una de las veinticinco ideas está inspirada en uno de los veinticinco Milagros de Nuestra Señora, escritos por Gonzalo de Berceo en el siglo XIII. Por su cercanía a la época del juego, por el ambiente que dibuja, por su casi “realismo mágico” es una obra que casa sorprendentemente bien con Ablaneda.

Tomamos los hermosos relatos del maestro Berceo y, como él ya hizo, los ampliamos y decoramos, pero también los retorcimos hasta crear algo nuevo. ¿Sacrilegio? ¿Plagio? ¿Homenaje? No sabemos si lo que aquí se ofrece es algo de eso o no, pero lo ofrecemos con humildad para disfrute de los jugadores de Ablaneda.

¡Buena Ronda!

209795.name: Bestias de Ablaneda
209795.description:
From publisher blurb:

¡Saludos, dilectos lectores!

En este suplemento para Ablaneda el Juego de Rol, Antón el Cojitranco vuelve una jornada más para hablarnos de seres curiosos, horribles y singulares que habitan el condado perdido de Ablaneda. En estas páginas encontrarán criaturas fantásticas (o no) recogidas sobre todo del folclore del norte de la Península y adaptadas para Ablaneda. Todas ellas llenas de ideas para aventura.

Se ha hecho una pequeña miscelánea de seres interesantes ordenados por orden alfabético donde pueden encontrarse seres únicos como el Arqueto, el Estero o el Nubero; criaturas mágicas como el oricuerno o el ramidrejo; seres terribles como los cuegles; duendes como los cuines o los enanucos bigaristas, y muchos otros.

209796.name: Lances de Ablaneda
209796.description:
From publisher blurb:

¡Buen día, dilectos lectores! En este suplemento para Ablaneda el Juego de Rol presentamos tres aventuras cortas similares a las aparecidas en el manual básico. Con ellas podréis poner a vuestros ronderos en peliagudas situaciones, en las que solo es posible escoger el mal menor.

Están creadas de forma que sean independientes entre sí y autocontenidas, a fin de que podáis incluirlas en cualquier punto de una campaña de Ablaneda sin mucha dificultad.

La primera aventura, “El molino fortificado”, da comienzo cuando una desgracia fortuita hace que los ronderos se encuentren encerrados en tal edificio con un barón local, a quien quiere linchar una incitada turba de sus vasallos. Pero siempre hay detrás más de lo que parece. No faltarán cabras de tres cabezas, íncubos y fuego.

La segunda aventura, “El aparecido de San Andrés”, se da en las cercanías del convento abandonado y maldito del mismo nombre, donde unos misteriosos espectros atormentan a los habitantes de la aldea de Fuenterreyes.

La última aventura, “Yo soy Juan Quinto”, presenta la desesperada persecución de un mítico bandolero a través de las brañas de los Picos del Diablo, donde los ronderos también encontrarán venganzas imparables, águilas monstruosas, romances forzados y puede que más Juan Quintos de los que esperaban al principio.

Pero no tienen por qué tomar mi palabra ahora, guarden sus juicios hasta haber terminado esta humilde obra que esperamos sea de su gusto.

209797.name: Secretos Enterrados
209797.description:
From publisher blurb:

Secretos Enterrados es un suplemento para La Puerta de Ishtar que describe en detalle a los siervos del dios Soua-Taqi, entre los que se cuentan los terribles gusanos de las arenas y los misteriosos Alabthaj. Este minisuplemento incluye:

1 Igigu: Soua-Taqi.
3 criaturas.
1 objeto de poder.
1 conjuro.
Numerosas semillas de aventura e información para el DJ.

209798.name: Los Rompeasedios
209798.description:
From publisher blurb:

Los Rompeasedios es un suplemento para La Puerta de Ishtar que describe la famosa compañía mercenaria del mismo nombre, detallando sus líderes, su organigrama, y la forma en la que se llevan a cabo las acciones de sitio en Akkad. Incluye:

6 PJs (o PNJs rivales) listos para jugar.
Funcionamiento de las compañías mercenarias en Akkad.
Descripción de los asedios en el Imperio.
Lista de términos militares en Akkadio.

209799.name: Laberinto de Espinas
209799.description:
From publisher blurb:

Laberinto de Espinas es una aventura para Ryuutama, de temática invernal y diseñada para Ryuujin negros. En ella los PJs deberán encontrar la forma de acabar con el Laberinto de Espinas, que bloquea el paso de montaña que da acceso al poblado de Kurosaki.

209800.name: The Road to the White House
209800.description:
