This a simple area-control, card-based U.S. election game aimed at younger children. It comes in a ziplock bag with a plasticized map of the United States, 4 crayons (red, yellow, green and blue), and a deck of 56 cards (50 state cards, a Washington D.C. card and five color-coded wild cards).

Players are dealt hands of five, and start by choosing one of their cards as their home state. Each player colors that state with his crayon. Each turn thereafter, a player starts by filling his hand to 5 cards either by drawing from the remaining deck or by stealing blind from another player.

To claim additional states, players must play cards for states that are adjacent to a state they already hold. In addition to playing from their hands, players may play the top card of the discard pile at any time. Players color in states as claimed, and only discard at the end of their turn if their hand still has five cards in it.

The states are color-coded by region, and there is one wild card for each region, plus a yellow wild card good for anywhere in the country. These allow players to claim non-adjacent states within the corresponding regions. Once all states have been claimed, the player with the largest number of electoral votes wins, with number of states held is a tie-breaker.

209801.name: ONDER Magazine (Issue 2 - Sep 2016)
209801.description:
The theme of this issue is "Portals" - in gaming, literature, film, and other media. Also included are:

- Details and insider info on the new epic fantasy setting Stormtalons!
- Tips and insights on writing and gaming by veterans of the industry
- Creator Profile of Eric Belisle, Art Director for Hellmaw and the newly launched Stormtalons story setting
- Fiction, including in-setting essays and documentaries from Hellmaw
- Comics, book and game reviews, and more!

209802.name: ONDER Magazine (Issue 1 - Apr 2016)
209802.description: The first issue of ONDER Magazine, whose theme is "Beginnings".

209803.name: Star Wars: Kapinaliiton tehtävä
209803.description:
The Death Star's strategic plans are hidden inside R2-D2. Transport R2-D2 to Yavin 4 and help the Rebel Alliance win!

In this adventure game you are part of the galactic rebellion. Inside R2-D2 are the strategic plans for the Death Star but it needs help to reach the rebel base on Yavin 4. Your mission is to defeat Darth Vader and the Imperial forces by transporting R2-D2 to the rebel base so they can destroy the Death Star. Use the Force, follow your galactic route ja make your way to Yavin 4. Is the Force strong with you... or with your opponents?

The game contains 1000 multiple choice questions and 250 picture cards which are suitable for all ages. The questions are from all areas of Star Wars galaxy from movies and TV to books. Join the galactic war and destroy the evil Empire - for good!

One player starts with the R2-D2 and others try to steal it from him. Whoever transports R2-D2 to Yavin 4 first wins the game. Luck is major factor in this game and answering the questions and getting them right may turn the tables in a heartbeat.

Mechanically, this game is the same as Aku Ankka.

209804.name: Cheese
209804.description:
Cheese is a game of observation and quick reflexes.
Each player gets a card depicting a slice of cheese. At the same time, each player tries to be the first to complete its scheme: to do this you have to quickly take the pieces on the table and place them on the card, making them fit with the pattern depicted on the card.
The player who successfully complete the scheme first, takes the 3D piece of cheese in the middle of the table: he earns the pieces of cheese taken and draws a cat card.
The cat cards are penalties to be applied in the next round. Examples: use only one hand, use only thumb and forefinger, do not bend your elbows.
When the cheese cards end, the game ends: the player who earned more pieces of cheese wins.
The rules provides various game modes, with different levels of difficulty.

209805.description:
Mini-expansion for the successful Ophidian 2360 Futuristic Gladiator Combat Game! Original mechanics, great art, with nods to the 2016 US presidential election.

This small expansion adds additional Minions, Quick-Hits, Pumps, and more, including an entirely new keyword-based subtheme!
209805.name: Ophidian 2360: People's Champion

209806.name: The Restless Knight
209806.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fallstones have a problem. The ghost of a man clad in armor haunts the inn they recently purchased. Its presence seems to have cursed the place, bringing all sorts of unwanted guests to the inn’s doors…

The Restless Knight is part of a series of mini-dungeons designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side quests or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

209807.name: Pizza Express
209807.description:
Pizza Express is a cooperative game of observation and quick reflexes.
The head pizza maker has been absent and the players, who are his assistants, must realize the pizzas without him.
A player, who plays the role of coordinator, takes the orders and talk to other players, who will try to realize more pizzas as possible, taking the right ingredients on the table before time runs out.
If the players, after several rounds, complete all the requested pizzas before the head comes back, win!
The game features 4 modes of play:
1) cooperative version, described above;
2) single-handed: the player plays both roles, taking the orders and trying to complete them;
3) teams: competitive version in which 2-4 teams try to complete the pizzas before the others;
4) all against all: competitive version in which everyone plays alone.

209808.name: DNA: Dark Native Apostle
209808.description:
User Summary

A run and bomb game similar to Bomberman and Silent Bomber.

209809.description:
Description from the publisher:

Beyond the industrialized world, formidable factions harness the power of magic, nature, and the unnatural to vie for domination of their realms. Battle in this wilderness is waged by potent warlocks, arcane warriors who wield the savage power of their warbeasts. Their consciousness magically linked, a warlock and a horde of warbeasts possess the power of a small army. When leading an army, they are more than a match for the mightiest forces of the Iron Kingdoms.

Take control of a warlock and a horde of fierce warriors and monstrous warbeasts in this action-packed 32 mm tabletop miniatures game set in the foreboding wilds of western Immoren, home of the Iron Kingdoms.

Hordes: Primal thrusts you into this savage world with: 

Complete core rules for the game, packed with examples to illustrate key concepts.
In-depth histories of the wild tribes and organizations of the Iron Kingdoms and the conflicts that have shaped them, from the stalwart Trollblood kriels and the enigmatic druids of the Circle Orboros to the dragon worshipers of the Legion of Everblight.
A selection of detailed army profiles and game stats for the powerful characters, warbeasts, and soldiers to help you muster a customized army for combat.
An instructional painting and hobby guide that will show you how to bring both your miniatures and your tabletop battlefield to life.
A summary of the rules for Warmachine, the fully compatible companion game that shows the steam-powered side of the Iron Kingdoms.
209809.name: Hordes Primal Mk III

209810.name: Play Letters
209810.description:
Play Letters contains 400 cardboard letter squares and has directions for 10 word games:
1. Anagrams: 2-6 players. Object is to create words of three or more letters.
2. Build-a-Sentence: 2-6 players. Similar to Anagrams but you create sentences and you can take words from other players if you transpose letters to form new word.
3. Scrambled Letters: Players take letters and form a word and then scramble letters in their hands to pass onto next player to unscramble and correctly guess word.
4. Word Solitaire: Take all the letters in your name (or another place or name) and rearrange to form other word(s).
5. Ghosts: 2-6 players - Object is for each player to add a letter to letters already played by preceding players without completing a word of three or more letters.
6. Heads and Tails: Similar to Ghosts except played with words of 4 or more letters.
7. Add or O-U-T: Similar to Ghosts except you want to create words of 4 or more by adding letter to previously played letters.
8. Crosswords: Players alternate in adding words to crossword layout.
9. Tell Me What: Storytelling game where player starts a story and the stops the story and selects a letter. The first player to say an appropriate word to continue the story beginning witht he letter wins it.
10. Barnyard Hunt: 8 or 10 players. Leader hides letter squares in defined area (indoors or outdoors). Everyone goes off to find letters and when all are found each player uses letters to spell out as many barnyard related items as possible. This can also be played with other categories.

209811.name: Casper & Lazarus
209811.description: The game Casper & Lazarus is a board game for 2-6 players. Each player moves his ghost through the mansion trying to gather the treasures of Casper. Depending on the space on which you land, you can get the various treasures, advance or otherwise retreat, and some of them indicated a punishment. In his turn each player rolls a die which will indicate the number of spaces that must move. Win the game the first player (ghost) reaches the last space with the "wonderful potion", allowing him to become human.

209812.name: Calabozo: La aventura de los anillos
209812.description:
In this game, the heroes seek to rescue the magic rings that were stolen by evil forces unleashing chaos in the kingdom and leaving it in darkness, only recovering them can be restored peace and order.

To obtain them, powerful wizards, brave warriors, intrepid elves and sagacious dwarfs will have to delve into the depths of the Dungeon and use each of their skills to avoid traps and beat the monsters and dragons that guard the rings.

Each turn players roll a die to move and fight with monsters or other players within reach by rolling twp dice to try to beat them and take their treasures, but if the monster survive, he launches a revenge attack.

The first adventurer to return with the rings in possession of the mighty dragons to the main hall will save his kingdom and wins the game.

209813.name: Myths of the World: Of Fiends and Fairies
209813.description:
The rat catcher’s after more than rats this time. He’s kidnapping fairy folk! Where did these pixies come from, and what do they have to do with your grandfather’s fairy tales?

Play both traditional and silhouette hidden-object puzzles in this dark fairy tale game. A unique new Q&A puzzle helps you discover your grandfather’s tie to the fairy realm.

Source: The Developer Website.

209814.name: Myths of the World: Spirit Wolf
209814.description:
The wolf spirit still haunts… will you heed its call?

You’re an expert in Native American symbolism who’s been called to investigate some glowing glyphs. Your amulet, which has been in your family for generations, begins to glow as soon as you arrive, as if it’s part of this place…

As you begin to investigate, you encounter strange ghosts from the past. Find out what caused their rift all those generations ago and how you’re connected to this place and its spirit.

Source: The Developer Website.

209815.name: Myths of the World: Born of Clay and Fire
209815.description:
Alchemists were always tied with the city of Prague. Their inventions built the city, their potions cured the plagues that devastated the townsfolk. Your father is one of those alchemists. Recently, he became secretive, isolating himself to research of an unknown purpose. He works with dedication – but to what purpose? Will he attempt to achieve the dream of every alchemist? Will he attempt to instill life into barren clay? Will your father accomplish the magnum opus and create creatures BORN OF CLAY AND FIRE?

Source: The Developer Website.

209816.name: Westbound
209816.description:
Publisher description from the kickstarter project page:

Westbound is the second book from the makers of the Pure Steam Campaign Setting. Take your game westward with unique races, new classes, archetypes, gear, and western monsters, all perfect for a rootin’ tootin’ steampunk wild west adventure.

In Westbound, you get everything you need to expand your game to the West.

New base classes like:


The Marshal, a lawkeeper whose jurisdiction grows with his renown.
The Savant, an intuitive contraption builder (think tech 'sorcerer')


Wild West archetypes such as:


The Wrangler, who can outrope, outride, and outgun her foes
The Gaucho, crazy enough to bring a knife to a gunfight
The Gun Devotee, a gun-slinging monk who uses ki for deeds


There is expanded support for the Chaplain and Gearhead, like:


New Chaplain organizations
New Gearhead archetypes like the Arsenalist
Clockwork schematics - expanding your contraption capabilities with options like delayed activation and self-propulsion.


A bevy of new monsters like the sand troll, the loch satyr, and the eternal soul.

New vehicles to span the desert, like the skiff and the ornithopter.

209817.name: Sword World 2.0: Card Adventure
209817.description:
This game is best described as a card based co-operative dungeon exploration.

Heroes of different roles and powers join together to defeat different challenges before them, and unlock the more difficult ones beyond. Every turn each hero can join in if they have a card that allows them to contribute to that particular task, pooling their dice with the ones the previous hero chose not to use. If they succeed the challenge is removed, but if you fail, you discard cards as damage.

Be careful though, the cards can only be used 3 times, and after that the heroes run out of time.

209818.name: Æthercoil (Issue 2 - Sep 2016)
rpgissuearticle: A Dual Feywild and a Shadowfell
209818.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

About the Document:

The development of David Foxfire's 5E Campaign world begins here: At first, it looks like your basic OSR world with some unique quirks, until the adventurers realize that there is a modern world underneath them, waiting to be rediscovered. Æthercoil puts an interesting--and even noble bright--twist on a post-apocalyptic setting.

Æthercoil Magazine will not only chronicle the development of this campaign setting, it will also compile many character options, monster settings (with adjustable Stat Blocks) and tips on Dungeon Mastering, many of them too small to put into a single document themselves.

Contents of Æthercoil Magazine #1:

Anthro Races: Catfolk, Wolffolk, Raccoonfolk
The Eladrin Race
Arcane Archer Prestige Class
Warlock Patron: Arch Witch
An explanation of a Dual Feywild and a Shadowfell
A 5E translation of The Dark Power Mechanic
The Witch Customized Wizard Class
The Red Haired Elf, Chapter 1

About the Author:

David Foxfire has been playing—and Dungeon Mastering—in D&D 5th Edition since it's playtesting, and is using the system to create his own homemade campaigns and even his own Campaign Setting known as Æthercoil. Before that time, he has been doing webcomics and illustration, of which his art style will become part of these submissions to this site.

209819.description: This expansion includes 4 additional building plans and 30 extra stones. Building plan boards include Schloss Schonbrunn, Sphinx, Louvre, & Kolner Dom. This package is exclusive for Kickstarter and fairs.
209819.name: World Monuments: Kickstarter exclusive

209820.name: The Stronghold (Issue 3 - Sep 2016)
209820.description:
The Stronghold
Issue 3
September 2016

A mixture of 3.x and edition-neutral materials. A little bit of crunch, a little bit of flavor, a little bit of humor, and a lot of fantasy gaming goodness.

209821.name: The Wheelhouse Prison
209821.description:
Adventure Seeds: Fantastic Locations to Drop in Your Campaign

From the introduction:

This book isn’t a complete adventure. Instead it’s designed to give you the starting point for a great session. In the following pages you’ll find maps and descriptions of a new location, designed to fit easily into your campaign world. There are NPCs, rumours, background information, adventure hooks - in short, almost everything you need to build an awesome adventure in this location. The only thing you need to do is populate the dungeon with monsters and loot that fit your party and the story you want to tell, and you’re good to go.

User summary:

The PDF adventure typically is distributed with twelve PNG files (high resolution maps, with and without grids).

209822.name: Inner Sea Temples
209822.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Houses of the Holy

Nearly every settlement in the Inner Sea has at least one temple, ranging from the modest shrines of remote hamlets to massive cathedrals in metropolises. Temples can act as centers of commerce, community, healing, and sacrifice for adventurers and common folk alike.

Pathfinder Campaign Setting: Inner Sea Temples helps Game Masters and players explore six of the Inner Sea region's most iconic seats of faith. Each entry comes complete with a detailed map and gazetteer; profiles of the temple's notable members; a history of the structure and the organization of its clergy; and a wealth of magic items, occult rituals, and spells favored by the resident priests.

This book contains details on the following temples:


The Cathedral of Exquisite Agony, a dark temple to Zon-Kuthon in Nidal.
Cayden's Hall, a combination church and tavern in the heart of Absalom sacred to the Drunken Hero.
The First Colonial Bank of Sargava, a bank-temple of Abadar in the city of Kalabuto.
The High Temple of Pharasma, a prestigious temple in Osirion dedicated to the Lady of Graves.
The House of Dawn's Redemption, a grand cathedral to Sarenrae in Taldor.
Imvrildara, an ancient shrine to Calistria hidden deep within the forests of Kyonin.


Inner Sea Temples is intended for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and Pathfinder Campaign Setting, but can easily adapted to any fantasy world.

209823.name: Fire Emblem Fates: Birthright
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best 3DS Game Winner
2016 Golden Joystick Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Nintendo Console Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Nintendo Exclusive Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Song of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Gal of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Guy of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Strategy/Simulation Game of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Honorable Mention
209823.description:
Your battle. Your future. Your fate.

Two kingdoms are on the brink of war. Whose side will you choose? Torn between two families, you're an heir of Hoshido, raised by Nohrian royals. If you choose the path of Birthright, you'll battle the corrupted king of Nohr beside a family of strangers.

You may also choose the path of Conquest, where you must fight to change your misguided kingdom from within.

Command warriors with expert precision and forge deep relationships to master this turn-based strategy game. For the first time ever, your customized avatar is the main hero. An army of knights, mages, archers and more are at your command in the most tactical battles in series history. Each unit and weapon has strengths and weaknesses you must consider for every foe you face. Partner allies on the battlefield so they can support each other in combat. Building relationships is key—the closer your allies become, the better they'll fight together. Their future is at your command, but first you must make the most important decision in the history of Fire Emblem.

- For the first time in the Fire Emblem™ series, your customized avatar is the main character (Prince or Princess of Hoshido Kingdom)
- Epic storyline centered on your avatar, forced to choose between bloodline and family who raised you.
- New "My Castle" area to interact with your allies and build stronger relationships
- Have StreetPass™ encounters with other players to visit their My Castle
- Tap in corresponding Fire Emblem amiibo™ figures and Marth, Ike, Lucina, and Robin will appear in your game, ready for you to battle and recruit
- Once you choose your path between Fire Emblem Fates: Birthright and Fire Emblem Fates: Conquest, you will enter a complete gameplay experience with different sets of characters to battle against and ally with. When you want to explore the other path (which is also a complete gameplay experience), you can purchase it at a discounted price in-game, adding an alternate take to the events that transpired between the kingdoms of Nohr and Hoshido.

- Please make sure not to purchase both Birthright and Conquest at full price on Nintendo eShop. To purchase the second path at a discounted price, please select the Explore Fates option that appears at the beginning of Chapter Six, or purchase a download code at retail to redeem within the in-game shop Dragon's Gate.

- The third path—Fire Emblem Fates: Revelation—will bring a conclusion to the saga. In order to play Fire Emblem Fates: Revelation, you must own either the Fire Emblem Fates: Birthright or the Fire Emblem Fates: Conquest game. At the beginning of Chapter Six, you can access the in-game shop Dragon's Gate or select the Explore Fates option to purchase it.

Source: The Publisher Website.

209824.name: Fire Emblem Fates: Conquest
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best 3DS Game Winner
2016 Golden Joystick Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Nintendo Console Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Nintendo Exclusive Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Song of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Gal of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Guy of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Strategy/Simulation Game of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Honorable Mention
209824.description:
Your battle. Your future. Your fate.

Two kingdoms are on the brink of war. Whose side will you choose? Torn between two families, you're an heir of Hoshido, raised by Nohrian royals. If you choose the path of Birthright, you'll battle the corrupted king of Nohr beside a family of strangers.

You may also choose the path of Conquest, where you must fight to change your misguided kingdom from within.

Command warriors with expert precision and forge deep relationships to master this turn-based strategy game. For the first time ever, your customized avatar is the main hero. An army of knights, mages, archers and more are at your command in the most tactical battles in series history. Each unit and weapon has strengths and weaknesses you must consider for every foe you face. Partner allies on the battlefield so they can support each other in combat. Building relationships is key—the closer your allies become, the better they'll fight together. Their future is at your command, but first you must make the most important decision in the history of Fire Emblem.

- For the first time in the Fire Emblem™ series, your customized avatar is the main character (Prince or Princess of Hoshido Kingdom)
- Epic storyline centered on your avatar, forced to choose between bloodline and family who raised you.
- New "My Castle" area to interact with your allies and build stronger relationships
- Have StreetPass™ encounters with other players to visit their My Castle
- Tap in corresponding Fire Emblem amiibo™ figures and Marth, Ike, Lucina, and Robin will appear in your game, ready for you to battle and recruit
- Once you choose your path between Fire Emblem Fates: Birthright and Fire Emblem Fates: Conquest, you will enter a complete gameplay experience with different sets of characters to battle against and ally with. When you want to explore the other path (which is also a complete gameplay experience), you can purchase it at a discounted price in-game, adding an alternate take to the events that transpired between the kingdoms of Nohr and Hoshido.

- Please make sure not to purchase both Birthright and Conquest at full price on Nintendo eShop. To purchase the second path at a discounted price, please select the Explore Fates option that appears at the beginning of Chapter Six, or purchase a download code at retail to redeem within the in-game shop Dragon's Gate.

- The third path—Fire Emblem Fates: Revelation—will bring a conclusion to the saga. In order to play Fire Emblem Fates: Revelation, you must own either the Fire Emblem Fates: Birthright or the Fire Emblem Fates: Conquest game. At the beginning of Chapter Six, you can access the in-game shop Dragon's Gate or select the Explore Fates option to purchase it.

Source: The Publisher Website.

Source: The Publisher Website.

209826.name: Mech Capture
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 112 - The Solo System
209826.description:
Description from the designer:

Introduction
Our enemy is rich in resources, but weak-minded. Many of their Mechs are bigger, faster, and stronger than ours. But challenge their mercenary pilots and they give up quickly and leave their machines.

We control 3 of the 6 sectors around their base, and we’re moving in for the kill. As their Mechs retreat to defend their base, we will attempt to surround and capture them. Capture them if you can, destroy them if you must.

We are closer than we have ever been to a major victory against the Federation. It is all in your hands now. Don’t fail us.

Game Overview
Mech Capture is a solitaire print and play card game using 36 cards - no dice, cubes, or other components needed.

As enemy and friendly units appear on the battlefield, take charge of friendly units and deploy them in pairs to surround enemy Mechs, or in triplets to surround enemy Mechs, Transports, or Long Range Guns at their base.

A limited number of friendly units may be placed in your Reserves for future deployment. Deploy these units to match the enemy’s displayed characteristic and number of pilots, to capture the Mech and gain its Victory Points. If you exceed their displayed characteristic, the Enemy unit is destroyed so that the Enemy (or you) cannot gain its Victory Points.

Winning the Game
By game end have more Victory Points than the Enemy. Compare your victory points from captured units to all remaining enemy units at their base, three sectors, and Enemy draw pile (if any).

209827.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Battles of Khalkhin-Gol, the first installment in Days of Wonders' second series of Memoir '44 Battle Maps, offers a campaign of six standard scenarios that can be enhanced with the two pre-printed Breakthrough battles provided in this expansion.

In more detail, The Battles of Khalkhin-Gol is a series of battles fought along the Halha River (Khalkhin-Gol) on the Soviet-Japanese border at the very beginning of World War II.
The Japanese Sixth Army was facing the Soviet 57th Special Corps, including Mongolian cavalry. At first, the battles were only short skirmishes, but it soon escalated into open war. The whole campaign lasted five months and ended with a Soviet victory. The six standard scenarios of this expansion can be played separately or as a campaign, with each scenario outcome impacting the following one. The pre-printed Breakthrough scenarios — Bain Tsagan Heights and Tightening the Noose — can be played in the campaign as well as one of the two Overlord scenarios, Encirclement at Khalkhin-Gol.

The second Overlord scenario, Cape Torokina Landings, highlights the fierce battle for Cape Torokina between U.S. Marines and Japanese forces that took place years later; therefore, it is not part of the campaign.

This expansion also includes six Soviet BA-10 Armored Cars and six Japanese Type 97 Te-Ke tankettes that players will find useful for many of the scenarios included.

The Battles of Khalkhin-Gol is designed for 2 to 8 players. Each oversized map is ready-to-play with all terrain, obstacles, and unit positions pre-printed so players can simply add the figures and play. The various scenarios of the expansion require one copy of Memoir '44 (two for the Overlord scenarios), as well as the Terrain Pack, Eastern Front, and Pacific Theater expansions. The Equipment Pack and Winter Wars expansions are also recommended.
209827.name: Memoir '44: The Battles of Khalkhin-Gol

209828.name: Falling Stars: Beginner Game
209828.description:
Falling Stars is a Role-Playing and Tactical Game of political and military conflict unfolding amidst an alien intervention.

What is a Tactical Game System? A tactical game system allows players to skirmish one-on-one with each other using the Falling Stars Opposed d10 game system. Players can take a break from role playing (or completely ignore that aspect of the game) and simply enjoy fighting other players. Players can select teams or elect to play free-for-all or anything else in between. The maps in Falling Stars are scaled perfectly for 28mm miniatures, or players can make their own maps using half-inch grid squares or as a miniature gaming system with ranges measured in half-inch increments.
Maybe that tough talking UPAS marine thinks he can take your brawler. So take a break for the RPG and let the two players settle the argument with the Tactical Game System. Bragging rights goes to the winner, and then the group can get back to playing the role playing game. The possibilities are endless!

This box contains everything you need to learn the basic mechanics of Falling Stars. It includes Quick Start Rules, eight pre-generated characters, the first three chapters of an ongoing sci-fi adventure campaign, “Into the Long Dark Night,” characters and tokens mounted on high-quality cardboard and full-color printed maps for the adventure.

209829.name: The Miller's Stone
209829.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The town of Leilon is set along the Sword Coast north of Waterdeep in the Forgotten Realms. The [player characters] are asked to retrieve a set of magic millstones from a ruined millhouse. There, the characters will battle the kuo-toa and their new "god".

User summary:

For 6th - 8th level characters.

209830.description:
Lock 'n Load Tactical: Solo is the next evolution in our LnLT series. LnLTS is a solitaire system that provides players with a way to play scenarios and generated battles on their own. We wanted to take that a step farther and provide to have one solitaire system that would work for the entire Lock 'n Load Tactical series past, present and future games. Gamers will be able to use LnLTS to play any complete Lock ‘n Load Tactical game including any expansions, in either World War 2 or Modern eras. We also wanted players to be able to play the scenarios that come with the games, so LnLTS makes this possible. There will be a few scenarios that won't play as smoothly as most of the scenarios do to events or special rules. LnLTS will work with any scenario generated by our LnLT Battle Generators. Included with LnLTS is a system is a random events generator that is optional to add a little something special to your games and could be used even in two player games.

Lock 'n Load Tactical: Solo was developed by Bob Bicket, Sean Druelinger and David Heath and is based and licensed from Academy Games's Solo game design. We like to thank Uwe Eickert for allowing us to create this edition for the Lock 'n Load Tactical series.
209830.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Solo

209831.name: Survive the Card Game
209831.description:
Description from the publisher:

Theme
Survive the Card Game is set in a hostile nuclear winter, where the players are a small band of survivors attempting do whatever it takes to outlive each other.

Game-Play
Survive the Card Game is a competitive game that forces players to play co-operatively. There are six card types: Food, Water, Shelter, Trash, Weapon, and Beast.

The game is divided into rounds, and each round is divided into two phases: Search and Negotiation. In the Search phase players be engaged in a combination of hand management and press your luck card drawing mechanics. In the Negotiation phase players will be engaged in trading, diplomacy, and combat.

At the end of every round, each player will need to have one of each resources – food, water, and shelter – to stay in the game. For each resource a player doesn't have they will lose a life. If a player loses all three lives they are eliminated. The last player standing is the winner.

209832.name: The Witch of Bareen Woods
209832.description:
From the introduction:

A Witch has kidnapped farmer Laiten’s son and daughter! There’s no telling what horrible plans she has for the two children, and the villagers of Nulren are simply not capable of fighting against the Witch and her Goblin servants.

Is this just a simple case of a kidnapping, or is there something more sinister going on?

209833.name: Questing Heroes
209833.description:
From the introduction:

In a world filled with evil and chaos, where magic and might threaten to engulf the many kingdoms in destruction, there will always be a need for heroes.

Now, you can be one of those heroes. Questing Heroes, a roleplaying game system, will let you travel the world, using your sword or your magic to quell the chaos and evil you might find. Help those in need. Find treasures and artifacts. Fight monsters and fiends.

Adventure is what you will find within these pages. All it takes is a bit of imagination, and the desire to be...

...a hero!

209834.name: The Wonder at Mercury
209834.description:
Publisher's blurb:

PhD candidate Becky Marta vanished during a field trip. Her last known location was Écrins National Park. The investigators must try to find out what happened. Then... they must try to comprehend it.

The Wonder At Mercury is a modern day 'narrative first' scenario blending Lovecraftian cosmic horror and the weird science fiction of Clark Aston Smith. It is ideal for a one-shot, or short series of games playable in any Horror system; including guidelines for Call of Cthulhu (CoCth), Trail of Cthulhu (ToC), Cthluhu Dark (CD), and Delta Green (DG).

209836.name: Wild West Shepherds
209836.description:
The Wild West Shepherds is a western style shepherd game that takes you on a cunning and funny adventure. To win this game, you must understand all the characters' abilities and observe carefully.

In each round, players take a new character card that will help them to collect sheep. The game ends at the close of a round in which a player has 11 sheep or more. The player with the most sheep wins the game.

In each round, set 4 location cards as shepherd locations facing down on the table. Starting with the player with Headman’s character card. He looks at 2 location cards first and announces the number of wolves. But the wolf in sheep clothing may count as 1 or 0. After Headman announcing the number of wolves, each player looks at one location card and chooses a location to put his own cowboy meeple on it.

Scoring: when everyone has done, reveal all character and location cards. Scores are tallied for each location. Players put their own cowboy meeple on a location with wolves may lose sheep, or a location with sheep may collect sheep. But character ability will impact the result: Hunter cannot effect by wolves and collect sheep base on wolf number, Turkey Mama snatches all the sheep, Banker takes double of the sheep, and so on.

209837.name: Something Wicked Stirs
209837.description:
From the introduction:

The adventure starts at dusk in the small off-road inn, “Hargern’s Treasure.” It is located just inside the Frendell Forest on Lightfoot Run Road, A band of six female Auzronian arcane gypsies have stopped in as well for a night’s drink and rest from a long journey. They are well known to the bartender, Uncle Tolin, who heartily greets them by name: Mara, Junree, Abalee, Chelmay, Lesla, and Savinia. The gypsies are very talkative and friendly to the party of adventurers.

User summary:

For 5th - 10th level characters.

209839.name: What Is Inside It
209839.description:
Description from the publisher:

YOU ARE IN A DIRE SITUATION.
YOU ARE CONFRONTED WITH A NUMBER OF IDENTICAL BRIEFCASES.
THEY ALL LOOK SAME.
THEY ALL WEIGH SAME.
THEY ALL FEEL SAME.
THEY ALL HAVE NO MARKINGS.
BUT WHAT EACH ONE OF THEM MIGHT CARRY IS ....
MILLION DOLLARS IN CASH, STINKING TRASH, HEAVY BOMB OR ...

What Is Inside It is a full action packed, very thrilling & very exciting card game. This game is of high intensity and mafia like situation. It is truly a Russian Roulette. It is highly enjoyable and can be played with a number of family members and friends. This is a great game if you are looking to have a great time. This is also a perfect party game as well as a source of great entertainment and joy. If you love Action, Thrill, Big Sum Of Money and Heavy Explosions then this game is a must for you.

Background Story & Synopsis :

Imagine your self in a crisis situation and in an urgent need of cash. You end up getting in front of a loan shark who is also a crime boss, asking him for a million dollars. He places 3 briefcases in front of you and asks you to "pick one and open it". He further mentions that "only one of them has the million dollars in cash, one has the trash and one has the bomb. If you end up opening the case with the cash, you walk away rich, if you open the case with the trash, you walk away with nothing but the stink and if you open up the case with the bomb then you are a roasted meat". You take a good look at all the 3 briefcases, put in front of you to choose from. They all look exactly same, they all weigh exactly same, they also feel exactly same, but the only thing in which they differ is, what they carry inside. All the briefcases are completely odorless and produce no sound upon shaking them. They are completely sealed and locked. You may only choose one briefcase and you only get to know what is inside it, by opening it right there and right then. You finally choose and grab one briefcase to open it while wondering, what is inside it ...

GAME PLAY :

What is inside it is an exhilarating and an exciting game. A number of players can play it against each other. This game of odds, chances and strategy unfolds when a number of players are confronted with a number of cards with briefcases pictures on it. To open a briefcase, the playing card is flipped upside down so that the content of that briefcase is revealed. Without knowing what is inside of each card, the players pick up and flip one card at a time, upon their turn in each round. The risk element kicks in when all the players must instinctively choose and flip a number of cards, which are to be opened one at a time upon their turns, and the content of the card is revealed. As each card is flipped or turned, the likelihood of the players having a valuable cash amount such as a million dollars in the card or something else, such as a BOMB. The pressure mounts in each round, as the number of cards are turned or flipped. The players may also come under pressure by what might be contained in their chosen card. What is inside it ? cash or bomb or something else... The players will always be curious and puzzled, but they also know that as long as they do not intentionally or accidentally open the card with a BOMB or come under attack by any other opponent player, they are fine. There are multiple variants of this game, which can be played.

209841.name: Armageddon
209841.description:
User Summary

Armageddon is an action game created to tie into the 1996 animated movie of the same name. You can switch between first and third-person viewpoints while piloting a space craft with the goal to drive back the invaders. The ship goes forward automatically and needs to avoid obstacles and destroy enemies in space.

209842.name: Geuk Cho Ho Kwon
209842.description:
User Summary

Geuk Cho Ho Kwon is a versus fighting game. The game allows two players to compete against each other and also offers a single-player mode with the computer AI taking control over the opponent. There are twelve fighters to choose from, each representing a different country (Korea, China, USA, etc.) and fighting in his or her own stylized location.

209843.name: FATED: The Silent Oath
209843.description:
Set in the mythical age of Vikings, FATED: The Silent Oath tells a tale of courage and sacrifice where an everyday father and husband must do the impossible to save his family from the destruction of the world at the hands of giants of old.

Source: The Game Website.

209844.name: Pankapu
209844.description:
Pankapu is a narrative and episodic platform/action game that takes place in the dreams of Djaha’rell, a child once troubled by a tragic incident. Play Pankapu, the tiny warrior chosen by The God of Dreams, to rid the Dreamworld of the Nightmare invasion.

Source: The Developer Website.

209845.name: Agenda
209845.description:
Agenda is a strategy simulation game in which you control a world-wide independent agency with a set goal of world domination. Try to claim your global influence through the power of your allies and covert operations such as assassinations, bribery or fraud.

Source: The Game Website.

209846.name: Madrobot X
209846.description:
MadRobot X is an old school shoot 'em up game. You control a robot trying to escape from the laboratory of a mad scientist, and to accomplish this, you'll need the help of GoboGobo, another robot who also wants to escape.

Source: The Developer Website.

209847.name: Gravity Island
209847.description:
Gravity Island is a loveable, colorful platform game that will really put your skills to the test. Shiro is an unbelievably cute, cuddly creature that loves collecting magical fireflies.

Source: The Game Website.

209848.name: Candy Kingdom
209848.description:
Candy Kingdom is a wonderful VR candy shooting game! The kingdom needs a new king! Will you be the new king?

Source: The Developer Website.

209849.name: Quibbit!
209849.description:
"Quibbit! Quibbit!" The frogs are croaking loudly over each other, and their pond is in a flurry of commotion because today is the day the king of frogs will be chosen.

The goal of Quibbit! is to remain in the game for as long as possible. Spatial thinking, clever planning, and a little bit of luck make Quibbit! an engaging game to take a breather and have some fun.

209850.name: Riff Route
209850.description:
A myriad fish wiggle in the ocean, and you are part of a large school of tropical fish trying to find shelter on a reef. You are helping the small fish travel on their chosen route to the reef where they can stay safe from predators.

Riff Route' is a fun and thrilling game full of surprises and exciting challenges all the way until the players reach their final destination!

209851.name: Titan's Tower
209851.description:
User Summary

In Titans Tower, jump the walls of the castle tower grabbing as much loot as you can. Many obstacles will stand in your way, but the reward is very big. Catch power-ups along the way to enhance your journey while capturing a high score.

209852.name: Eve of Destruction - REDUX
209852.description:
Eve of Destruction is a First-Person-Shooter for PC about the Vietnam War era.

Source: The Game Website.

209853.description:
To play Crazier Eights players start with seven cards in hand. During your turn, you draw a card, play up to one card for an effect, and discard one card. The first player with zero cards in hand wins.

Crazier Eights: Camelot has fifty three unique cards, each with a different effect. It has a fantasy theme in the world of the King Arthur stories. Merlin, Morgan le Fay, Avalon, Excalibur, and many elements from the stories are unique cards in the game.
209853.name: Crazier Eights: Camelot
boardgamepodcastepisode: 28 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Boston FIG Tabletop games

209854.name: Cusp, City on the Edge of Eternity
209854.description:
Cusp, City at the Edge of Eternity

Publisher's blurb:

Built on the lip of the mountainous crater that surrounds the Halls of the Eternal Moment, Cusp caters almost exclusively to adventurers. Heroes, travellers and thrill-seekers alike come and go from the town all the time - and since Cusp is the last place to spend time, or coin, before one enters the Halls in the crater below, they do their best to extract as much of it from passers by as they can. Of course, as people do occasionally come back out of the dungeon, Cusp also offers adventurers a chance to sell their hard-won spoils to a wide variety of art collectors, historians and eccentric wizards who call the City at the Edge of Eternity.

209855.name: d30 Natural Potions and Poisons Generator
209855.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This series of d30 tables produces odd-sounding plant-based "potions" that can treat certain (also randomly generated) ailments while also producing poisons derived from the same plants. Many plants can be beneficial if used one way and deadly if used in another fashion (although the difference could just be a matter of dosage). Sub-tables also indicate the mortality (speed of the poison) and method of death, just for some extra flavor.

This table exists just to add a little color to the game and to show a bit of love for the venerable d30.

209856.name: Huscarls: A Game of Conquest in Dark Ages Britain.
209856.description:
INTRODUCTION
Huscarls is a semi-historical game where one to four Players assume the roles of minor Saxon Warlords in Britain during the Dark Ages of around 980-1080 AD. There are many rich pastures, thick forests with deer and boar and rolling hills, all ready for the taking as the riches of Medieval Britain can be yours. All you need is to demonstrate a firm hand and fruitful estates. A strong sword and loyal followers are also required to maintain your lands and ensure the villagers are providing the proper taxes. You must also be able to defend your territories from rival Lords and invading Normans and plundering Vikings.

GAME OBJECTIVE
Players assume the roles of Saxon Warlords in Dark Ages Britain (AD 980-1080) with the goals of expanding and improving their territorial control. Warlords do this by raising Retinues and conquering neighboring territories. Warlords can, also, improve their holdings by building Hamlets, Manors and Castles. A Game consists of up to 10 Campaign Seasons. Players may agree to play fewer or more as desired. The Player, who at the end of any Campaign Season (Spring, Summer or Autumn) controls the greatest Settlement Value from their Hamlets, Manors and Castles, is the Victor.

209857.name: PJ Masks: Night Sight
209857.description:
Work together as the PJ Masks to stop the mischievous Romeo from stealing the city's toys.

You setup three toy stores with random sets of 9 red masked toys. Players put on their PJ Masks to reveal and memorize the toys in each store. Then, after the masks are off, Romeo reveals his plans and shows which toys he plans to steal. If the players remember and place the toys with the stores that contain that same toy, they stop Romeo. However Romeo will steal any toys they place incorrectly. If the PJ Masks can stop Romeo from stealing 5 toys during 9 rounds, they win.

209858.name: Krypte
209858.description:
The game was invented by Marino Carpignano in 2016.
An 8x8 unchequered game board is used with a certain number of bi-colour counters, white on one side and black on the other, like in Othello. At the beginning, the board is empty. Black moves first.
The Black player's first move is obligatorily on one of the 8 squares along the North side of the board.

After that, each player will choose an entry square for their counter, placed along one of the two next side rows (clockwise) with reference to the last piece played.

A counter slides (also jumping over any other counters already present on the game board) along the line perpendicular to the selected side, and stopping on the first empty square encountered.
Ambiguous moves are forbidden: that means you are not allowed to place your counter on a square that may be reached from both sides where you can play in your turn.

In this game the counters are captured by flanking them; the result of a capture is instead the same as in Othello.
The aim of the game is to be the first to complete an orthogonal or diagonal line of at least four counters of the player’s colour, avoiding a simultaneous alignment of four or more of the opponent’s counters.

209859.name: Crypts & Things Remastered
209859.description:
(publisher blurb)

Be a wild Barbarian, a deadly Fighter, a soul-torn Sorcerer or a sword sharp canny Thief, fighting evil tyrants and foul demons in a world rapidly dying and heading towards its final nemesis.

Crypts and Things (C&T) is a Swords and Sorcery Roleplaying game based upon the Old School Rules of the 70s/80s. It also draws upon the British fantasy games and game-books of that period to bring a distinctly dark and dangerous feel to the game.

209860.name: Autobahn Tokio
209860.description:
User Summary

A racing game for the 3DO. Players can choose from 4 unnamed cars with different characteristics. And can race an AI opponent on three tracks, a city at night, coastal highway, or forest track.

209861.name: Battlesport
209861.description:
User Summary

Battlesport simulates the sport of the future. Choose your vehicle and enter the arena to face your computer opponents to see who scores the most goals before the clock runs out.

209862.description:
The active player chooses a random theme by throwing two numbered dice then throws six "words and phrases" dice and sorts them from lightest to darkest color. Each die shows a word or phrase on it's face and the player must use the words to tell a story using the dice in front of her, in order: "Did I tell you about..." . During the story, other players can throw an "interrupt" die and read the result aloud. The active player has to adapt her story to the interruption: "No, that's a lie!"

Once all dice have been used up, the player throws a six sided die that gives her her score. Other players decide if she is allowed to throw another die to get a better score. As the rule book says "the scoring system is unfair, but life is unfair and this game... is life!"

Great fun for adults, and an amazing expression tool for children.

This game is almost identical to "Comment j'ai adopté un gnou", but is better adapted for families.
209862.name: Comment j'ai adopté un dragon

209863.name: Fall Of The Third Reich
209863.description:
Description from the publisher:

From award-winning designer Ted S. Raicer, The Fall of the Third Reich covers the dramatic last two years of WWII in Europe, as the Western Allies and the Soviet Union fight against fierce German resistance to bring down the Thousand-Year Reich.

The time is July, 1943. From the beaches of Sicily to the plains of central Russia, millions of men are poised to decide the fate of Europe and bring about the end of WWII...

Two large hex maps cover Europe from France to Central Russia, and Leningrad to Sicily. Units are Armies, Corps, and in a few cases, Divisions. There are twelve two-month turns.

Those turns play quickly, and yet there is a lot of subtlety within each one, with rules for both reaction and exploitation. Getting the most out of the various movement segments is essential for both players: as the Axis for plugging gaps in the front line, and as the Allies for exploiting every last opportunity to move ever further into the Third Reich proper. But the German player will quickly learn that a passive defense is doomed to fail, and that selective counterattacks are vital to hold the enemy at bay.

The game includes rules for Soviet and German Command (Stavka), while the effects of Hitler's increasing interference in military affairs is presented through a rule which requires the German player to use OKW (West Front Headquarters) or OKH (East Front HQ) to be able to retreat infantry units from an enemy ZOC.

While the Soviets and Germans begin the game locked in a death struggle at Kursk, the Allies face the early dilemma of where to invade, with a choice of invasion sites ranging from Holland to Greece. Knock Italy out of the war or Second Front Now! in Northwest Europe: the choices are yours.

Supply rules have been kept as simple as possible, while still modeling the historic importance of logistics. The Western Allies in particular will learn the importance of ports in supplying their armies, and have to base their strategy around them.

Perhaps most significantly, the game effectively models the Strategic Air War over Europe with only a few simple rules and a handful of counters. But though easy to learn, this ‘game within a game’ can have a dramatic impact upon the course of the war, as the Allies must prioritize their air resources while the Luftwaffe struggles both to slow the Allied air offensive and support the German armies in the field. The challenges are numerous and subtle.

Other rules cover variable (and degrading) German troop strength, Allied Airborne drops, Strategic Transit, Forts, Yugoslav Partisans, and Axis Minor Powers, including Italian Surrender

The game can be played by two (Axis and Allied/Soviet) or three players (Axis, Allied and Soviet) but also works well solo. The Fall of the Third Reich is a game of large scope and nail-biting decisions, combining fidelity to history with a fun playable game system."


Product Information
Complexity: 5 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 8 out of 10
Time Scale: 1 turn = 2 months
Map Scale: 1 hex = 30 miles
Unit Scale: Armies, Corps and some Divisions
Players: Best with 2 players but can be played well with 3 players or solitaire
Playing Time: 6-10 hours

209864.name: Enlace
209864.description:
ENLACE is a competitive, tile-placement abstract game which emphasizes its educational aspects, mainly, the stimulation of the observation & association skills in players.

Contents

140 printed tiles

Setup

All 140 tiles are shuffled, put face down and divided between 3 stacks of tiles of any given size. Each player is given 10 tiles that should be put in front of them facing up, so other players can clearly see them.

Gameplay

The player that begins the game takes one of his tiles, puts it at the center, then takes another tile from any of the three stacks and puts it next to his tiles; the next player chooses a tile among the ones he has whose 'printed pattern shape & color' properly links/connects and puts it next to the first one placed at the center, then takes another tile from any of the three stacks and puts it next to his tiles; and so forth...

When a player has no tile to properly link the ones at the center, he'll take one from any of the stacks, if this one also doesn't match, he loses his turn.

Object / Winning

When the stacks are gone, the first player who runs out their tiles wins the game.

In the case that no player can properly link/connect their tiles, the one with less tiles wins.

209865.name: Myths of the World: Island of Forgotten Evil
209865.description:
The Isle of Wight has always been a place surrounded by mystery. Through centuries many different civilizations lived there, and they all left some traces of their existence: castles, old towns, shrines and temples. Sometimes, precious treasure and jewelry were things they left behind. But, occasionally they used the island to hide the things that should be hidden forever. Unfortunately, they never accounted for human curiosity and lust for the unknown in their equation.

Source: The Developer Website.

209866.name: Myths of the World: Stolen Spring
209866.description:
The rich folklore continues with this exciting tale set in an old Slavic land. As Child of Spring, can you save the world from eternal winter?

A cruel and cold Goddess of Winter has hijacked springtime, and her victim has called on you for help. You’ll be surprised by what you, a lowly peasant, can do in the face of evil – and what cute little furry friends you’ll meet along the way in Myths of the World: Stolen Spring.

Source: The Developer Website.

209867.name: Myths of the World: Black Rose
209867.description:
Vampire hunting is a full-time job, and your latest lead has brought you and your partner to Louisiana. Hop aboard a Mississippi River cruise, and get to work! You must investigate the riverboat passengers to expose a vampire who’s carrying an ancient artifact that could spell disaster in the wrong hands. Just be wary of who you trust… Even a seemingly normal person might be under the spell of the cunning vampire, luring you into a trap. Uncover the clues and unmask the true villain in this heart-pounding Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game!

Source: The Developer Website.

209868.name: Myths of the World: The Whispering Marsh
209868.description:
People have been vanishing in the Whispering Marsh, and the county has enlisted you to investigate. But this is no ordinary missing-persons case… The entire marsh is steeped in myth, with tales of mysterious twinkling lights that can mesmerize their victims and lure them to their doom. What are these lethal illuminations, and who –or what – is controlling them? You’ll have to act fast to find out before it’s lights out for you, too, in this chilling Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game!

Source: The Developer Website.

209869.name: Myths of the World: The Heart of Desolation
209869.description:
It was just supposed to be a routine mission. Fly in, drop supplies, and fly out. But when a dragon attacks your plane, crash-landing in a lush valley, you’re drawn into the adventure of a lifetime! This ancient valley is filled with living, breathing dragons – guardians of nature who protect the weak. But when one of their own becomes possessed by their ultimate foe, it’s up to you to restore order.

Can you defeat the Dragon King’s mighty terracotta army, or will the world be destroyed once more, just like it was centuries ago?

Source: The Developer Website.

209870.name: Myths of the World: Chinese Healer
209870.description:
A great myth has enduring power… no matter where the story comes from. In this first game in the exciting new Myths of the World series, your story begins as a Chinese healer who’s brought to the Imperial City to save the Emperor’s son. But you uncover a devious plot and end up having to save yourself!

Throughout the game, you’ll use your herbal kit to concoct powerful potions to summon spirits and heal the people you meet. There are also collectible cranes hidden everywhere, and achievements to earn as you play.

Source: The Developer Website.

209871.name: Amaranthine Voyage: Winter Neverending
209871.description:
For eons Corra was a world of prosperity. Events of recent design have propelled the world into famine and misery. You must answer the call of Corrans and find your way through the foreign world. What is the reason behind Corra’s fate? An answer worthy of your call. Journey into the winter and become a true voyager.

Source: The Developer Website.

209872.description:
Keltis is a multi-player game based on Lost Cities, with some rules changes, later published with Knizia's original rules and theme as Lost Cities: The Board Game.

Players play cards to move their playing pieces along stone paths. Cards show one of five different colors/symbols, each corresponding to one path; in addition, each card shows a number (0-10, twice each). In each color, each player can play his cards in either ascending or descending order. As in Lost Cities, it's better to concentrate on a few paths since the final spaces on a path grant high points, but ending early gives negative ones.

The active player plays one card (out of a hand of eight) or discards one, then moves the corresponding playing piece on the path. Many of the spaces have a token that grants some bonus: either immediate points (counted on the scoring track), an extra move on a path, or wishing stones that are needed at game end to avoid negative points.

The game ends when five playing pieces (from any combination of players) have reached the seventh (or higher) space on their respective paths. Now, scoring happens:

Pieces that moved only 1-3 steps earn negative points (-4, -3, -2).
Pieces with 4+ steps earn points (1, 2, 3, 6, 7, 10).
One piece of each player twice the height of other pieces scores double, either positive or negative.
Holding fewer than two wish stones earns negative points (-3 / -4), while a collection of five or more stones yields a bonus of 10 points.




All endgame points are added to any scored during the game. The player with the highest score wins!

Included expansion: This new board provides new challenges and requires new ways of thinking. The new gameboard is arranged portrait-style rather than the landscape orientation of the original, and the five roads have been replaced by a network of intersecting and overlapping roads, so you can continue on a different color or even choose which way to go. The point values also change during your way, not simply increasing.
Also you have 5 cairns on the board, with each cairn having a stack of five stones in a particular color. When you reach a spot on that track, you claim the top stone. Stones of all five colors are awarded 10 points; collecting three stones of the same color is also worth 10 points, too.
209872.name: Keltis (with Neue Wege, Neue Ziele)

209873.name: Goo Saga
209873.description:
Goo Saga is a platform adventure game that takes place in a hidden underwater lab, where a reclusive genius scientist seeks to create life for his own enigmatic reasons. After many failed attempts, he succeeds in creating Goo, a strange creature with elastic properties. The scientist soon disappears mysteriously and Goo embarks οn a perilous journey through the sunken laboratory, in an effort to find his creator – and with him, the purpose of his own creation. Will Goo succeed? Throughout the game, the player is invited to guide Goo and solve puzzles, avoid deadly traps and face an army of foes that threaten to bring an end to his quest. Goo's destiny is in the player's hands.

Goo can be in one of three states: Deflated, Normal, and Inflated, each one conferring different advantages. The player may choose which is the most suitable for each situation Goo faces, as the game progresses. Finally, the player may collect crystals by completing levels in different modes (Normal, Survival, Time Trial). Crystals are important as they may be used to enhance Goo's various abilities in order to get through levels of increased difficulty. Free access to a powerful level editor allows the player to extend Goo's journey of discovery in unprecedented directions.

Source: The Developer Website.

209874.name: The Bait
209874.description:
The Bait is a fun mobile game where the player tries to avoid fish attacks for as long as possible. The main character,Buffy the turtle, has lucked out and finds himself hanging from a rope about to be eaten by fish. To avoid the fish attacks, Buffy gets to swing the rope left or right but has to be careful so as not to run out of stamina. Fortunately, coins pop out of the sea from time to time and these can be used to improve Buffy's abilities such as his stamina regeneration or the number of fish attacks he can withstand. For some extra fun the player can visit the shop to buy new outfits for Buffy. Finally, the game features online leaderboards with Facebook integration so that the player can compete with the best players from around the world.

Source: The Game Website.

209875.name: RPG Geek Random Tables
209875.description:
User summary:

A series of random tables on random subjects, created for a challenge run on the RPG Geek site. All entries from RPG Geek users. Compiled and published as a PDF.

Available for download right here in the Files section. So instead of reading this stupid summary, go download it already.

209876.name: Anonima Gidierre (Numero 94 - Ottobre/Dicembre 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Il gioco di carte del Non t'arrabbiare. Un filler da coltelli tra i denti

209877.description:
WORLD AT WAR 85, VOLUME 1: STORMING THE GAP

The commander of the West German 15th Panzer Brigade held the headphones away from his ears, protecting them from the voice of his border battalion commander, the man’s voice rambling and emanating out of them at high volume.

“There are Soviet tanks pouring across the border south of us heading for the Fulda crossings, our Intel section says it must be the 79th Guards Tank Division….so many…we are pulling our right flank back already, the American 11th Armored Cavalry over there will have to take care of themselves, but we need artillery…and Air, yes Air….NOW!”

“Calm down, Otto, Air is on the way, and the guns are firing now. Tell me how many tanks you see.”

“How many??...” There was a momentary pause. Through the headphones, he heard the battalion commander’s breath sigh out. Then his voice came through again, only, this time, it was sad, resigned, almost normal.

“All of them.”

STORMING THE GAP is the first volume in the World At War 85 series of games of fast and furious platoon-level combat. Set in 1985, in an alternate history of World War III, when the Warsaw Pact armies storm across the border of East Germany in a powerful attempt to seize West Germany and the whole of Free Europe.

The World At War 85 system features a unique combat system that involves die rolls by both attacking units and defending units, which keeps both players engaged throughout the game. Die rolls are compared and hits are applied quickly, as all the information you need to fight your units is on the counters. No combat results table is necessary. The initiative, formation activation, random turn length, close air support and air cover are all integrated smoothly.
209877.name: World At War 85: Storming the Gap

209878.name: Shadowrun: Anarchy - Alternate Ruleset
rpgissuearticle: Rules Are Made To Be Broken
209878.description:
From the publishers website:


Man. Machine. Magic.

Shadowrun. The Sixth World. Orks in pinstripe suits with uzis; mohawked dwarves jacked into vehicles racing through megasprawls at breakneck speed; humans casting fireballs at corporate-trained paracritters; elves hacking the Matrix for a datasteal of the latest tech or working to topple an upstart corp. It’s where man meets magic and machine.

Dive into a cyberpunk dystopia and become a shadowrunner, a deniable asset who does the jobs no one else can—or will—do. It’s not an easy life, but it beats selling your soul to the megacorps. You’ll break into top-secret labs, stand up to gangs bent on destruction and chaos, encounter dark spirits hiding even darker secrets, and come face to face with some of the infinite dangers the Sixth World can throw at you. And you’ll come out on top—because if you don’t, you don’t get paid.

Shadowrun: Anarchy is a new way to get into the best cyberpunk/urban fantasy action around. Based upon the rules-light and easy-to-learn Cue System, Shadowrun: Anarchy is a narrative-focused game experience that has everything you need to quickly grab some gear, load up on spells, and get to throwing the dice. With loads of characters and missions, the book makes it simple to get up and running. Immerse yourselves in the Sixth World!

209879.name: Ground Force
209879.description:
Ground Force is a free print & play 2 player scifi high luck strategy game.

The goal is to get one of your troops in the base of the other player. Destroying all the units of the other player will also make you win the game.

Each turn the player picks a card from his deck to see which troops he can move. Sometimes he can move different type of units in the same turn.

Each time a reinforcements card is drawn new units are placed in the base. The more mines (red spaces on the board) the player occupies the more units he can place in his base that round.

Units only move horizontal or vertical, not diagonal. Combat is done by rolling dice. The attacker has to roll swords or explosions, the defender shields or explosions.

There are three types of units: troopers. saboteurs and heavy weapon units. The troopers can occupy mines, the saboteurs are fast and can sneak behind enemy lines and the heavy weapon unit can shoot from a distance.

209880.name: No Caboose!
209880.description:
No Caboose! is a serious game with a whimsical name. It takes about 2-3 hours to play.

No Caboose! is not an 18xx game. It is not a crayon game. It is a unique game about the early years of railroad building in the 19th Century U.S., with six railroads along the Atlantic Coast poised to build their lines to the Midwest heartland.

It's main feature is a more realistic stock market model than any other game. The stock market in No Caboose! includes the effects of supply and demand due to stock trading, it embodies the effects of the nation's changing economic climate. Watch stock prices soar during economic Booms! Watch those stock prices plunge during economic Panics. Players can buy stock to pump the stock price, or sell stock to depress the price. Players may choose a strategy of holding a diversified portfolio with stock in many railroads, or put all their money into one or two railroads.

Another difference in No Caboose! is that players are not railroad presidents and are not bogged down in the detail running a particular railroad. Instead, players are financiers who arrange the routes railroads build and arrange the merger of small local lines into the bigger railroads. That is, players are in the role of banker J.P. Morgan, not the role of president Jim Hill. Players can help any railroad build a new line, which earns the player stock and money for arranging the new route.

A player's goal is simple. Being a financier, the only goal of a player is to be the richer than any rival financier at the end of the game.

There are important decisions for players to make every turn, and players must watch what their rivals are doing. There are subtle strategies in selecting routes to build, stocks to buy or sell, and opportunities can be seized or missed. No player is ever out of the game, and victory in most games is in doubt until the final tally.

209883.name: Hyakuninisshu Karuta English Translation 1-50
209883.description:
Hyakuninisshu Karuta is an English translated version of the Japanese Karuta using the translation of the original Japanese old poems from the anthology called "Hyakuninisshu".

The game is sometimes described as intellectual martial arts. It is about listening and being extremely focused and fast, just like the Samurai with their swords. Only here you fight with cards instead.

The game is comprised of two decks of cards, the Reader deck and the Player deck. Cards in the Reader deck contain short poems or poetry quotations while cards in the Player deck contain only the second part of these poems. To begin the game, a Reader is chosen (or you may opt to use the Reader app) and the players are divided into two teams sitting on opposite sides of the table or play area. The Reader shuffles the Reader deck and the Players mix, split evenly the Player deck between the teams and place them face-up in 3-4 rows in front of them. The Reader will read the complete poetry quotation on their cards and the player that finds the matching card first takes that card and puts it aside. If the card taken was on your opponent's side, you must give one card from your side to your opponent. The first team that has no cards left on their side is the winner (you must get rid of all your cards first, to win).

The game is set in Japan during the Genpei war (1180-1185). In order to win the war, you need a strategy. Place the cards you are familiar with close to you (in the beginning it is normal that none of the cards are familiar). If you know what cards your opponent is familiar with, place those cards as far as possible from them inside the playing field. Since the reader or app will always read the complete quotation, you do not need prior knowledge of the poems. Strategically place the playing cards in a way that you can find and take them quickly such as laying them alphabetically or categorize them under the same first words.

209884.name: A Haunting in Brenton
209884.description:
From the introduction:

Your adventurers find themselves drawn into a small hamlet in a secluded valley. Very quickly, it becomes obvious that this seemingly quiet town has a dark past, and the party has become caught up in it. They’ll have to unravel the mystery of what happened in Brenton, and once they do, defeat the ancient evil that has cursed it. If they don’t, they may be doomed to remain forever, a part of the story known as A Haunting in Brenton.

User summary:

For 7th level characters.

209885.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Iron Golem
209885.description:
Super Dungeon is headed to video games with Super Dungeon Tactics! In this turn-based strategy game you create a guild of Heroes to combat the Dark Consul. Accept bounties, help the downtrodden, and answer the noble call for adventure!

The Iron Golem is useable in your tabletop games of Super Dungeon. Also included is a Steam Key, which unlocks the full version of Super Dungeon Tactics.

209886.name: Las Vegas: The Card Game
209886.description:
Gambling continues in the glamorous world of Las Vegas, but now with cards instead of dice — and while you might now be somewhat better able to estimate your possibilities of success, many surprises are inevitable in Las Vegas: The Card Game.

Additional Comment

This game is #3 in the Alea very small box series. It includes an expansion for the Alea medium box series game Las Vegas.

209887.name: RWBY
209887.description:
From the introduction:

Remnant [the setting of RWBY] is a world where Man was brought to the brink of extinction. Driven back by the creatures of darkness known as Grimm, Man was nearly helpless. However, in time Man’s ingenuity led to the development of Dust. Dust is nature’s wrath in physical form, and with Dust, Man could bend the forces of nature, and by extension, the creatures of Grimm to his will. In the time since, great Huntsmen and Huntresses have been selected and trained to protect Man and all his kingdoms from the creatures of Grimm, who are always ready to strike and the first sign of weakness, and destroy Man forever.

User summary:

An "unofficial" adaptation of the media series to tabletop gaming.

209888.name: Sullivan
209888.description:
User summary
Sullivan is a simple two-player card game with a theme of boxing between two rabbits.

This game has 12 punch card, each of which is numbered 0-3, and depicts a type of punch, which is either straight, hook, or uppercut. Each player chooses a color and takes two cards which belong to that color.

Each turn, the active player draws and reveals a punch card, whose number means additional punch cards a player receives when that player loses the turn. Both players choose a card from their hand and reveal them simultaneously. If the revealed cards are the same, the active player receives that punch card and the additional punch cards, otherwise the in-active player receives those cards.

Repeat the process until either player receives three punches of the same type, in which case that player loses the game.

Publisher's summary
サリバンは簡単な２人専用バッティングゲームです。手番プレイヤーは山札から１枚引き、各プレイヤーは手札から０または１のカードを伏せて出します。カードが出揃ったらオープンし数字を合計します。山札から引いたカードを手札の合計数分プレイヤー間を移動させます（１なら子のカードに、０と２なら親のカードとなります）
カードを手にしたプレイヤーはカードに書かれた数字分山札を引きます。これを繰り返し同じ絵柄のカードが３枚集まったプレイヤーの負けとなります。

209889.name: Renaissance: The Rebirth Core Rules
209889.description:
User summary:

The core rulebook (and perhaps the only book made for) the game.

209890.description:
The Elect is a fast-paced humorous card game of politics, elections, and the monsters which populate them.

The object of the game is to be the first player to match your Candidate's priorities to that of the Political Climate established at the start of the game - or to be the last viable Candidate in the race.
209890.name: The Elect

209892.name: Dungeon Recruiter
209892.description:
In Dungeon Recruiter each player is a mighty lord of his own dungeon kingdom.
The High Lord-Keeper is going to retire and soon he will have to choose a successor.
You are going to gather the greatest army in the Underworld to take his throne.
There are many cunning tricks at your disposal: use ancient knowledge and artifacts, alchemy and magic. But be careful: there are other pretenders who will hinder you all the time, and the stepped-up raids of adventurers from above make your funding highly unstable.

Game turn:

Reveal the top card of the Monsters deck
You may draw up to 3 Vile Plans cards to reduce that monster’s Power value. Keep these cards face-down until the end of your turn
Each player can play any number of cards of Vile Plans, starting from the player to your left. Active player may use a minion during his Recruiting phase
At the end of the Recruiting phase roll a die
Each player puts all played cards of Vile Plans to their discard pile
The turn is passed to the next player




DUNGEON RECRUITER will be presented at Essen Spiel 2017

209893.name: Auf, auf, kleiner Pinguin!
boardgamefamily: HABA My Very First Games series
209893.description:
From the publisher's site:

The penguin mommies and their babies live on an island, but the tasty fish is on the mainland, and the penguin babies don’t know how to swim yet. Fortunately, there are plenty of stones, logs and planks jutting out of the water so the penguin babies can hop with their mommies from one to the next. Which penguin twosome will be the first to reach the plate on the mainland and gobble up the two tasty fish?

209894.name: Clustertruck
209894.description:
ClusterTruck is a chaotic physics based truckformer. Jump your way through insane levels in a game of “the floor is lava” on top of speeding trucks driven by terrible drivers.

Source: The Publisher Website.

209898.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 6, Issue 13 - Training Day)
209898.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This Week: We have a great new adventure for your heroes, so join the fun.

209899.name: The Secrets of Cats: Feline Magic
209899.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE MAGIC OF CATS IS BEYOND ANY HUMAN BURDEN’S COMPREHENSION

This book is a companion volume to The Secrets of Cats, a World of Adventure for Fate Core System.

We've told you that cats are magical, but we've barely begun to show you their true potential.

In this book we describe two entirely new schools of magic, Alchemy and Illusion, and describe the powerful effects that cats can create by combining effects from two of the six schools of magic.
