We also reveal the minor magical knacks that are nearly as individual as each cat, and give you a bunch of new exclusive stunts for the original four schools of magic.

Finally, we delve deeper into the mysteries of forbidden magic with some new horribly powerful magic tricks, each of which necessitates the sacrifice of a sapient being.

209900.name: Olara
209900.description:
From publisher blurb:

Olara, and Stahlheim..those who see War as an art form!

Imagine a country that has never had a time without war. Olara has learned that the first borders to be violated in campaigns against the south are their own. These people seem serious and dour to others but they've a rich culture that recognizes the need to live as if any moment could be the last. Imagine a country that combines the legendary fighting ability of the Vikings with the commitment to service that is expected in modern day Israel and you might be close to Olara's culture.

Everyone fights, Even when a person excels in administrative service, they still practics at weapons. Mothers and sisters fight beside Husbands and brothers. While the country mostly fields infantry, there is a battallion of cavalry that is elite in shaintar.

In this book you'll find some great new edges, powers and fighting styles along with some new gear and bad guys to help give a campaign that Olaran flavor.

209901.name: Adventures in Wonderland #2: Down The Rabbit Hole (5E)
209901.description:
From publisher blurb:

After chasing a white rabbit through the wood, a group of young adventurers find themselves falling down a peculiar rabbit hole! Can they puzzle their way out of the hole by feeding a hungry dictionary and playing the oddest game of peek-a-boo ever?

Welcome to Adventures in Wonderland, a mini-adventure path for the Dungeons and Dragons Fifth Edition! Chapter 2: Down the Rabbit Hole is a family-friendly mini-adventure suitable for 1st level characters. By the end of the adventure, all characters who have played the rst chapter should have earned enough experience points to advance to 2nd level. The Adventures in Wonderland adventure path will take characters from 1st to 5th level.

Adventures in Wonderland: Down the Rabbit Hole is an After School Adventure. After School Adventures are adventure shorts designed to only take a few hours of time to complete.

209902.name: Adventures in Wonderland #2: Down The Rabbit Hole (Hero Kids)
209902.description:
From publisher blurb:

After chasing a white rabbit through the wood, a group of young adventurers find themselves falling down a peculiar rabbit hole! Can they puzzle their way out of the hole by feeding a hungry dictionary and playing the oddest game of peek-a-boo ever?

Welcome to Adventures in Wonderland, a mini-adventure path for Hero Kids! While Down the Rabbit Hole was designed to be part of a mini-adventure path it can be played alone or even as part of another adventure entirely. The rabbit hole can be a strange but fun transition point between one location and another in any adventure, making the very act of getting from point A to point B a challenging encounter.

Adventures in Wonderland: Down the Rabbit Hole is an After School Adventure. After School Adventures are adventure shorts designed to only take a few hours of time to complete.

209903.name: Adventures in Wonderland #3: The Dodo's Race (Hero Kids)
209903.description:
From publisher blurb:

After chasing a white rabbit through the wood and falling down a strange hole, a group of young adventurers meet the Dodo, who asks them to engage in the oddest obstacle course ever!

Welcome to Adventures in Wonderland, a mini-adventure path for Hero Kids! While the Dodo’s Race was designed to be part of a mini-adventure path it can be played alone or even as part of another adventure entirely. The Dodo’s obstacle course can add a wacky and fun element to any quest.

Adventures in Wonderland: Down the Rabbit Hole is an After School Adventure. After School Adventures are adventure shorts designed to only take a few hours of time to complete.

209904.name: Adventures in Wonderland #3: The Dodo's Race (5E)
209904.description:
From publisher blurb:

After chasing a white rabbit through the wood and falling down a strange hole, a group of young adventurers meet the Dodo, who asks them to engage in the oddest obstacle course ever!

Welcome to Adventures in Wonderland, a mini-adventure path for Dungeons and Dragons Fifth Edition! Chapter 3: The Dodo’s Race is a family-friendly mini-adventure suitable for 2nd level characters. By the end of the adventure, all characters who have played the first two chapters of Adventures in Wonderland should have earned enough experience points to take them one third of the way to 3rd level. The entire Wonderland adventure path takes characters from 1st to 5th level.

While the Dodo’s Race was designed to be part of a mini-adventure path it can be played alone or even as part of another adventure entirely. The Dodo’s obstacle course can add a wacky and fun element to any quest.

Adventures in Wonderland: Down the Rabbit Hole is an After School Adventure. After School Adventures are adventure shorts designed to only take a few hours of time to complete.

209905.name: Adventures in Wonderland #3: The Dodo's Race (Pathfinder)
209905.description:
From publisher blurb:

After chasing a white rabbit through the wood and falling down a strange hole, a group of young adventurers meet the Dodo, who asks them to engage in the oddest obstacle course ever!

Welcome to Adventures in Wonderland, a mini-adventure path for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game! Chapter 3: e Dodo’s Race is a family-friendly mini-adventure suitable for 2nd level characters. By the end of the adventure, all characters who have played the first two chapters of Wonderland should have earned enough experience points to take them one third of the way to 3rd level. The entire Wonderland adventure path takes characters from 1st to 5th level.

While the Dodo’s Race was designed to be part of a mini-adventure path it can be played alone or even as part of another adventure entirely. The Dodo’s obstacle course can add a wacky and fun element to any quest. For example, the yeti in Madam Margareth’s Magic Potion (another After School Adventure from Playground Adventures) could challenge the party to a race in the Dodo’s place instead of simply attacking them!

Adventures in Wonderland: Down the Rabbit Hole is an After School Adventure. After School Adventures are adventure shorts designed to only take a few hours of time to complete.

209906.name: The Frost Fang Expedition
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
209906.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Frost Fang Expedition challenges PCs to reach the top of a frozen and treacherous peak on a mission of discovery: why have huge chunks of a mysterious sorcerer’s floating castle begun raining down on the once quiet village of Neverthawes? The quest for answers will uncover hidden motives, fearsome foes, and deadly environments galore!

72 digest-sized pages of level one Dungeon Crawl Classics carnage!
Easily adaptable to any old school system.
An 'instant action' adventure with tips to play in a single 4-hour session (perfect for cons or demos), but with enough backstory for extended campaign play.
Includes a 40 page appendix PDF containing judging tips, patron sheets, a host of paper miniatures, and easily printable versions of every map and image in the adventure (to be used as handouts or judge's aids).
From the author of the best-selling Nebin Pendlebrook's Perilous Pantry (including tips on how to link the two adventures).

209907.name: Acropolis of Voor Darayn (Pathfinder)
209907.description:
From publisher blurb:

This one-session adventure for characters of 5th to 9th level is designed to provide you with an exciting taste of the Primeval Thule Campaign Setting - a primordial land of fierce barbarians, elder horrors, and savage wilderness. Four 7th level pregenerated characters are included so you can begin play immediately!

Centuries ago, the dark sorcerer Tur Nyaan built an extravagant palace atop a hill called Voor Darayn. For decades, he demanded tribute from nearby cities and trade routes, and summoned mighty demons or conjured terrible curses to punish those who refused him. Tur Nyaan's reign of terror ended a century ago, when death finally claimed him ... or so it is believed. So why is it that summoned demons have once again appeared inthe nearby cities demanding tribute in his name?

209908.name: Psi Lord
209908.description:
From publisher blurb:

When soldiers stationed overseas discovered a lost nazi vault storing priceless treasures, they schemed to claim it for themselves. What they found was an artifact of great power. Martin turned on his cohorts and took it for himself. Now, endowed with incredible telekinetic and telepathic abilities, he has embarked on a life of crime and domination as PSI LORD!

209909.name: Chessman
209909.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tracking down people is nothing new for most private investigators, but when your subject turns out to be a renegade wizard you never know what you might find. In Greg Brandt's case, he found a collection of enchanted game pieces that granted him the ability to channel appearances and abilities reflective of the game of chess. Now, he brings his hard-boiled sensibilities to the streets as the super-powered and often unpredictable hero, the CHESSMAN!

209910.name: The Sinister Sutures of the Sempstress
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
209910.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Level 6 Adventure

Mother was wrong: There are monsters in the closet.

Terror seeks out the adventurers in the safety of their own homes, drawing them into a tailored web of vengeance long-deferred. Torn from their beds, the PCs find themselves trapped in the House of Tattered Remnants, the home and prison of an eldritch entity known only as the Sempstress. The adventurers must overcome patchwork horrors, unearthly craftsmen, and even the unravelling of their own realities if they hope to defeat the Sempstress in her lair and escape the House. Or will they be unmade by the Sempstress’ evil?

209911.name: Knights Proving Ground
209911.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 48 x 30 inch, full color battlemap of a Knights Proving Ground .

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps (VTT) .

“I’ll make a Knight out of you yet Squire! And a Squire out of you too Page!—Head Knight Instructor

Knights Proving Ground is an exterior map of a large enclosed courtyard where there are several areas set up for training knights including archery targets, standing training dummies, and two sandy octagonal arenas for duels.

Knights Proving Ground is intended for use in fantasy or medieval games.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Pride of the Red Lion Academy: The Red Lion Academy teaches squires and pages in classrooms about weapons, armor, horses, military history and heraldry. The Red Lion Academy isn’t just about scholarly work however as they have a huge courtyard for squires and pages to practice under knight instructors in the ways of archery, fencing, dueling, and riding.

The final exam every year is a mock attack on the academy which the graduating class must repel. When the mock attack begins this time however, students are slain by real weapons. Someone has replaced the Head Knight Instructor’s mock attack team with knights armed to the teeth! Can the Player Characters survive the attack armed with mere practice weapons against fully trained knights?

What happened to the Head Knight Instructor’s mock battle team? Kidnapped? Knocked Out? Dead?

Who is responsible for this attack? An enemy kingdom replacing the mock attack with a very real ambush? A rival academy that believes real teaching requires spilling actual blood on the field and is here to teach them a lesson about war?

209912.name: Doc Plague
209912.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains a full write up on Doc Plague.

"Doctors offer hope in the face of disease. One however brings suffering and pestilence...Doctor Plague has returned and soon enough the heroes will feel his blighted touch"

209913.name: Tealnik
209913.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tealnik are an old-fashioned people, and one who fiercely believes in a strongly decentralized government. They are constantly fighting one another in ancient family feuds, duels of honor, and wars of aggression. Though they are isolationists who are uncomfortable interacting with members of other species, the Tealnik readily venture far into the Fringe in order to find dangerous beasts to hunt and worthy forces to battle with in order to further increase their personal honor. Their worlds are an old-world mixture of teeming cities, vast rural tracts, and heavily restricted wilderness areas (hunting preserves).

In the vastness of space, few will ever see a Tealnik, and those few that do, they will never see them coming.

209914.name: Invention 2
209914.description:
https://www.facebook.com/Atriagames

While you were on the island exploring the underground laboratory, the infection was busy spreading throughout the world.

209915.name: Rat Wars
209915.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Rat Wars. This is the great chronicle of the mighty struggle between wizards, men, and rats. The war was started many cycles ago. It is a war of cheese, the lifeblood of the universe, but that would just be stupid. So the cheese is made of gold, and magical. You must now make the most important decision of your life: will you be a mouse, human, or wizard?

209916.name: Patricians & Plebians
209916.description:
From the introduction:

Patricians & Plebeians is a rules-light role-playing game based on the Greek version of the board game Citadels and set in a medieval city fraught with corruption, intrigue and class warfare. Patricians and Plebeians are locked in an ever-continuing struggle for influence and wealth, both between themselves and against each other. They occasionally cooperate in the face of greater dangers… after which they promptly carry on with their backstabbing.

209917.name: Space Exploration Quarterly
209917.description:
Q3 2047 Special Edition

From the introduction:

What you have in front of you is the re-issued edition of Star Bastards! Sam Iacob started with this one because of the current interest in sci-fi related things and because it’s two adventures in one, giving first-time Two-Fisted Fantasy gamebookers a sample of the sorts of adventures you can expect from Herman Skull in the near future.

User summary:

A companion booklet to Star Bastards.

209918.name: Pokémon Pen and Paper
209918.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Pokémon! This guide assumes some knowledge of the Pokémon franchise as it exists apart from this game. If you are unfamiliar, there is a great deal of information available about it. This game aims to provide a roleplaying experience that resembles the Pokémon world as portrayed in the video games and anime while keeping the mechanics easy to learn and use, and the gameplay quick and entertaining.

User summary:

This game is a tabletop adaptation of the famous video game and anime media franchise. The game is very carefully created to correlate with the methods, missions, feel, and style of the source materials.

209919.name: ABS12 Flexible Solo Game Engine
209919.description:
User summary:

This product is a d12 implementation of the author's ABS Solo Game Engine that can be utilized with nearly any standard dice type. The rules here present a generic, universal mechanism for asking and answering questions during solo play - in effect, a methodology to replace the game master function.

Note the product if focused on the d12 flavor, but does include a generic action table for numerous types of other standard dice.

209920.name: Albino Peacock
209920.description:
From the "Publisher"

Albino Peacock is a hack of Lady Blackbird which takes place at a game convention. The players are a group of Organized Play heroes who have just discovered that a last minute change in the schedule means they'll have a sessions with Pete Douglas an event GM who has it in for one of them.

They need to find someone to avoid that sessions without giving up the rest of their con. Simply skipping it is not an option since that would earn them a suspension from Organized Play for the next year.

209921.name: ABS12 Fact Generator
209921.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a flexible fact generator that is meant to aid or take the place of a Gamemaster (GM) for answering questions or finding the clues, information, or describing situations. A chart with results for 2D6, 1D12, 1D20, and 3D6 systems is included. It makes it a versatile fact generating engine. A 1D100 can use the 1D20 if they divide and round their 1D100 by five.

This system is meant to give keywords, that when put together help to generate story ideas, objects, people, places, and events. The keywords are meant to help trigger thoughtful and inspirational ideas.

This system works well for adding random ideas into story writing, solo gaming, or to aid a GM in creating [something entirely new].

209922.name: Patchwork: A Game About Siblinghood
209922.description:
From the introduction:

You need 3 to 5 players. Each player needs to be open to playing with honesty, vulnerability, and trust, with the knowledge that this game will be played in public even though it touches on difficult personal issues. If players have any concerns about specific triggering issues, have them look through the cards and ensure they’ll be okay.

209923.name: Immortal Coil
209923.description:
From the introduction
The old world is in ruins, devastated by the ghost wars when literal Nightmares broke free to roam the earth. Humanity, now familiar with the existence of Blooded magic, tapped into the source and laid low many of the Nightmares and forced others into tenuous exile.

Humanity's defense against the Nightmares are OMEGA cells, cohesive military units bred with magic, and their specialized handlers. In the most dire circumstances, even witches and warlocks - humans who can reach through the boundaries of the paradigm and grasp the magic directly - are employed to hunt down rogue nightmares and their followers, minions, and terrible offspring.

209924.name: Garden Eel Go!
209924.description:
Players are the Spotted garden eel hunters! Let’s take garden eels! And open the top of the Garden Eel museum!
Players will be helped by hunters of the Rabit, the Kappa or Mr. Otter. They will take many garden eels.
However the watchman will save the sea from hunters. Additionally, the sharks at the deep sea are searching garden eels!

Escape from them, and take many garden eels!

Each player have three animal cards of the Rabit, Kappa and Mr. Otter as hunters.
Each player selects one of them, and put it with face down.
The watchman player selects one of animal cards on the table.

Then, players open the card at the same time.
If there is no watchman, the player can take the Garden eel card. The cards are placed below the animals on the table.

The garden eel is drawn zero to six. They are points. But sometimes a shark icon is also drawn.
So the next card is flipped out to poos. So it's minus points.

When two line is out, the game is end.
The winner is the player with most points.

Description in Japanese:

みなさんはチンアナゴのハンターです。
海底から素敵なチンアナゴのなかまたちをつかまえて世界一のチンアナゴ水族館をつくりましょう★
うさぎ・カッパ・カワウソさんの力を借りてたくさんチンアナゴをつかまえましょう！
でも、うみの監視員に見つかってしまわないように注意しないといけません。
油断していると、海底ではこわーいサメがあなたのチンアナゴを狙っていますよ？

209925.name: Kosmium
209925.description:
Kosmium is a space corporation handling whatever it’s needed thru the galaxy. They have just deployed 6 Space Station around the Solar System and have chosen you among other famous pilots to build the first cosmic highways in this part of the galaxy.
You compete against each other at navigating your ship thru the outer asteroid belt to collect minerals and then transform those into pieces of highway at the Space Stations from where you also deploy them.
Be careful: Kosmium is a ruthless company and to test your skills they might send you coordinates where you lose minerals, but also with each instruction card you get a special power to use when necessary. You can choose to disobey their coordinates and navigate to richer spots by bluffing, but be advised: the pilot behind you can contest your move and try to steal your minerals.
Be the first to complete the cosmic highway on your mission and win the game!

209926.description:
Description from the publisher:

Movable Type is a card-drafting, word-building game. You can think of it as a little like Scrabble crossed with Sushi Go.

Over a series of 4 rounds, players will draft cards and score words in order to build a victory pile. Impressive words may also earn the player author challenge cards, which give a variety of immediate and lasting abilities. In the final round, it will be the victory pile that provides the letters for their final mega-word and provides players with a chance to win the game.

Movable Type is a family-friendly word game for up to 4 players. It rewards savvy planning - not just an extensive knowledge of words!
209926.name: Movable Type

209927.description:
Super Ninja Ambush! is a deluxe crossover warband that is playable in games of Super Dungeon and Ninja All-Stars. Featuring three ronin useable as Super Dungeon Heroes, four Elemental Shrine spawning points, eighteen ninja, and two monstrous oni mini-bosses, Super Ninja Ambush! expands player options with exciting ninja adventure like no other!

Thanks to unique team building elements, Super Ninja Ambush! is incredibly versatile. Players can use all the included miniatures to create Ninja All-Stars themed games of Super Dungeon, use the included air and earth ninja in games of Ninja All-Stars, and even hire out any of the three ronin for their clans in standard and league play games of Ninja All-Stars.

Both novice and advanced players will enjoy the wide range Super Ninja Ambush! offers. Ninja Division Publishing is also committed to the growth of Super Dungeon with thrilling expansions and also greatly supports organized play communities of Ninja All-Stars with an impressive array of tournament and league kits that feature unique narratives and fun prizes for participants. Whether playing amongst friends or family, Super Ninja Ambush! is sure to be a hit with all!

Contents:
27 Assembled Ninja Models
1 Mochizuki
1 Komuso
1 Momotaro
2 Oni
4 Elemental Shrines
18 Elemental Shrine Ninja
6 Assembled Samurai Models
32 Super Dungeon Cards for Classic and Arcade
3 Ninja All-Stars Ronin Cards
1 Mochizuki Card
1 Komuso Card
1 Momotaro Card
209927.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Super Ninja Ambush!

209928.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (October 2016)
209928.description:
From publisher blurb:

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s on-going design of the megadungeon Gloamhold, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

This month’s issue features:

10 Things to See in a Burned Out House
10 Things to See in a Plague-Infested House
Y’taris at a Glance (from Village Backdrop: Y’taris)
Midnight Market at a Glance (from Places of Power: The Midnight Market)
Gloamhold: The Ghost Tower

209929.name: 10,000 Bullets
209929.description:
User Summary

A scrolling beat 'em up/shooter combo game.

209930.name: Druid Spells III (PRD)
209930.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Druid Spells is a simple document that collects the druid spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 3rd-level druid spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

209931.name: Druid Spells III (3PP)
209931.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Druid Spells is a simple document that collects the druid spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 3rd-level druid spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

209932.name: Horror Feats E-I
209932.description:
From publisher blurb:

Horror Feats E-I is the latest Mythic Mini devoted to exploring the terrible tricks that desperate heroes and vile villains alike might unleash in a horror-themed campaign. Whether they deal in blood, pain, death, plagues, curses, corruption, sinister sorcery, or the mortal and immortal soul, these enhanced feats will dial up the horror in your campaign to a diabolical degree! Open up sinister secrets and skills aplenty in this PDF of 10 new feats from Engulf Horror to Incorporeal Intuition and all feats in between, including truly nasty tricks like Horrific Gorging and Exsanguinate!

209933.name: Haunted House
209933.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation. This instalment provides ten tables designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life a haunted house.

20 Things #7: Haunted House comprises the following 20 Things articles, along with other supplementary material:

10 Things to See in a Burned Out House
10 Things to See in a Plague-Infested House
20 Things to See in an Abandoned House
20 Things to See in a Haunted House
20 (More) Things to See in a Haunted House
20 Treasures to Find in a Haunted House
20 Unfortunate Discoveries to Make in a Haunted House

209934.name: The Magician - New Archetypes
209934.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces three new non-arcane archetypes. Rather, these archetypes focus on the craft of the magician: prestidigitation and legerdemain. There is the Stage Magician for the bard that uses his ability to tell astounding stories while performing amazing feats of misdirection and death defying stunts. The Street Magician for the monk prefers to use his skills of agility and mental acuity to trick even the most vigilant of observers of his close up magic. And then there is the beguiler, taking the craft into the unsavory realm of the rogue. The prestidigitation Perform skill is also defined for use with these unique archetypes.

209935.name: Ghosts in Machines
209935.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Victims of the Demon Lord

Souls bound to mechanical bodies, clockworks are among the strangest of the people living in and around the Empire. Ghosts in Machines builds on the information presented in Shadow of the Demon Lord by providing you with 16 delicious pages packed with information on this popular ancestry. You'll find the secret origins of the ancestry, rules for building clockwork servants, upgrade components, variant marks of darkness, and a detailed look and expansion on clockwork mechanics! Written by Robert J. Schwalb and illustrated by Kim Van Deun, Jack Kaiser, Kevin Adkins, and Bob Schwalb, Ghosts in Machines contains everything you need to play and fit clockworks into your campaigns!

209936.name: Incarnate: The Last of the Lacers
209936.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A blast a fire, a rush of wind, the roar of water, the rumble of stone.

The elements have always been a fantastic space to explore creatively for gamers.
...
This book fills in gaps in the timeline of the Forgotten Realms, showing how lacing magic was created, how it reached its height, and ultimately, how it began to fall, until very few lacers remain.

209937.name: 10 Useful Maps Vol. 3
209937.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

'10 useful maps #03' consists of maps and handouts of various typical fantasy locations.

Each map from the set provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting encounter or one shot adventure for one evening play. Each product in the line consists of notebook for a GM and handouts, which can be printed and presented to players.

209938.description:
The small package contains the "Fate Stones" (aka "Stones Of Fate"), two acrylic stones (black for the Fomori and amber for the Tribes).

During the game (either permanently or at the end of each round), players are able to keep track of the amount of locations occupied by the Fomori and by the Tribes respectively.

For this purpose, the stones are laid next to the Fame Point Track, indicating the respective amount (e.g. if Balor & Fomori occupy 17 locations, the black stone is put next to the number 17 of the Fame Point Track).
209938.name: The Arrival: Fate Stones

209939.name: The Total Party Kill Handbook
209939.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dungeon Masters rejoice and players beware!
...
The Total Party Kill Handbook will help you take your game to the next level of challenge and fun with 25 encounters, built for groups from level 1 to level 20, all designed to be dropped right into your existing campaign with minimal prep.

Every encounter can be scaled up or down to fit groups that are several levels higher or lower, and the tactics scaling sections let you make the monsters smarter or dumber to further tweak the difficulty to match your party. With an index that organizes encounters by level, where they take place, and which monsters appear in them, you can find the next challenge for your group in seconds.

Within you’ll also find the Trap Workshop, a revolutionary trap creation system that will let you build traps that damage, disable, and debilitate adventurers, making your dungeons even more dangerous. If you wish the Dungeon Master's Guide had better rules for creating traps, you won't be disappointed here.

You tell the story, this book provides the numbers.

209940.name: Modulo
209940.description:
Description from the publisher:

With most games, you learn the rules, and then you play. Modulo is not like most games.

As rules get added, replaced and reintroduced, you’ll be tied up in knots as the rules interact, nullify, and combine to outfox you and your friends.

You’ll have to keep your wits about you as you try to get rid of all your cards!

In Modulo each player is dealt a deck consisting of coloured number cards (from 0-9) and action cards. In the most basic form of the game, each player takes it in turn to play the top card of their deck face-up onto a central pile while simultaneously stating the count.
The count starts from 0 each round, and increases in steps of 1 until it reaches 9, after which it starts again from 0.

At any point during a round, if the number on the card on top of the pile matches the count then all players must quickly slam their hands onto the pile.

The last player to slam must pick up all the cards from the pile and add them to the bottom of their decks before starting the next round.

The goal of Modulo is to get rid of your cards. You are hindered in your attempts as more rules are added making the game increasingly complex! If you are the player with the most cards when the 'Game Over' card is revealed then you lose.

209941.name: Mecha Press (Issue 0 - Mar/Apr 1991)
209941.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

March/April 1991

MS Gundam Special
Battles From The Training Field
An Engineering Outlook

209942.name: Mecha Press (Issue 2 - Mar/Apr 1992)
209942.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

March/April 1992

Patlabor Special
Mekton: Closer To Japanimation
Teckno Police 2100 AD

209943.name: Journey to the City of Pearl
209943.description:
News Flash!
City of Pearl Discovered in Barbaric Wilds!

Deep in the Forest of Hurrizan, after following the Dark River to the Heart of Darkness Lake, there is an amazing city of pure white. It seems to be untouched by the world, sitting on an island, surrounded by foetid jungle yet untouched by the decay. It is a beautiful, yet strange place! To read more about this hidden gem, turn to page A2.

Terrible Update!

After many good men have attempted to brave the wilds of the Hurrizan Forest, and the mysterious black lake, none have returned! Will the Empire continue to lose her best sons this way? What is it that keeps attracting, yet killing, so many adventurers? Is the city cursed? Are the jungles too wild? More on this on page A12.

Adventurers Welcome!

It is five years after the City of Pearl has been discovered. During those five years, the natives of the Hurrizan Forest have been busy. Savvy businessmen, they have set up a riverboat which will carry tourists up the river to circle the lake and travel back to Port Lassk. This river tour goes by, but does not stop at, the City of Pearl. Of course, all of you have joined this tour with the purpose of slipping off the riverboat when it nears the city. You long to be the first to successfully discover the secrets the City of Pearl is supposed to hold... if you can survive it!

209944.name: Into the Darkness: Map 3
209944.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

This map-pack features a single cavern/dungeon encounter site (that is suitable for use with most fantasy games and settings).

Included in this product are the following:

A pdf booklet featuring a labelled version of the map.
An unlabelled jpg image of the map (scaled at 100 pixels per grid square - for use with virtual tabletops).
In addition, the map has also been provided as a miniatures scaled battlemap* (i.e. printable at 1" per grid square).


Note that a 'printer friendly' version of this map (i.e. one with a plain white background) has also been provided.

209945.description: Pretending to Grownup is a casual card game for grownups who feel like they're pretending, with gameplay along the lines of Top Trumps in that the cards have different values for time, money, and energy, and players will be comparing these cards to see who wins in a face-to-face competition.
209945.name: Pretending to Grownup
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 73: Tuesday, October 4th

209946.name: MultipliPotion
209946.description:
In Multipli Potion, the goal is to be the first to capture five enemy's monsters! To do this, multiply the numbers on your potions to get as result the value of an enemy's monster.

Dans Multipli Potion, le but est d'être le premier à capturer 5 monstres adverses ! Pour cela, multiplie les nombres inscrits sur tes potions afin d'obtenir le résultat correspondant à la valeur d'un monstre ennemi.

209947.name: Out of the Cocoon
209947.description:
From the introduction:

What will you talk about in Out of the cocoon? You’ll make up the realistic tale of three people who feel uneasy in the real world and look for a comfortable space on the Internet, a space where the void of their loneliness can be filled... but they will soon realize that such a clique is far from perfect; in order to understand whether this effort is worth it, they’ll have to clean up their thoughts in the real world.

User summary:

This game is the Italian-language winner of Game Chef 2016, and also the overall winner of the International Game Chef 2016.

209948.name: Focus
209948.description:
From the introduction:

Focus is a game about problem-solving. Further, it’s a game about how to solve these problems in a creative and unexpected way.

User summary:

This game is the winner of the Portuguese-language Game Chef 2016.

209949.name: Remedy: The Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 73: Tuesday, October 4th
209949.description:
Remedy is a fast-paced card game for 2 to 5 players featuring humorous characters, silly graphics and easy-to-learn rules.

There are 2 decks: the white deck that contains all of the illness cards and the green deck that contains, well, everything else. You'll draw from the green deck. At the start of the game, a card from the white deck will be flipped; this is your illness card. The illness has a number and your goal is to be the first to bring that number to 0.

To do that, you can use cards like “snuggly bed” or “delicious soup” to make the illness weaker and subtract from its number.

You can also use cards like “week old burrito” or “glass of toilet water” to make the illness stronger and add to its number.

In addition to all of that, you can play various action cards like “snot shot” or “disorienting diarrhea” to throw your opponents off and give yourself an advantage.

209950.name: Matching Hearts
209950.description:
From the introduction:

Matching Hearts is a role playing game for 2 players. Each of you alternately plays as one character, Jess or Sam, and as the Game Master. As the GM, you describe the obstacles the character encounters during their run through Neo-Paradize. At the end of each scene, the roles are reversed and the point of view changes from Jess to Sam.

In order to play this game, you will need two character sheets (you actually have Jess’ sheet), a pencil, at least five 6-sided dice and two smartphones/tablets.

User summary:

This game is the French-language winner of Game Chef 2016.

209951.name: Thunder in the East
209951.description:
Description from the publisher:

Frank Chadwick’s ETO (European Theater of Operations) is a series of linked games covering the land campaigns of World War II in Europe using a constant map and unit scale, and common rules.

Thunder in the East is the first game in that series, this one covering the titanic struggle on the Russian Front. This is a two-player game (although teams or even solitaire play would be just fine): one player assumes the role of the Axis (Germany and its allies) and the other player assumes the role of the Soviets (i.e., the Soviet Union).

The individual ground units represent Divisions of 10-15,000 soldiers, Corps (from the Latin word "Corpus," meaning body) of approximately 25-50,000 soldiers, or Armies of approximately 75,000 or more men. The Soviet ground units are mostly armies of approximately 40,000 men each, with a few cavalry and airborne corps of about 10,000 men each.

Air units represent about 200 combat aircraft early in the war, and gradually more as the war progresses. Each hex on the map represents 30 miles of actual terrain from side to side, and each Game Turn represents the passage of 7.5 days (or up to 15 days during inclement weather).

209952.name: Kineticists
209952.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the Psionics Augmented: Occult project, Dreamscarred Press is working to integrate the new psychic magic from Pathfinder RPG: Occult Adventures into the psionics system from Ultimate Psionics and related products. Within the pages of these releases you'll find new feats, archetypes, items, and more, bringing psionic takes on psychic classes, psychic takes on psionic classes, and everything in-between. Psionics Augmented: Kineticists is the latest entry in this project.

Within its pages you'll find:

A guide for how to use psychic magic and psionics alongside each other in the same game
Two new archetypes
A variant for slower-burning kineticists
A new item
New wild talents
New feats

209953.name: AMP: Year Three
209953.description:
From publisher blurb:

The War of 2017 has begun, and brings many things to the AMP universe... Heroes... Loss... even Rebirth. See what happens in the next year of people with powers changing the landscape of what it means to be human.

Includes:

2017 Setting Timeline
11 New AMP Powers
Rules for Resistor Power Suits
Mutation Mechanics
New Character Type: Twice Born

209954.name: Agoraphobia
209954.description:
From the introduction:

This is a game about social isolation and how technology can help us connect in spite of physical and emotional barriers.
...
There are two players in this game. One player is locked in a dark room, alone. This is a person with fear of public spaces that has ended in a comfortable and sad seclusion.

The other player, the free player, is in a public space during the day. This is a person with the ability and intent to help the locked player to get out of their personal prison.

The players speak to each other at distance by an electronic means of their choice.

User summary:

This game is the Spanish-language winner of Game Chef 2016.

209955.description:
Description from the publisher:

...and upon returning to the land of men, the Elders of the High Council made that fateful decision. Go West. West into the wilderness, where wretched Goblins roamed and the Warlock held sway. West, into the blackness of Thil Asara. Their mission was clear. To set a beacon to quell the dark, a beacon that would grow in brightness and strength. A shining light to announce to all the world that they had returned. And that light came to be known as “Anduine - First City in the West.”

In Anduine - First City of the West, a cooperative fantasy board game for 1-5 players, each player will take a role as a member of the Elvish Elder council: Galadhon Master Builder, Nienna the Ranger, General Istaras, Mardiel the Sorceress and Mithrond, Lord of the Elves.
Together they will build a new city, master challenging Events and defend their fledgling home from vicious Goblin Raids.
All while the Warlock lies in wait, plotting to defeat the Elves and destroy the city of Anduine, once and for all.

Negotiation and strategy are paramount, as players will come together to decide how best to use the resources of the Elves to develop and defend their city. Players will research new magic, master new abilities and command the Elves of Anduine to construct a city worthy of legend.
With teamwork, planning and a little luck, the Council of Elders and the Elves of Anduine, will successfully defeat the menacing Warlock and his hordes once and for all.
209955.name: Anduine: First City in the West

209956.name: Island City
209956.description: Νησόπολη ("Nisopoly" or "Island City") is a game similar to Monopoly, with Greek islands in place of streets.

209957.name: Peacekeepers
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 112 - The Solo System
1P 113 - Freedom: The Underground Railroad
209957.description:
Peacekeepers tells the story of 5 factions seeking to bring peace and stability to a war torn nation. Peace must be created without using the factions greatest assets, overwhelming fire-power and military strength.
Imagine advanced western nations with their mech’s striving to keep the peace in a country as it tears itself apart. But imagine being unable to use many of those powerful weapons because your mission is to prevent carnage and civilian causalities. Where the mission to being peace is a harder tactical challenge to your leaders than to invade. Peacekeepers is set a civil war in a mid-European country, 30 years in the future. Where fires of war still darken the night-time skies.

Imagine ingenious insurgents using stolen, scavenged and bolted together machines and monstrous weapons to attack, or welded together parts of western mechs, or black market weapons. While commanders must show restraint and work out who is the enemy or the innocent on the ground. This is the setting of peacekeepers.

Peacekeepers is a 4X inspired game set in a near future world reminiscent of our world. It is a ‘peace em up’ where civilian casualties are the 'countdown' timer in the game and where players can cooperate to protect the populace from events, or compete with each other. Its board game about peace - using giant machines of war.

Peacekeepers thus is a delicate balance of strategy, public relations and maneuvering.
Sometimes not using tactics is harder than using tactics. Sometimes the hardest strategy game of all is to not fight.

209958.name: Funny City
209958.description: Αστειούπολη ("Funny City") plays like Monopoly. As the name implies, all the roads and the cards and even the artwork of the game are funny.

209959.name: Daenyr's Return (5E)
209959.description:
From publisher blurb:

4-6 Characters of Levels 8-9

3,500 years have passed since the vampire Daenyr and his followers terrorized the countryside from his dark temple. His name now myth, his temple in ruins save for a few remaining chambers; no one recalls how or why this came to be. A mysterious cult has taken up residence in the ruins, and rumors of blood rituals and a crimson god are spreading across the countryside, while many disappearances go unanswered.

209960.name: Pleasure Den (5E)
209960.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4-6 Characters of Levels 7-8

Venture into this pleasure den where nymphs await the arrival of your party. You will be well taken care of and become so relaxed you just may drift off to a peaceful slumber.... ZZZZZ

209961.name: The S&P Psionics Net Book
209961.description:
From the introduction:

Psionics are a supernatural force, but, unlike magic, it does not come from the world. It does not come from a deity. It does not come from other planes of existance. It comes from within. Generated by all living creatures, day in, day out, it is a silent force, a power. A power which can be harnessed by those with the Will, by those who know the Way. Come. You know the Way.

209962.name: The Aura of Profit (5E)
209962.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4-6 Characters of Level 1

The Aura of Profit takes place in an underground lair that serves as an alchemical laboratory. Fritz is an alchemist who has an underground laboratory in the poor section of the city. His experiments produce wastes that run into the sewer and enhance the effects of alcohol. Several local innkeepers have seen sales plummet, as their patrons can’t hold their liquor anymore. They think that there is something happening underground, where a strange odor has been detected under one of the taverns. They have asked the PCs to investigate.

209963.name: The Lapis Maiden of Serena Hortum (5E)
209963.description:
From publisher blurb:

For 4-6 Characters of Level 6

The desert settlement of Serena Hortum is located at the heart of an oasis that is surrounded by a vast desert. The only source of water and reprieve from the scorching sun for a hundred miles, the city is a regular stop for those who traverse the surrounding sand buried wasteland. This has brought great wealth and prosperity to the city, but it has also invited corruption that lingers just beneath its immaculate façade.

209964.name: The Complete Guide to Sanity
209964.description:
From the introduction:

Long has it been that man values nothing more than his health, and the health of no organ is more important than that of the brain. What lurks in the minds of men and contorts them into who they?

User summary:

Several text-only versions exist with apparent production dates of about 1996 through about 2000. Most are very minor variations; the PDF version is, essentially, the most complete and final version produced. Most of the document could be easily adapted to any fantasy game system.

209965.name: Bomber Command
209965.description:
This WWII British game bears neither a date nor a publisher, but vivid graphics make its objective clear: fly your planes to the big X over Berlin in the center of the board and drop your bombs! The board is almost square (13.9" x 12.8") and is divided into quadrants with player bases at the corners. There are two "Bomber Stations" at opposite corners and two "Fighter Stations at the other corners, where players start their planes.

The game itself is a spin-and-move affair, with snakes-and-ladders type tracks in each quadrant leading to two shared final approach lanes to Berlin. The bomber and fighter tracks have different hazard and bonus squares. In addition to the bonus and hazard spaces, a plane landing on an occupied space must return to base.

Each player has four planes, and must fly them sequentially to Berlin, needing to spin a 6 for a plane either to take off from base or to return from Berlin.

209966.name: Championship 3 Dimensional Baseball
209966.description:
This is really a baseball card game, but uses a cardboard box insert, folded into a six-sided ballfield with images of cheering crowds in the stands, as justification for the 3D sales hook. Even the player pieces are flat cardboard!

The card game itself is basic: shuffle the deck and turn over the cards one at a time. Each card reveals the results of an at-bat: a hit, a walk, or an out. Players take turns revealing cards, moving runners on the board and scoring accordingly, until their third out; then the other player has his turn. As usual, the player with the most runs after nine innings wins.

While the cards are very plain and printed on thin yellow stock, they provide unusually detailed color commentary: “Third Baseman Makes a Diving One-Handed Catch of Line Drive for an Out”; or “Ground Ball to Shortstop: He Throws High and Pulls First Baseman’s Foot Off of Bag. Batter is Safe.” There are supplementary instructions on each card for what happens to any runners.

209967.name: The AD&D Guide to Trees
209967.description:
From the introduction:

Many varieties of trees common on Earth are also common in the Forgotten Realms. In warmer regions, the date palm, coconut palm, ebony, cypress, and mangrove are common. Evergreens exist in the northern regions, and most hardwoods live in the central forests. Birch and yew are rare in the Realms; alder, boxwood, the plane tree, redwood, and sycamore are unknown. Cork and rubber trees are found only in particular areas in the far South and are disappearing quickly due to heavy harvests. Many recent explorations of the lands of Chult have been undertaken simply to find new suppliers of these woods.)

209968.name: The Vampire and Vampirism Netbook
209968.description:
From the introduction:

The vampire, as we know the species, was originally a creature of myths and legends told over the flickering flames of the campfires, first in primitive hunting camps, then in peasant's hovels and lord's castle. The concept of life-stealing spirits of the night is a universal one. Vampires are predators whose natural prey, humanity is more usually the hunter than the hunted.

209969.name: Caligo
209969.description:
From the back of the book:
Caligo è il secondo Mondo di Fate creato in Italia. Vivrete in un’Italia risorgimentale alternativa, a cavallo tra la realtà storica e la fantasia. Dopo quasi trecento anni, il dominio degli angeli, esseri soprannaturali giunti sulla Terra grazie all’Artefatto di Leonardo Da Vinci, si è sfaldato a causa della Caligine, una nebbia perenne.

English translation:
Caligo is the second Fate World created in Italy. You will live in an alternative italian Risorgimento, between historical reality and fantasy. After nearly three hundred years the domain of the angels, supernatural beings came to Earth thanks to the artifact of Leonardo Da Vinci, has crumbled due to the Caligine, a perennial fog.

209970.name: La Profezia Fulgente
209970.description:
From the publisher website:
Dunqora Le Cronache delle guerre Eterne - La profezia Fulgente - è un modulo avventura che vi spalancherà le porte del fantasy nella sua forma più classica e avvincente. Un'avventura progettata per essere un'introduzione al sistema di Fate e un trampolino di lancio per tuffarsi nel mondo dei giochi di ruolo con facilità.

English translation:
Dunqora The Chronicles of Eternal Wars - The Fulgente prophecy - is an adventure module that will open the gates of fantasy in its most classic and compelling form. An adventure designed to be an introduction to the system of Fate and a springboard to dive into the world of RPGs with ease.

209971.name: Walkthrough
209971.description:
From the publisher website:
Walkthrough, Gioco di Ruolo ispirato alle atmosfere dei JRPG per console

English translation:
Walkthrough, Roleplaying game inspired by the atmospheres of the JRPG for consoles

209972.name: A Night on the Rob
209972.description:
From the introduction:

An adventure suitable for a suicidal thief of about fourth level. An absurdly action packed romp across the tiles. This block of housing and businesses accommodation lies at the corner of thirteenth street, and Main. I would use Liverpool, but you could use anywhere.

User summary:

Originally provided online, the scenario now is available as a ZIP archive including five HTML pages and five JPG files (primarily maps).

209974.name: The Complete Guide to AD&D Technology
209974.description:
From the introduction:

This informative guide is to give a [Dungeon Master] some rules for introducing technology in an AD&D game. The consequences of doing so is not discussed in this guide because it is discussed thoroughly in the articles that are listed in the "Suggested Readings" section.

Since players shouldn't automatically know how a highly technical item works immediately, "Figuring Out Techno-Items" gives a few systems to allow characters to analyze any technical item.

This guide will take you through various new weapons starting with a modified hand crossbow to a laser gun.

209975.name: The Net.Libram of Wild Magic
209975.description:
From the introduction:

This book contains a collection of resource materials for players and dungeon masters playing Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (2nd Edition) with wild magic. All items presented here are written by players who have donated their time and ideas about wild magic. While Wild Magic originated in Forgotten Realms, an attempt has been made to make the material provided here applicable to any game world using AD&D rules.

209976.name: Código Enigma
209976.description:
It's a card game themed on the decryption of the German Enigma machine during the World War II. The game is located on Bletchley Park, a military facility located in Buckinghamshire, England, where the decoding of German codes took place. Each player is an Enigma machine operator and he must code and decode messages before the other players and the Germans soldiers block him. An strategy and concentration game, with a lot of historic content.

Gameplay:
Each player must collect sets of cards with different symbols, retrieving the cards from a common pool, while also blocking the other players from obtaining the cards they need.

209977.description:
Commander’s Log: Nov 5th, 2286
Classified Document: Interstellar Relocation Initiation Strategy

“The business of settling these new planets has turned out to be a difficult one. The clones help do the dangerous labor but the tension between the human and clone populations is only rising. There is also something unsettling about their eyes. The engineers ensure me that their eyes only hold data but when I look into them, I can’t help but see something more sinister….” End Log

In Iris, players will work together to manage human populations and rebellious clone work forces while settling four newly discovered planets. Players have the goal of minimizing clone attacks and maximizing human survival rates. The game has major puzzle and memory mechanics that forces players to rely on one another for both game play decisions and remembering details. Iris takes the tension, collaboration, and challenge of larger cooperative games and puts them into an elegant 20 minute micro game.

In Iris players attempt to organize 16 clone cards in a manner that does not cause the clones to attack human populations. The game has simple rules that are easy to learn yet make for a complex and difficult game. There are three types of clone cards and each type of clone card has a common front. Each clone has a letter on the back of the card that stays hidden until the clones "Data" is scanned. When a clone is scanned this letter is revealed to all players. Players try to organize these clone cards in a way so that at the end of the game the letters on the backs of the cards cannot spell the words "BOMB", "MOB, or "AMMO". Because the only letters on the backs of the clone cards are A, B, M, and O this can be very challenging. Players come across the clone data slowly so there will always be information unknown to players. Players will weigh the odds of playing one clone over another (letter distributions are published on each card) while also risking gaining less knowledge about clones in order to take special actions like moving clones, moving human populations, or learning about un-played clones. The whole game leads up a big reveal. When all 16 clone cards are in their final locations they are all turned over and players see if any attacks occur. When attacks occur, human populations are lost. When all attacks have been accounted for players compare their remaining human population to their survival goal set at the beginning of the game.
209977.name: Iris: A Cooperative Micro Game

209978.name: Unearthed Arcania
209978.description:
From E. Gary Gygax's Introduction:

Some ideas are better than others. When I wished to air a new idea I had for Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (1st Edition), I had the luxury of publishing it in Dragon. Reader input then helped me to assess what was proposed and make such changes as were necessary. That was done with the intent of inserting the new material into the game. Thus Unearthed Arcana was published.

Here you have the forum for presenting your own ideas as to how the fantasy role-playing game in general can be made better in some way. I believe that be the matter a small thing or large, such opportunity, and the realization through publication here, is a tremendous benefit for all concerned. I urge all participants to take advantage of the opportunity presented in all ways. Share your creative thinking, read and utilize such material offered as suits your game environment, and tell other enthusiasts about this netbook. Imagine a readership numbered in the tens or even hundreds of thousands! Quite possible, don’t you think?

209979.name: Wings of Time
209979.description:
From the "Publisher":

Getting into the Living City is hard. Getting out is harder. Some will go to any lengths for a chance to have their wish granted in the City of Djinn...

A Scroll-Keeper and the Djinn bound to her bloodline are racing to escape before anyone notices the epoch map leading to the legendary City of Djinn is missing.

The Undertaker had no choice after her magickal talent was exposed and she couldn't exactly leave without the Corpse she brought back to (sort of) life.

With a monstrous curse looming over him, the Assassin has enough to worry about without getting stuck with the target he refused to kill. Unfortunately, that's exactly what happened.

Now crouched together in a hidden passage beneath a smuggler safehouse with automatons of the Brass Forces banging on the door above, it is only a matter of time before they break in and the search for your hiding place begins.

Getting out of the living city is hard. Surviving the shifting sands, forbidden magicks, exhumed lords, and ancient automatons to find the fabled City of Djinn is harder.

209980.name: NeoExodus Campaign Setting
209980.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The World of Exodus needs heroes...

Exodus boasts a turbulent history—from the rise of the Kaga to the defeat of the First Ones and the events of the Twilight War, from the creation of the Imperial Alliance to the present crisis that threatens to tear the Alliance apart. Great heroes and terrible villains drove this march of time, though even in hindsight the two are not always easy to tell apart. Theirs were the titanic passions, the burning obsessions, and the base treacheries in which modern Exodus was forged and tempered. And once again, the world of Exodus needs heroes…

Inside this book you’ll find all you need to embark on adventures in the exciting setting of NeoExodus:

The history of Exodus, from the reign of the First Ones to the Dominion–Protectorate Wars, from the Twilight War to the creation of the Imperial Alliance.
Details on the nations of Exodus, including the powerful Caneus Empire, the magic-wielding Dominion, the mechanically minded Arman Protectorate, the unifying Imperial Alliance, and many more.
Nine all-new races, usable as PCs or NPCs, including the cavians, psionic rat-men; the cyneans, arcane crystalline humanoids; the dalreans, plantlike humanoids; and the p’tan, feline creatures who can conjure black lightning.
New base classes, archetypes, and prestige classes including the apothecary, high guard, Janissary, peacekeeper, and Protectorate artillerist.
Over 90 new feats including Black Lightning Bolt, Cannibalize, Information Network, Plantsight, Spellbud, Terran Sorcery, and Wyrd Casting.
Over 70 new spells including accelerate magic, blade drone, dead man’s gaze, lunar arsenal, rapid repair, and wall of silence.
Over 60 new mundane and magical items including the alchemist’s bandolier, ball and chain, instant rope, scarab gauntlet, and telescoping staff.
Nearly 20 new monsters and templates including the arcaneslime, draco, necryos, Protectorate golem, and razorfiend.

209981.name: Wizards Mutants Lazer Pistols (Issue 7 - Oct 2016)
209981.description:
Wizards Mutants Lazer Pistols
Issue 7
October 2016

The Fanzine of Old School Weirdness

209982.name: Wizards Mutants Lazer Pistols (Volume 1 Compilation)
209982.description:
Wizards Mutants Lazer Pistols
Volume 1 Compilation
December 2014

Contains Issues 1 - 6 (previously published separately)

209983.name: The Adventurers
209983.description:
From the introduction:

What really happens when a fighter or a wizard decides to become an adventurer? The idea of sneaking around deadly dungeons looking for treasure and fighting horrible monsters that can kill you in ways, nobody should ever get killed – it is actually crazy when you think about, so normally we don't. Except in this game, which is all about crossing the threshold between a relatively normal life in a fantasy world and the life of a hero.

209984.name: Aban Hawkins & The 1000 Spikes
209984.description:
User Summary

Aban Hawkins & The 1000 Spikes is a platform game developed by Nicalis and published on Xbox Live Indie Games.

209985.name: Dwarven Dread (5E)
209985.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Argyle the Betrayer was a powerful Dwarven cave wizard that was corrupted by a Derro Magister named Angree’, and is now quite insane and bent on the destruction of the surface races, most especially Dwarfs. Angree’ has subjugated Argyle using powerful hallucinogens, in addition to a number of Duergar Tyrants, and positioned Argyle as a mad savior to the Duergar. Argyle and his “servant” Angree’, as well as the Duergar, spend most days torturing Dwarfs, or calling on elementals to forge alliances to overthrow the surface dwellers.

Argyle’s complex is found miles below the surface off a well-traveled path in the Underworld. Its walls are covered in a fungus that emits an eerie green glow.

User summary:

For 5th - 6th level characters.

209986.name: Howling Halls (5E)
209986.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The PCs may encounter this minidungeon as part of a larger underground complex, or they may be employed specifically by a local power in order to clear this den of undeath.

This cold stone crypt is unlit (except in the three central chambers), and only creatures with a light source or darkvision can see into its depths ; it is advisable
that the PCs keep moving – prolonged exposure to the numbing cold here will eventually lead to frostbite or hypothermia, unless the PCs are wearing warm clothing, or have access to the appropriate magic.

User summary:

For 7th level characters.

209987.name: The Legacy of Theft (5E)
209987.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The town of Ghezbaldi has stood for millennia. Recent construction work to build a new inn uncovered the entranceway to a long abandoned underground complex. The builders of the inn, Edwyn and Jackson Cairn, took it upon themselves to drop down into the dark hallways of what some say is a long forgotten thieves’ guild and explore. That was 3 days ago, and now the townsfolk are concerned.

User summary:

For 6th - 7th level characters.

209988.name: The Choker Lair (5E)
209988.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The mountain town of Kraga has changed hands many times; strategically important for its location close to rich veins of iron and copper, it was originally a dwarven community who built structures deep into the ground as well as above ground. Periodically attacked and razed by various tribes of orcs, ogres, stone giants and humans, it has been rebuilt at least four times, leaving the deepest and most ancient structures accessible only by the ancient sewers and subterranean water courses.

Now a heavily defended border town providing refuge for many travelers passing through the mountains, as well as purifying much of the ore pulled from the many mines near the town. Recently the town militia have noted a number of missing people who have entered the town but have never left – investigations have led them to the warren of ancient tunnels and sewers under the city, and they will pay handsomely for adventurers to investigate these losses...

User summary:

For 6th level characters.

209989.name: Sanctuary of Exsanguination (5E)
209989.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Many years ago the witch priestess Segolia established a temple in the frontier town of Feluxia. In exchange for healing services to the town, Segolia only demanded the weekly sacrifice of orcs and other raiding humanoids. As the frontier has pushed further away from the town and the area has become more civilized, raids by monstrous type humanoids have become few and far in between. However, Segolia still demands her sacrifices, and some of the townsfolk have begun to disappear. The mayor has hired the PCs to investigate Segolia’s temple as he believes her to be behind the recent disappearances, but is fearful of confronting her himself or sending the town militia for fear of offending her if she is not.

User summary:

For 4th - 5th level characters.

209990.name: Kaltenheim (5E)
209990.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the far frozen lands of the north, word comes south via traders and messengers that a new threat has reared its terrifying head. Reports claim that a heavily built raider, skilled with a huge sword and a fearsome bow, has struck at several nomadic tribes wandering the snowline as they follow the herds of elk. It is said that this raider, dubbed Koloss and accompanied by a huge white wolf, leaves nothing of these tribes but frozen bloodstains in the virgin snow.

User summary:

For 9th level characters.

209991.name: Throne of the Dwellers in Dreams (5E)
209991.description:
Publisher's blurb:

While seeking work the PCs are contacted by an artificer named Vynthis Targain who offers them a job investigating an ancient tomb complex. He is convinced the site contains information pertaining to the location of three relics known as the dream rods. He also believes that these artifacts are hidden somewhere within, but his own research has proven fruitless.

User summary:

For 5th - 6th level characters.

209992.name: Heart of the Sacred Dawn (5E)
209992.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In ages past the realm was plunged into an age of darkness beneath the terrible wrath of Tenebrash, vile lord of dragons. His evil had no mortal equal, and hopeless lament was the only bounty of his subjects. For generations the tyrant ruled unopposed until the Order of the Sacred Dawn challenged his cruelty. By the charge of a powerful and benevolent deity, six holy knights were bestowed with an artifact of tremendous power. Wielding the relic known as the lucespel, the order vanquished Tenebrash and light was returned to the weary world. The knights bound the vengeful spirit of the dragon within their stronghold, and sacrificed their own mortality to eternally guard the artifact from those who would misuse its power. With the return of evil to the realm, a new quest has been called: venture into the ruins of the ancient keep to retrieve the lucespel. Those who seek to harness its holy essence will face the ultimate challenge to prove both their valor and virtue.

User summary:

For 20th level characters.

209993.name: The Burning Tree of Coilltean Grove (5E)
209993.description:
Publisher's blurb:

While travelling deep in the forest the adventurers happen upon a violent feud between two tribes of sprites vying to add a sacred grove to their own territory. While such disputes among the fey are not uncommon, it is rare for these hostilities to escalate into warfare.

Coilltean Grove is tended by a dryad caretaker named Flùràlainn. She has unsuccessfully tried to negotiate a truce between the Briarvine and Thornbranch sprite tribes – even offering to evenly divide her home between them if it would stop the war. When diplomacy failed she resorted to using force to dissuade them from their actions which prompted the sprites to set her most beloved tree ablaze.

User summary:

For 4th level characters.

209997.description:
Description from the publisher:

Beneath the Sands is the third Adventure Pack in the Haradrim cycle for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game.

There's more than Haradrim to fear among the lands of Harad. There are the jungles and the beasts that lair within them. There are the Orcs and Wargs sent by the Dark Lord of Mordor to patrol the region. And there are the deadly expanses of desert, where the sun and dehydration can kill you slowly, provided you're not first captured and eaten by the hidden predators that lie in wait.

In Beneath the Sands, several of Middle-earth's greatest heroes continue their perilous journey through the hostile lands of Harad, only to find evidence of giant spiders that have dragged people under the dunes. Compelled to investigate, your heroes must crawl into the spider's tunnels, only to navigate a scenario that weaves through a labyrinth of cobweb-choked darkness, blocked passages, and deadly spiders. Time is of the essence, as the spiders' victims may yet be alive, but you'll need to be clever and attentive lest you become lost underground.

With scenario-specific rules that allow you to squander your progress when you get off-track, even if you quest successfully, Beneath the Sands places an emphasis upon the game's questing and exploration in a way that truly allows you to feel trapped in a maze. Fortunately, the Adventure Pack also comes with a new Scout hero and twenty-seven player cards (three copies each of nine different cards) to help you get back onto the proper path—or forge your own.
209997.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Beneath the Sands
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

209998.name: A Bandit Ambush
209998.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The trade road is long, and the moors are desolate. A few disparate bandits lurk around the area, waiting for merchant caravans carrying valuables to pass by - but when the adventuring company passes by, they cannot help but wonder what magical treasures they might carry...

User summary:

For 3rd - 5th level characters.

209999.name: The Bridge in the Swamp
209999.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The trade road is long, and the moors are desolate. A few disparate bandits lurk around the area, waiting for merchant caravans carrying valuables to pass by - but when the adventuring company passes by, they cannot help but wonder what magical treasures they might carry...

User summary:

For 3rd - 5th level characters.

210000.name: Watcher in the Night
210000.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It starts as a dream, but rapidly turns into a waking nightmare. With their sleep haunted by terrifying visions, this powerful band of heroes quickly realize that this is no mere trick of the mind; someone - or something - is weakening them to the point of exhaustion, eroding their abilities slowly but surely. It's only a matter of time before the opportunity presents itself - and the unknown assailant strikes in the waking world!

User summary:

For 14th - 16th level characters.
